Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CSHouston80
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at The James Hotel and couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. The James is conveniently located just a block of Michigan Avenue, which makes walking to most destinations a breeze. For the times that a taxi is needed, there was always one right out front. We had a Queen Studio Suite and the extra sitting area was plenty big and made the room feel nice and large. The decor is very clean, modern and highly attractive. We were really pleased with the overall quality of the furnishings as well. Some hotels don't live up to their photos shown on their website and we didn't find that to be the case with The James - what you see is what you get. The view from our room wasn't great, but that's to be expected for most hotel rooms. The free wireless internet access in the room was an added bonus and was definitely a nice feature. All of the hotel staff that we encountered were extremely nice and helpful. We'll definitely be returning to The James next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: RalphieSpeaks
Reviews.Content: Great location and a very attentive staff. Rooms are not spacious but they were very clean. Would return on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lifesci99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James for five nights at the end of February for a conference. First off, this is the only hotel that I've stayed in where housekeeping comes twice a day to freshen up your room; needless to say, the room was very clean and, while not particularly large, perfectly adequate for our needs. There is a complimentary bottle of filtered water on the bedside table that is refilled every day, the staff is friendly and the bed is comfortable, with lovely down comforters. I had asked for a quiet room on a higher floor, away from the elevators and with a view (these are all options when you make your reservation, either online or on the phone) and that is exactly what we received. We were on the tenth floor (room 1014) and we were never bothered by street noise, other than the occasional siren. Right across the street there is a Trader Joe's and a bakery cafe with great food and illy coffee, and absolutely everything you'd need (be it a metro station, a UPS store or Nordstroms) is a short walk away. One little detail about the design of the room - the entrance to the bathroom has a sliding door which really wasn't that easy to open and close (I would get lazy and just keep it open wide enough to just slip through) so it might be an ergonomic issue for the elderly or disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping, dining, sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Love4Life2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James Hotel for 5 nights in March. The location was perfect for shopping, dining, and seeing the sights of Chicago. The staff at the front door were so friendly and helpful. The beds are amazing even if only double beds. They are so comfortable. Small complaint but selection of TV channels is very poor in the rooms. Big bath towels, quality shampoo/body wash, robes, and fresh drinking water in the rooms are great amenities. We gave our car to the valet at checkin and did not use it until we left. So convenient to walk or grab a taxi for where you want to go. Anywhere you go you must be careful and aware of surroundings, but felt really safe walking in the evening in a several block area of this hotel. No great views from this hotel, but who sits in the room to look out the window anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but stole my money”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_HKaty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the James Hotel in the month of February. The hotel was very nice, and I enjoyed my trip a lot. When I got home though I noticed charges on my card when they were only supposed to charge my boyfriend's card. Well they ended up charging both of us. They told me it would take 7 days to refund my money. It is now at least 2 weeks later, and still no money. Whenever I try to call them they basically give me the run around, and are not really helpful. Still waiting for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Stay in the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: TravelFun7
Reviews.Content: Got a special rate on Snique Away for the James-we were not disappointed! It was a fun boutique hotel. There was considerable street noise, but not enough to keep us from sleeping just fine. The room itself was not large, but was furnished in a minimalist/modern style. We loved the Kiehl toiletries that were furnished at the time-not sure if they are still using them. We also found the concierge to be very friendly & helpful for restaurant recommendations. There is a small restaurant nearby (Eleaven) that has great chocolate chip pancakes for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business Travel - No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: giulianova84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the James on business, the hotel my company has been staying at for years whenever business takes them to Chicago. The location is perfect, right downtown. If you like to run, they have a gym and are within close proximity to the water running paths. If you ask the front desk, they'll even give you a free running route map. Breakfast at the restaurant downstairs is awesome, would definitely recommend eating there atleast one morning out of your trip. Rooms were nice size, modern, linens were high quality. Water pressure in showers were great and they also provided nice toiletrie products. Nothing to complain about at all for this hotel. I would stay there if I came back to Chicago for liesure.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of home furnishings mecca, and steps away from all else!”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: Forgetting about the time difference, we arrived exceptionally early (10:30a.m.!) but were graciously received and offfered a room immediately with an upgrade at no extra charge. The staff was attentive and friendly to nearly a fault, and the room was exceptionally clean and well appointed. The concierge got us into a restaurant that was 'fully booked' with a brief notice. The public areas and rooms were quite toasty, and a turn-down service was provided. The gym was well equipped with state-of-the-art hardware and santitized earbuds for the TVs mounted on nearly every piece of equipment.My only caveat to guests is to be careful using the extremely aromatic (pungent?) toilet articles...they seemed to have some astrigent ingredient that caused a somewhat unpleasant burning sensation. Michigan Avenue is closer than it appears on maps (Chicage is fairly compact) and my favorite home furnishing stores (Room & Board, Crate & Barrel, Design Within Reach, and Bloomingdales) are steps away, along with some of Chicago's most iconic heralded restaurants. Enjoy your stay at The James!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ninja1111
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with my stay at the James Hotel. First, the quality of the rooms were exceptional. I love the modern touches and attention to detail. I stayed in a Loft Suite with a media room. I ended up watching the Academy Awards in the media room and it was ideal! I love that they use Intelligent Nutrients for their shampoo, conditioner, etc. I also love that they provide all guests with bottled triple filtered water. Service was excellent. The doorman greeted me by my first name and everyone was friendly, courteous and professional. Their complimentary ride on an Audi Q7 was a treat! I loved that. There are so many "detail" stories to tell--I found something interesting and delightful at every turn. Last but not the least, unbeatable location. The James is likely my "go to" hotel when I go to Chicago from this point forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff, thanks,”
Reviews.Author: Pandacouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in the James for a valentines day/anniversary getaway (2/13/12-2/15/12). Hotel is in a prime location a block from Michigan ave. and across the street from a trader joes store. (fun speciality grocery store with fun foods and cheap wine/beer). Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. When I called the front desk once for a refill of the triple distilled water that they provide in your room for free everyday someone was at my door in minutes. I also really loved the variety of free newspapers downstairs. Only gripe is that the local Bulls game was not on tv in the room. Not sure why they didn't have local channels? Other than that minor complaint everything was amazing, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: allbunk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location -- very convenient to everything but rooms are quiet. We stayed 2 nights in a junior suite (upgraded from regular king room that we booked). Very comfortable beds, good atmosphere and friendly staff, but nothing that stood out enough to make me choose it over other nearby hotels again unless the price is better. Read about the complimentary transportation they offer, but no one ever mentioned it while we were there so we just took cabs when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boutique Hotels Genre”
Reviews.Author: oibarra3
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at this property and really enjoyed my stay. This property is in a great location, walking distance to most destinations. The hotel offers a driver (no extra charge) if your are heading downtown. Comfortable rooms, modern decor friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with a couple service issues”
Reviews.Author: Cleanhotels
Reviews.Content: We found the James through samatha brown and the travel channel. We booked a deluxe king but were given a double studio, so our initial check in wasn't smooth, we had to move. The concierge wasn't extremely helpful with suggestions and when I asked for any coupons she dug up a couple but when I looked closely, they expired in 2010. If you valet, don't leave anything in your car, we waited 45 min for a pair of shoes. We would have gone to the car ourselves but were told we could not. On the positive, book the insider promotion, half rate valet parking and a $50 resturant voucher. The room was older but remodeled, I found the bed very comfortable, very nice bedding. The large bottles of bath amenities ( shampoo, conditioner etc) are in a locked wall caddy. I didn't really want to use used products so I obtained personal size bottles from the cleaning staff. Room service was good, overpriced as with any nicer hotel. The courtesy ride from the James to one of the attractions was a nice bonus. All of the bellman were very friendly and helpful upon checkin and checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: INArchitect
Reviews.Content: The James is a wonderful property, very modern decor with an active bar, but what really makes it shine is its service! From the front desk to the doorman to the cleaning staff, they did a fantastic job! The concierge left a little to be desired (seriously - how can you not know how to navigate the train system when you work in downtown Chicago?) but luckily the others made up for what he lacked. The complimentary ride to the restaurant was the best! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: velezmar
Reviews.Content: We visited las weekend the James, it is a very nice hotel in Chicago. Its location is near the magnificent mile, restaurants, stores and a metro station. The hotel itself is very chic, with nice decorations, ammenities and the a very comfy bed. Maybe the reception could be more attentive, but nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna O
Reviews.Content: Great location for what we had in mind, modern & nice decor, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “City hotel with personal perks!”
Reviews.Author: Peach91279
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled all over the world, and were really impressed with the James. Here is what we loved: *Check out time at 2PM! *Cleanliness was second to none. *Concierge gave superb recommendations *Location, location, location *The hotel has a car that will drop you off at your destination

Reviews.Title: “Good News/Bad News”
Reviews.Author: kirbyfredstpaul
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel largely because of the many good reviews on this site. Our experience was quite mixed, certainly not up to par with what most others have said. We arrived on Friday nite and received very friendly greeting at curb, kind help with bags, etc. Another warm welcome once inside, guiding us to check in desk. So, high points for a warm welcome- this was great! Now, the disappointments: No coffee maker in room, just packets of instant and hot water pot- bummer. No coffee shop in hotel, either. Bummer. To make matters worse, our packets of instant were all 'decaf' - didn't discover any of this til Sat. morn. Called room service Sat am, they sent up some packets; arrived back late Sat. nite. As we entered hotel Sat nite, I asked desk if we'd have coffee paks in our room for Sun am., she said 'yes', but we arrived at our room and, no coffee, and no housekeeping of any kind, either! We were out all day on Sat., they had plenty of time to straighten the room and drop off coffee- Certainly not type of service you'd expect from a 4-5 star hotel. Also, ask for an interior room- ours was on 8th floor, above the street and, even with windows closed, we heard honks, street talk, etc. interspersed all nite long. So, our review is quite mixed. Maybe we were an anomaly- but the hotel was nothing great for us; overall experience here was a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: annieandzoey
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at The James Chicago for a mid-week winter holiday. The concierge and staff were enormously helpful in providing information about restaurants and sights. We loved the twice daily housekeeping service. Location is perfect for exploring Chicago without a car as it's only a block from Michigan Ave and a nice 15 minute walk to Millennium Park and The Art Institute, among other things. Check out is 2:00 pm, an unheard of convenience if you're catching a flight home later in the day. We will stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “One night was not enough”
Reviews.Author: moaksey
Reviews.Content: Me and my other half stayed here for a night before heading back to London. We wanted somewhere downtown which was nice, but which we mainly wanted to use as a base to shop and eat. We found a great rate on travelrepublic which seemed a little too good to be true. We arrived to find the hotel of our dreams (for this type of hotel at least). Staff were incredibly good - professional and friendly. The property itself is obviously very design focused and we did feel rather trendy staying there. The rooms themselves were large and really well designed, with things like floor lamps and designer chairs and other furniture which we would have stolen if we didn't have to fly home! The bed was comfortable. The place was spotlessly clean. The only disappointment was that the bathroom didn't have Kiehls toiletries (as other reviews suggested it did). It did, however, have very eco-friendly, green products which worked just fine. The gym was fantastic. It was one of those gyms you'd pay money to use at home. It had everything you could possibly need. One of the best features of this hotel was the check in-check out times... We automatically had a 2pm checkout time - apparently it's one of the only hotels to offer 24 hour stays... And this is the way it should be! Wifi was free too - which is also how it should be! Location was great too. I go to Chicago a lot - for work and pleasure - and I know I'll stay here again. It was such a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, even better location!”
Reviews.Author: democrazy
Reviews.Content: The James is really a jewel in the Magnificent Mile area. It is a block from Michigan Ave, so it is far enough away from the hustle and bustle that it remains peaceful. Yet, it is a short walk to the best shopping Chicago has to offer. It is also within walking distance to several great restaurants with various cuisines. We didn't eat at the steak house in the hotel, but heard it was good. The sushi place on the other side of Ontario has great sushi and there is a Trader Joe's right across the street as well - convenient! Overall Pros: -Boutique property (small, low-key feel, with a personal touch) -Twice daily housekeeping (turn-down service at night) -Rooms are spacious by Chicago standards (our room even had an alcove with a small sofa) -Friendly staff (doormen are VERY friendly and remember you each time you arrive) -Fantastic fitness facility -Location, location, location Cons: -The only con I could think of (and it is a small one) is that the bathroom door slides on rails. This could cause a privacy issue if you are not intimately comfortable with your travel companion(s). It really didn't bother me or my party that much. Give The James a shot next time you are in Chicago. If you get a good rate, it's a no-brainer!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: StanLee0413
Reviews.Content: The suites are often a great value. Excellent property well located, quality in house restaurant. Check this hotel and often an awesome deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: dna7575
Reviews.Content: The James Hotel is in a great location, just of Michigan Avenue (aka Magnificent Mile). The hotel is very cool and trendy. It has a great lobby bar that was busy every night. And, they provide FREE wifi access. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SymnCwl
Reviews.Content: This is the place! Near everything but not on the main drag. Rooms are spacious, service is excellent and bellman and driver remember us from one stay last year! It is our "go to" Chi-town hotel. Nothing comes close!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The James”
Reviews.Author: cawwac
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at The James. Loved it! Let me just say that the staff are OUTSTANDING...and that is the entire staff. The location is perfect for anything that you want to do downtown. Weather was so nice that we walked down to the Theatre District...nice 15 minute walk. Just steps from Michigan Ave. Lots of restaurants close by. Ate at the hotel restaurant....David Burke's Primehouse for dinner and breakfast. Both times it was great - again the staff at the restaurant were outstanding. When we arrived at the hotel (early) they had a room ready. It had two double beds, but I preferred a King....no problem - they gave me an upgraded room at no cost. Great boutique hotel. This is the first time I stayed at The James - it will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Used a Sniqueway and found a great hotel near Michigan Avenue.”
Reviews.Author: jtn634
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were just going to Chicago for the weekend. We went on Sniqueway and found a great deal for the James hotel. It is a nice, trendy hotel that is walking distance from a lot of Michigan Avenue. The doormen and check-in staff were very friendly and helpful. The room had a great mini bar (although we didn't buy anything because it was a little pricey). It also had fun, unique lighting and a good TV. The glass bottle of water on the table and the James stationary was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Love the James Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Longhini
Reviews.Content: I'm in Chicago a lot for work and I'll certainly stay here when I can. The room was very comfortable (love the feather duvet and pillows), very clean and the fitness center has enough machines that there were no lines. It's in a good location and if you don't want to eat/drink at the James there are plently of other options within walking distance. I was in room 507. I only have 2 small critiques: there's not enough counter space in the bathroom for toiletries and the closet was only 3ft high so long coats/pants/skirts on the hanger were touching the floor. But these minor things wouldn't prevent me from coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alboy1975
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find much fault with the James at all. Check-in was friendly and efficient and all staff I had contact with were very knowledgeable and helpful. Location was superb and it was easy walking distance to many good bars, clubs, restaurants and attractions such as Sears Tower, Hancock Tower. Rooms were surprisingly spacious with ultra comfortable bed and TV was large. I would definitely return and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will go again and again, love The James”
Reviews.Author: closerjean
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at The James downtown Chicago and we love it. After a difficult, slow snowy drive into the City from our suburban home, it's just so nice to pull up and the bellman greet you and make you feel so welcome. Our entire stay both times was very pleasurable. The staff is great from top to bottom. Room is inviting, beds are comfortable, noise level, none, nice amenities in the bathrooms. Highly recommend The James!

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ThurmanMurman
Reviews.Content: The James is a lovely, eco-friendly boutique hotel in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. Service was outstanding and the room was huge in comparison to other boutique hotels nearby. Decor is modern, but not uptight. Very earthy in the heart of the city. The bar is nice and the staff are very friendly and ready to help in every way possible. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of location and value”
Reviews.Author: hkpuipui99
Reviews.Content: The most obvious benefit of staying here is the location. The hotel is one block away from Mag Mile shopping, and 4 blocks away from the Red Line subway station. It's also around the corner from Pizzeria Uno, so need I say more? The hotel is about the same price as most 4 stars hotel in town. But when you factor in the location, and the FREE Wi-Fi, this hotel's value is unbeatable. Also, if you book directly with the hotel, there's a good chance that you will be upgraded to a suite. I also got 20% off dinner at David Burke's Steakhouse, which came out to about 20 dollars for my meal. The hotel has a great gym, a nice bar (seemed popular on Sat), David Burke's Steakhouse in the lobby, but no pool. In the free-upgraded suite, the room has 2 awesome iphone/ipod docks, and 2 flatscreens, which is nice but... a bit unnecessary really haha. Overall this is a great choice for Chicago. I rarely choose to return to the same place, preferring the excitement of somewhere new, but this place definitely earned my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “The James is great.”
Reviews.Author: donstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the James in Chicago. Booked online through Hotels.ca and got a great price. The regular rates were more than double what we paid. The place was clean and comfortable. The front desk people were excellent. We mostly walked all over downtown from this location. We did not rent a car as the trains are close by. Easy to get to Wrigley Field or to Cellular Field. Only a short walk to the Navy Pier. This hotel is one that we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in style”
Reviews.Author: Jattal
Reviews.Content: It is a pleasure to be on a business trip if you stay at the James. Comfortable and stylish room with great amenities, pleasant bathrooms, high speed wi-fi, large screen TV and good restaurant on location. The service is friendly and it is in the heart of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel. Excellent location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: KJandPenny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the James with my boyfriend back in August for a 6 day trip to Chicago. We found a good value on Expedia and based on the positive reviews, we decided to book it. We are very glad we did - the bed was extremely comfy! We also loved the "modernized" look of our room. For our next visit to Chicago this summer, we will definitely stay here again. PS: it is in an extremely convenient location. Near the subway and shopping. Literally right beside the Luxe (wonderful place for lunch).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cyasukot
Reviews.Content: Nice location, very nice staff. Note that I say that they were nice - not the same thing as helpful. When I booked my room, I told them that I wanted to host a reception for 10 people in my room on a saturday, and wanted to arrange for some food and drinks. I wanted to make sure that was okay, and to be put in touch with an events coordinator. "Of course it's okay, this is a 4 star hotel," was the response. Gee, thanks for treating me like a hick and sorry for asking for some details on a hotel I've never stayed at before. The events coordinator told me that no prior arrangement was needed - that there were items on the room service menu meant for parties, so I could just order those on the evening of my party. There aren't any such things on the menu, and when I called room service after I arrived, they were overwhelmed/confused about what I wanted. So, I went across the street to Trader Joes and did it myself - bought food (all cold, of course), cups, utensils, etc. I had rented an "apartment," and it was nice and stylish and there was table space for food and drink and it was a great space for a get together - just wish the hotel could have helped me with my plans. Other negatives: lukewarm water only in the shower, which has no tub, a non - functioning TV, and a chair that was broken (noticed when a guest at my party sat down and almost fell over). This is a nicely styled, well located hotel. I don't think I got my money's worth in service, though.

Reviews.Title: “Really special”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and extra comfortable beds. Great location and very accommodating staff. Housekeeping a bit sloppy in restocking rooms, despite multiple requests. Breakfast at Primehouse excruciatingly slow but delicious. Love the snacks at the bar, albeit accompanied by a poky waitress. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Christee B
Reviews.Content: Very friendly helpful staff. The room was nice- everything was provided for. Stayed here over New Years weekend and though the hotel was full, you would never have known it. None of the staff seemed stressed or uninterested in helping, Drinks in bar were fabulous. The place was spotless and has several pieces of very interesting art. The price was unbelievable for what we received ( a great value)

Reviews.Title: “sensational location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: pomlea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the james whilst on hloiday from Australia.The loaction is perfect for shoppers foodies etc.Michigan avenue in right next door.We received a great rate through hotwire. The rooms are excellent with staff to match. If i ever make it back to Chicago this is the place for us. I will have no hesitation to reccomend this hotel to couples, families and business people who like being treated like family.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional level of service!”
Reviews.Author: MeggieMiller
Reviews.Content: We showed up at 10:45am on Friday before New Year's Eve expecting to drop off our bags and check in later, but they actually had a room available for us right away! The front desk staff members were extremely cordial and accommodating. They seemed genuinely happy to have us in their home. The location of the hotel is perfect - Michigan avenue is less than a block away and you can get nearly anywhere on a cab ride for under $10. By far the most impressive part of our stay was the level of service from the Bellhops. They were always eager to take luggage off our hands promptly, open doors, and hail cabs before we could even ask. They also had a house Audi that they whisked us into a couple times when we were heading to special parties or dinners. After spending a long time getting ready for those events it was nice to not get shoved into a crummy cab! The staff remembered our trips to specific events and restaurants and asked us how they'd gone when they welcomed us back. The professionalism of this team exceeded all expectations and I was very impressed. The rooms were comfortable - a bit smallish, but you'll experience that at generally any city hotel. The shower had good water pressure and was piping hot. The toiletries provided were spa quality and the mini bar was very well stocked. The gym is shoved away into the basement, so it's not exactly the most beautiful gym I've ever seen, but they did have a greater variety of equipment than most hotels. One of the best things about the James is that they won't nickel and dime you for extras like wi-fi and the gym - those amenities are included with your stay. And check-out time is at 2pm, so there's no need to rush out on the last day! I would definitely stay at the James hotel again and would highly recommend it to anyone taking a trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: Katrina R
Reviews.Content: I had an exceptional experience at the James hotel! Staff was pleasant and accomodating. By far one of the best Hotel I've been too. I will absolutely recommend The James to friends, colleagues and family. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here every time I'm in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: erniegirard
Reviews.Content: I had a really great experience at The James. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are a good size, very comfortable. The hotel is in great condition. Great restaurant, great bar. Small gym but has everything you'd need. It's also in a great neighborhood, near lots of restaurants, bars, and shopping. I'm going to try and stay at The James every time I end up back in Chicago, it really is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The James remembers”
Reviews.Author: carlrh
Reviews.Content: I stay at the James once a month or so. Every time I go, the staff remember me, give me an upgrade, and treat me exceptionally well. The rooms are always comfortable and well-appointed. The James is centrally located - easy to go for a run around the lake and close to some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CdnGirlie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the James for our honeymoon and we loved it. The staff (from the front desk, to concierge, bellhops and cleaners) were all awesome. Always friendly, helpful and never pretencious. The hotel is very modern and has a great location. i will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great choice....”
Reviews.Author: TomandHubbs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just stayed at the James and we were incredibly impressed. The staff were all very helpful, kind and friendly. The rooms were beautiful and housekeeping did a great job of cleaning every day and turning down in the evenings.The bar staff were friendly and knowledgeable too! During our stay in Chicago, we ventured in to some of the local hotels e.g. Allerton and Sheraton and although they were both tip-top, we believe that due to its location, amenities and quality of rooms and public areas, the James has to be the winner!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality - service is great!”
Reviews.Author: Bernardo T
Reviews.Content: The location is great and rooms are spacious and clean. The staff working is great and make you feel at home! Been there 3 times and will for sure return. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James”
Reviews.Author: Tainc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while driving cross country with my dogs and my sisters. Loved the hotel. Very friendly staff and very nice rooms and in a great location. Would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, top notch concierge service”
Reviews.Author: Montreal59
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the James ( December 2nd to the 5th) was booked through the hotel's own website, which offered competitive pricing. Upon arrival, we were immediately upgraded to a junior suite. The room was large, modern and clean, with two flat screen TVs, internet, a nice comfortable bed and luxurious sheets. The evening turndown service is a nice touch. On the down side, the hotel elevators are quite small and drawer space in the room is a bit lacking. The reception staff is friendly and efficient, but it was the staff at the concierge desk who really impressed us with their knowledge and helpfulness. The hotel's location near Michigan Avenue shopping and many popular restaurants can't be beat. We will definitely stay at the James on our next Chicago trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, chic room!”
Reviews.Author: becksCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in Chicago and had a marvelous time. I thought the location was perfect, close enough to Michigan Avenue, restaurants, the El... Our room and bathroom were plenty spacious - and my boyfriend is 6'5" so we are wary of space constraints. It had a lovely sitting area and I liked the chic decor. Everything was easy from check-in to check-out. We also enjoyed our room service breakfast and our late night drinks in the bar. The only thing I would have liked was to have 2 bathrobes left for us and 2 cookies at turn-down - but that is only a minute little detail. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to the James!”
Reviews.Author: gdandjo
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay and found the staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms were nice and location is very convenient to shopping on Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Deal”
Reviews.Author: GirlfromKtown
Reviews.Content: We got a room here for $158 through getaroom.com. When we arrived we were bumped up to a suite which was a nice size with a wet bar area, a sitting area with modern couch and chair in front of the flat screen TV and another flat screen in the bedroom area. The whole room was very stylish and modern. At night sweet treat desserts are left on the bed from a local steak house. The complimentary wifi worked well and the staff was helpful. The only cons were: That they have lotion in the bathroom that they clearly don't change out for every guest, it's a large bottle and was practically empty-that seemed gross. Also the heat couldn't be adjusted so throughout the night the air would turn on, the room was hot then cold then hot all night.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VWCalgary
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel for the following reasons: location: easy access to trains and buses therefore easy access to a lot of attractions; walking distance to the Magnificent Mile for great shopping; service: staff are friendly and helpful, and the room is very clean and comfortable. We are in a room with a queen bed, the only thing I complain about is there is only one little drawer, so we are literally living out of our suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hurrysquirrel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Then modern atmosphere was very fresh. The service was great! The restaurant was awesome! My friend raved about her massage at the spa. And it was 50 feet from Michigan avenue. I thought the sheets were a tad scratchy but I am picky. My friend disagreed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Micht123
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in everyone was very nice. We got our package on luxury link so we got great deal. The room was a good size, no real view, but very comfortable bed and a really nice bathroom. Our deal came with a couple of cocktails and the bar was great and the staff was wonderful. We even got an extra drink. The only thing we didn't like was the charge for the parking, but that is every where in Chicago. We would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: inspecting
Reviews.Content: We stay regularly at The James. The service is top notch. As for those who complain in other reviews I am quite surprised since we have never experienced anything negative in the many times staying here. The rooms are clean, the location is perfect and they arrange all things to run like a boutique hotel should. We truly love this hotel. The doormen are knowledgeable and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Meh!”
Reviews.Author: Amelietravels
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the flip, snarky check-in, where the young man mistook us for another couple of guests, unbeknownst to all of us at that time. He gave us an 'upgrade' based on THEIR reservation, which was several grades below what WE had reserved. When we went up to the room, we noticed that it was exactly what we had booked. Not that that was a problem itself, but he had made such a big deal of the upgrade and the promo at the time was 'show the upgrade barcode on your phone for a free upgrade.' When we pointed out that the room was exactly what we had booked and NOT an upgrade, he insisted it was and had I not had a hard copy of the reservation, he still wouldn't have believed us to this day. Then he mumbled something about mixing us up with a different reservation and that 'oh, yes, here's yours. But sorry there are no upgrades available for that room' Not a good beginning, but the Jr Suite was adequate for our needs. There was an odd, hard banquette and a side chair made of paperclips, or so it seemed. The non-view was of exterior walls and other windows in some sort of interior courtyard arrangement. Couldn't even see the sky to see what weather might be happening outside. Location was excellent, as we knew it be, walking distance to restaurants and shopping. I made the mistake of asking the concierge a very routine question, but it just highlighted her lack of knowledge of anything outside her immediate realm of comfort and her reality. Tourists are interested in other things besides just where are the bars? Architecture and tours were beyond her and she couldn't even research on the internet very capably. Luckily, I had done most of my homework before coming, so we didn't need her. Our attempt to have breakfast one morning was met by FINALLY being acknowledged and being led to a long table for about 8. There was just 2 of us. When I asked if we could have a smaller table for 2, she said "why, when you can have all the legroom you want here?" So we went across the street and had great breakfasts for the rest of the week. I gave the James an average, when it seemed so poor, on the merit of their location, the fact that I loved Chicago and that, with a sweep of a magic wand, if most of the present staff would just disappear and be replaced by competent professionals, this place has great potential.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great area of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BarrioTravelers
Reviews.Content: Things were rocky upon arrival and we were told our four "double" rooms were not available. They were holding the "you booked on Hotwire" card against us. Trouble was, I had called earlier in the week and they said they had plenty of rooms and it would be no problem. The day of travel, in the morning, I called again to confirm the rooms and I was told it was in the system and our rooms would be waiting for us. Even with assurances, it appeared we were going to get screwed. Most grown men don't like to share beds, that's why we wanted the doubles. After a bit of debate, the young lady at the desk finally relented. There's a lesson here for everyone... when you call asking for something, get names! Once I started naming the people I had conversations with, they couldn't dispute my argument. Once we got that settled, we got the rooms we wanted. Heck, the young lady actually said we were getting upgraded to larger rooms. They were very nice. King bed on one side of room, with a big Japanese bed on the other, which was quite comfortable. It also had a big couch and living room area. The original dispute not withstanding, it is a very nice room with very nice people working there. Lots of stuff nearby for all tastes and pocket books. Grocery store right across the street too.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, restaurant, and location, though shows its age”
Reviews.Author: wlfmn77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James hotel over a weekend in August and we had a very pleasant stay. The staff was very helpful and attentive and the various meals we had at the restaurant were really very good! Our room was comfortable and I appreciated the clean lines of the decor and that it wasn't overly conceived. The rooms were also very clean and spacious. The two downsides of this hotel were that 1) there are only 2 elevators so you can often be waiting a LONG time for one during the busier times of the day and 2) though the decor is updated, if you look below the surface, the hotel shows signs of its age. Nothing too dramatic, but you can certainly see signs of wear and tear. Overall, though, the hotel is a great option for Chicago and has a central, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, comfortable vibe and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: carerea
Reviews.Content: Very pleased that the James was in the centre of things yet not on the main street. Staff gave very good recomMendations for dining and sightseeing. Rooms were a good size and very clean. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay in city”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: Clean, space, and service!! They have them all!! For this price, here is a nice hotel in the city. Room is clean, and its room space surprises me(if you tried the holiday inn across the street). People here are friendly. Hotel got style too. Bed gives me a nice dream. Location is great!! What else I can say!!

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones minimalistic”
Reviews.Author: Finiky390
Reviews.Content: You always see this one on the "deal" sites, ie., Gilt Jetsetter, Travel Zoo, Spire. I booked this one based on pictures and recommendations from various sites. I also chose this hotel because I believe in great product amenities, Khiel's, Bvlgari, Aveda, Etro. If a hotel puts effort into these small details, as well as, high end linens and down comforters, then they are paying attention to service and customer service too. There was a disconnect here at this hotel. The room was minimalist in every way. The bathroom was so small that only one person can be in there at one time. If you are brushing your teeth, another person can't get past you to get to the shower. We are average sized people. The room felt like a dorm room. I'm the kind of traveller that believes that the hotel is as important as the vacation. If this is not the case for you and the hotel is simply a place to fall asleep then this probably is adequate for you. To be fair, the positive points were: 1) the concierge gave fabulous information and bent over backwards-knew his stuff. 2) the product amenities were high end. Can't remember the brand now but I was impressed, too bad the room was so basic. I recently saw an advertisement for this hotel and the room pictures looked nothing like the room we stayed in. Maybe they were in the process of remodeling when we were there. May '11

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Marci52
Reviews.Content: this was our annual shopping weekend to chicago and this year we stayed at The James Hotel. From the moment we arrived, it was one pleasant experience after another. Our room was big with a great size bathroom and very comfortable beds. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful with a sense of humor. the restaurant at the hotel was very good (get the chicken BLT sandwich - it was terrific) the hotel is located within walking distance of all the major shopping and great restaurants. the River Walk is close by and the boat rides up the river are only $26 and looked to be a lot of fun (we ran out of time but it is on my 'agenda' for next year) the only reason I am not rating this hotel as "excellent" is because the beds, while comfortable, were small and the only mirror is in the bathroom. When more than 2 women are in a room at one time you need more than 1 mirror!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birkby2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago for a five day stay at this wonderful hotel. Beautiful room, very friendly staff and Bill the concierge arranged tickets for us to see the Chicago Bears at Soldier field and booked us into a fabulous mexican restaurant. The location is perfect and we cannot fault the hotel at all. On our next trip to Chicago this is definitely the hotel we will head for.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: nevans26
Reviews.Content: 5 stars!!! James is in a perfect location only 1 block from Millennium Mile and totally walking distance to everything in Downtown Chicago. I found a really good deal on one of the opaque travel booking sites, which ended up being a phenomenal value for this upscale hotel. The David Burke restaurant is amazing â€“ they had a great deal for lunch Monday-Friday for $15 you get a steak (I had filet mignon), a vodka or gin martini, and a side dish (we had truffle fries and basil whipped potatoes). My girlfriend and I went there for a Friday late lunch and were so happy with the whole experience. However if youâ€™re staying at the hotel, you can enjoy the DB restaurant 24 hours a day with room service. The bathroom amenities were all sulfate-free, organic, and smelled really good. The nightly turn-down service, bathrobe, and little cookie/treat on your pillow was such a nice touch to come home to after a night out on the town. I also really liked the little sitting area in the corner of the room. Oh, and the triple distilled water refilled twice daily was awesome. Finally, the last amazing perk is that the hotel is across the street from a Trader Joes so you can buy a bottle of wine, juice/water, or snacks and save money if youâ€™re the type of person that may dip into the mini bar. I will definitely return to the James!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: susief18
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meeting in Chicago. When he asked me to join him we decided to look for an exceptional boutique hotel. The James is a great location...just two short blocks off of Michigan. The staff was attentive to our every need. The concierge were wonderful. The gym was great. Before seeing it I was sure that I would get day passes to a local fitness facility, however once I saw the gym with the weight equipment and no lines there was no way I was leaving the hotel for a fitness facility. We had a lovely suite on the 17th floor (top floor of the hotel). Unfortunately, we didn't have a view at all. We faced the rooms on the other side of the courtyard. Very disappointing. Also, the layout of the suite was really funky....a little couch, table aligned right in front of a large frlat scree tv. Much better off watching a tv of this size from the bed, which we did since we had a tv by the bed as well. The David Burke steakhouse which was where we ate breakfast certainly did not live up to its name. It was so disappointing. In fact, the egg white omelet as well as the eggs that my husband ordered were inedible. They tasted like oil. It got to the point on the last day that I finally sent them back and ordered what was supposed to be steel cut oatmeal, which unfortunately was watered down and cold.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CazBumBaz
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the James on the 30th Sept. I was visiting family in Chicago and since this was my first trip to the USA, I must say , I was blown away. The staff were so attentive, nothing was too much trouble for them, especially the chappy on the door. When we got our room, it was beautiful, clean, fresh. Great View!! Bathroom was outstanding.. Cant rate this hotel any higher! Will be returning next year, definately!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed at the James over most recent labor day weekend, and I was disappointed. The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful, except for giving us grief for wanting separate receipts upon checkout. But our room was cramped and the air conditioning couldn't keep up with the heat (admittedly, it was a hot weekend). An engineer came to service the air conditioner, but couldn't really resolve the problem. The fitness center is nice, but not nearly as nice as the ones at the Chicago Hilton or the Trump. We paid as much at the James as I've paid at any Chicago hotel (including a $399 Saturday night), but I don't think it belongs in the top tier based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: 7ericcantona
Reviews.Content: The James is in an ideal location for a first time visitor to Chicago, being only five minutes' walk from the Magnificent Mile and close to the L stop. The hotel is well decorated and has one of the largest and most well equipped hotel gyms I've seen. Our room, a studio, was enormous. Two huge flat screen tellys, comfortable sofa and bed and large bathroom. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and there is the added bonus of a late checkout (2pm) as standard. If you're looking for a city centre hotel Chicago, I doubt you could do any better than The James. I wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: Native_Chicagoan11
Reviews.Content: I would stay at this hotel based on the caliber of their service alone. I had purchased a stay for my best friend's wedding night off a third-party site. Not only did they not treat me like I was third-rate (which most places do in my opinion), they were amazingly sweet and accommodating. They went out of their way to make sure my best friend's evening was special. The service, care, and attention I received is some of the best I've ever had. A special thanks to Krista in the concierge department for making me look good! Needless to say, my friends had a magical night.

Reviews.Title: “gem off michigan ave”
Reviews.Author: flizzer
Reviews.Content: amazing little hotel with no problems whatever!! my first experience w priceline & if this is an example...wow....got an upgrade to a deluxe king at ck in...great view of the neighborhood....good sized room with a cozy bed...comfy chair...window seat and a little niche seat for drinking coffee & reading the paper.... no elevator problems as is often the case in boutique hotels...great bathroom....and TURN DOWN...don't get that much anymore...and it included a full ice bucket....nice touch to come home too after a night in the city!! love love this place and the service and I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “bad service, dishonest receptionist”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller038
Reviews.Content: The hotel definitely doesn't match its 4.5 rating. The receptionist was very unhelpful and dishonest, and I don't feel welcome at all. I booked a non-smoking room, but upon arrival, the receptionist told me that there was no non-smoking room left. Of course he was lying. I argued with him for 5 minutes, before he reluctantly gave me a non-smoking room. At checkout, they tried to charge me $40 upgrade fee each day, because I requested a non-smoking room. This was completely ridiculous. I had to go argue with the receptionist again before they agreed to take away the charges. The room was quite small, the TV was broken, so I had to call someone to fix the TV. Then the wireless network banned my IP address, so I had to talk to their tech-support -- the tech support was quite friendly, knowledgeable and helpful -- I guess this was the only bright point of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Goweje
Reviews.Content: Positives: Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was well laid out and had high quality bedding. The bathroom door was sliding and very heavy, making it difficult to close. The bar area is welcoming and lively. Great location. Negatives: Hotel parking is $48 a day. We parked in a garage several blocks away and still paid $23. Factor this into the cost of this hotel. Bath products were awful. Felt like Vick's Vaporub. The 60's style modern furniture might be a bit much for some.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the James, loved the location”
Reviews.Author: wondermomToronto
Reviews.Content: The James Hotel is situated in the heart of the Magnificant Mile. Everything you would want is in walking distance. The hotel is small in size, with a fresh and hip lobby. Staff was friendly and welcoming and check in was quick and efficient. The room were given was as requested away from elevators or any other potential noise factors. The room was with 2 double beds and was quite large. The room was stylish in a contemporary feel, clean and fresh look. Beds were super comfortable, nice linens and lots of pillows. Bathroom was nice a bit of a refurbished type, older bath tubs with newer surroundings. Didn't love that the only closet and full length mirror or for that matter the only mirror other than the one over the sink is in this little dressing area off the bathroom. Let me explain, there is a pocket sliding door from the bedroom that when you open it you step into this tiny dressing area that has the closet and full length mirror and then to the left is the sink, toilette and tub/shower. This prevents possibly two people from being able to one use the bathroom and two get dressed at the same time. Liked the complemetary water bottle that was refilled daily. The room had good lighting, amazing large window, the full width of the room. No real drawer space if you were staying for any length of time and wanted to unpack. But did have a large bench under the window which was great for putting your suitcases out on. Did have complementary coffee and tea in the room, with mini bar fridge stocked. Very nice to have turndown service every evening with a sweet treat left by your bed. Did not use any amenities from the hotel, but can tell you that there is a Starbucks across the road and tons of restaurants and shopping all with in a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite - Chic, Clean, Hip and Urbane”
Reviews.Author: betsyscott
Reviews.Content: The James is an amazing hotel. I didn't really need to read the reviews before staying because I was pretty sold already on the website on marketing! But as soon as we got to our room, we immediately felt like royalty. The modern decor was welcoming and our hug COMFY! bed on an elevated space all it's own was impressive. Everything about our stay was great - and James Burke's Primehouse is my favorite brunch in the city...just an elevator down from our room. Thanks James! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dribbs
Reviews.Content: I'd read lots of reviews about this hotel before booking it and we were not let down. A very stylish hotel that backs up it's looks with excellent service. We picked a very busy weekend to arrive, but the front desk service was excellent and very welcoming after a long flight and a long wait at the airport. The room (a studio) was perfect, just the right size with lovely clean and plain fittings and a really good bathroon (with fantastic products).The bed though, wow, so comfy. We didn't eat in-house but the bar was excellent, very high standard of service and a good drink selection. The only reason we didn't eat in-house was that within a short walk you are spoiled for choice of great places to eat. The location couldn't be better, so many places within walking distance and so much to see so close by. Without a doubt if we ever get to visit Chicago again I wouldn't think twice about staying here , we only stayed for 5 nights but it felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “another wonderful stay at the James”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte S
Reviews.Content: Once again, the James comes through as my favorite Chicago hotel. The staff is the main thing that differentiates it from other hotels that may be similar. The rooms are so amazingly well thought out and comfortable and the bathrooms are the same. There is nothing not to like from the stylish lobby bar that is great for people watching and a drink to the well-equiped gym. I think it is a great value for this location and very convenient in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Staying At the James”
Reviews.Author: travel4now
Reviews.Content: From the minute we pulled up the service was great. The room was chic and contemporary and the location perfect. The only issue I had with the hotel was exterior construction and road noise. I have stayed at other Chicago hotels that had better sound proofing than The James. I found it impossible to get a full night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “touchs of class in great boutique hotel in the heart of the city~”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: first of all i will like you guys to know that i find that i am liking small boutique hotels more then the huge hotels. i just do! having saying that i will top my review with great people who work for the hotel with many touches. the room is great one point that i didn't like is the fact that the bathroom has sliding door which is not really sealed and there is no double door to the toilet ...you are getting my point? smiling. the bed had great bedding crisp white with touches of browns. the modern touch's were met with old wood. fun lounger seat and corner office in the room with free wifi! yep free for my i phone i pad and laptop and my husband laptop too. bottles of fresh drinking water were filled daily. the bill come with brown envelope with touch of class~ we will come back i have not one word to say about the hotel just make small umbrellas with your logo and sell them we will buy them as when its rain we will buy anything and you get some free advertising. i will not charge for the marketing tip...smiling loved your hotel thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room!”
Reviews.Author: DLBroyles
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, great service. Lobby bar and meeting room were great for our wirk meeting-

Reviews.Title: “night trip”
Reviews.Author: sophie s
Reviews.Content: having stayed in numerous hotels in chicago, this might just be my favorite. across the street is a trader joes for munchies vino and h20. all downtown shopping footsteps away. the room was modern and clean. we ate at david burkes steakhouse located in the hotel and the meal was wonderful. will defiantly make this my go to for all future road trips to chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: bird1010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The James and will continue to stay there. Room Service is great. Toiletries are the best. The vibe is similar to that of Chicago, upbeat and unpretentious. Trader Joe's across the street for vino and extra water. I love having a nightcap in the bar or starting the night there.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: gostanford19
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came to Chicago for a girls weekend and had the most amazing experience at the James. We are both very well traveled and have probably stayed in over 1000 hotels between the two of us. We both thought the James was outstanding in every way. The location was great--near to everything. Our room was large and well-appointed. The housekeeping service was wonderful. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and elegant. We used the free bicycles to ride along the Lake one day, which was so exhilarating. The very best part of the stay was stepping outside to grab a taxi to dinner and having the hotel chauffeur Reuben say "I wlll take you ladies wherever you need to go" at no charge. FANTASTIC! I will always choose to stay the The James whenever I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, excellent housekeeping.”
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights, concierge was excellent in having wine orders upon arrival. Housekeeping was wonderful (remember a tip each day helps). Service a bit slow in the lobby lounge. Plenty of outlets to recharge batteries. Rooms seem a little sparse, could have used another chair. Bed was comfortable. Tub would not drain on the first day. Coffee delivered promptly each morning on request. 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: derbius
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James in Early October. You can't beat the location. It's within walking distance of anything in the loop and River North areas. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever stayed at. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but Misses the Mark”
Reviews.Author: NoAxToGrind
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m surprised by the number of good reviews for the James Hotel in Chicago. The hotel does have some stylish attributes but when you put it all together, the hotel is a disappointment. Maybe the good reviews come because the James is a good bargain; I donâ€™t knowâ€¦I didnâ€™t comparison shop. Here are just a few things for the traveler to consider: The bathroom is small. It has a sink, a toilet and a tub shower. Hardly room for anything else. The sink has an extraordinarily small bowl. Itâ€™s shallow enough so that filling a cup or putting a toothbrush under the faucet calls your attention to it. And why the portal door to the bathroom? Yes, itâ€™s frosted but at night when you turn on the light you risk waking your mate because of the light that comes through. No hook on the bathroom door. Thereâ€™s a hook somewhere in the bathroom but only one and if it were over the portal, you could at least block some of the light. The shower has large jars of lotions/shampoos/etc. Maybe thatâ€™s a good earth friendly feature but a bad idea. And, the body wash â€œinvigoratingâ€� as it was billed to be, caused some minor irritation. Like many stylish hotels, the James had a high tech alarm clock. Darned if I could figure it out to dim its light (a towel covering worked). There is no coffee station in the lobby although you can ask for coffee in the restaurant (it wasn't good). Perhaps this is not a big deal; thereâ€™s a Starbuckâ€™s just across the street. The hotel says it has a spa and there are signs from the lobby to the spa. Spa? Yes, there are massage tables/rooms. But no steam. No sauna. However, there is a gym. The hotel does have some good features. Thereâ€™s the location: Excellent. The small desk/niche is a good idea. Plenty of plugs for powering iPods/iPads/Kindles/cellphones/laptops. Service is fine; towels are plentiful and huge.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie46
Reviews.Content: Room OK, nice and clean but spoilt by the sliding door into the bathroom which was extremely difficult to move and actually came off the sliders on more than one occasion. We also didn't like the location of the wardrobes which were in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Modern design, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a relaxed feel but modern design - and seldom do you get both together. The staff is friendly and accomodating. Free internet usually means slow internet, but mine worked great and I worked it pretty hard. The bench/desk is a little funky but I liked it...only complaint is that the speakerphone is near the bed, not the desk. Great clock with big LCD panel on the bedstand. Bathroom is okay, but I prefer dedicated showers over bathtubs with showers...still not bad. Room service was pretty good - not great. A few stains here and there but generally things felt clean and new.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: megs_in_to
Reviews.Content: Travel dates: Sep 24-27, 2011. The location is absolutely fantastic and for a boutique hotel, it is good and the staff are very friendly and courteous. I was a little disappointed for the following reasons: 1. We were upgraded to a king corner suite from a king premium room (yay James Hotel - thank you!), but it was on the 4th floor and our view was of the inner courtyard facing a rooftop and other hotel rooms. 2. Acoustics: we could hear people walking up and down the fire exit stairway. We heard the plumbing pipes everytime somebody flushed the toilet. We heard the other rooms door close each and every time. The fan/air conditioner was extremely loud (another reviewer had the same comment) 3. Room was booked for 2 adults; got 1 bath robe. Had to ask twice to get the 2nd one the first night. 4. The "little" things that annoyed us: total of 6 hangers in the closet for 2 adults. Bathroom had no hooks to hang up robes, towels, cosmetic bags, etc., just 1 towel bar that held 1 bath towel near the bath tub. Bar on ground level was smaller than expected. We LOVED: 1. Location, location, location 2. Free WI-FI 3. The health club facilities - best ever for a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “wanted it to be better than it was - location is awesome though”
Reviews.Author: eat_drink_and_sleep
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the year that it opened and LOVED it. I recently returned and was less than impressed. It is thoroughly worn - with makeup stains on the robes, worn through rugs, a work out facility that is dirty and has seen better days. The location is well worth the stay - but I just wanted this hotel to be better than it was. The final straw was that the valet's were too busy talking to each other to hail me a cab in rush hour traffic ... arrgh!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location; flair comes with downsides.”
Reviews.Author: davcosLondon
Reviews.Content: A very special hotel with excellent facilities in a great location. It has a small but stylish reception and bar area and an excellent restaurant. And the service is outstanding â€“ friendly but unobtrusive. They gave me a room at 10am with no complaint or surcharge. WiFi is free. However, my designer open-plan room had some quirks: a built-in hill (the bathroom floor was an inch higher than the bedroom); a noisy A/C (77dB, noisier than the cabin of a jetliner); no plug for the basin (makes washing smalls tricky); strange dimmer switches, some of which don't seem to do anything; a low-set clothes hanging rail such that trousers could not hang free; no chair or desk (instead there is a round table and a comfy, but fixed bench); large TV that is stuck on wide-screen so that everyone has Pinocchio noses; bed base with sharp corners that are easy to bump into. Not sure I expected that for USD 400+.

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutly amazing in every way”
Reviews.Author: poterajko
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and got upgraded to a suite overlooking Magnificent Mile. The suite was very luxurious and we didn't want to leave. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend and stay here again. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “My Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariettaKen
Reviews.Content: I can't make enough positive comments about the James Hotel. It's an upscale hotel in a great location. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. But there's more. This hotel separates itself from the others in two ways: 1. They don't 'nickel and dime you' to death. Everything's included in the price, even the internet. 2. The staff is incredibly personable. While the hotel is upscale, it's not snooty. Everyone is so nice. All the staff talks to you. I'm not one who stays at the Ritz because they have great service, but lack personality. The James isn't like that. They combine quality with amazing, personable service. Stay at this hotel. And tell the front desk staff that Ken sent you... ;)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EtotheZ
Reviews.Content: The James is situated in a great location; just blocks North of the Chicago River and West of Lake Michigan and two blocks from the famous Miracle Mile shopping district. The room is nice, clean and they go the extra mile to make sure their guests are comfortable. The James provides free bicycles to explore the area. If you aren't comfortable and experienced riding in traffic, however, skip the bike, or it might be the last bike ride you take. They are friendly people, but traffic can be heavy and fast-moving. While not huge, the room was certainly is big enough for my solo stay. While all the other hotels in the area were going for $250/night, I was able to get a $170 (+taxes) rate. Quite a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_RN_AR
Reviews.Content: I finally came across this hotel after several trips to Chicago. The rooms are a bit on the small side but all in all I really enjoy staying at this hotel. It is located near all the good stuff on the MM and the subway/"El" and has a very nice spa and comfortable beds. A good value in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Would go again tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: Toada1
Reviews.Content: Convenient, trendy, clean, boutique hotel. We stayed four days and loved it. The gym had plenty of equipment in great condition. Iced lemon water and towels for after your workout. They have a spa but I didn't have time to try the services. Rooms were nice. Full bar with snacks etc if you wanted the mini bar. Also small refrigerator. Coffee and teas provided in room with bottled water in a "green" carafe that is refilled daily to avoid plastic waste. Turn down service at night with robes and slippers was a nice touch. Several daily papers in the AM to choose from. We were also given great restaurant tips and directions to attractions from the concierge. In all, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: dcall90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The James with 5 other people for the Chicago half marathon and had a great time! The hotel is an older building but has been refurbished and they did a great job. There are still things about the building, like small elevators, that remind you of the hotel's age but everything else is stylish and comfortable. The beds are very soft, pillow-top beds, bathroom was stylish, clean and stocked with great toiletries, the bar in the room was amazing and the bar in the hotel served great drinks. The thing that really stood out about the hotel was the service from the staff. From the second we pulled up to the moment we left they were spot on. They were speedy with bag delivery, filled our cooler with ice, made countless reservations for us, were always friendly and helpful and seemed genuinely glad that we were there. Also, the location of the James is perfect for a Chicago stay. Close to everything, very central to both the south and north ends of the city. Short cab rides to anything.

Reviews.Title: “great price for this location”
Reviews.Author: Hermoinevancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights at the end of August/first of September. It is a newer hotel within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and restaurants. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with two double beds. The rooms are small and the bathroom is tight on space as there is no counter space and had a sliding door to the bathroom which got stuck a few times when someone was in the bathroom. We did have some trouble with our entry cards and had to get it reset a number of times. Staff is fairly attentive, but everything is tight, the gym is small as well. Our main purpose of the visit was to shop and see some of the local sights, which this hotel is perfect for- we were able to walk to many places to eat ,shop and sightsee! Even though you are right downtown, we did not find it noisy and slept very comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang-for-the-buck in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: dalohr
Reviews.Content: Was in town with a buddy during Labor Day week to catch a White Sox/Indians game at U.S. Cellular Field. Came across multiple write-ups on The James in various guidebooks (Fodor's, Forbes/Mobil, Unofficial Guide, etc. + TripAdvisor), that, in general, seemed overwhelmingly positive. After also discovering that the hotel had a decent summer promotion rate available when we were going to be in Chicago, I booked four nights at The James. Wise move. The hotel is centrally located to every possible tourist destination worth walking to and only 4 blocks to an "L" station to take you to even more. The hotel also puts you in the midst of the restaurants and stores of N. Michigan Ave. and the bars/restaurants/galleries of River North. Our room was larger-than-expected (all we had to do was ask for it) and was kept spotlessly clean throughout our stay. Beds were exceptionally comfortable. Only minor grumble was the fact that we had to make due with the same small bar of soap in our bathroom (couldn't housekeeping see that it was melting down to a sliver and place a back-up bar on the sink counter?). The James has done away with Kiehl's in-room products (darn!) and has instead gone with eco-friendly large pump-dispenser bottles of shampoo, conditioner, & body wash that stay in the shower. A selection of almost-full-size bottles of booze were provided in the room's minibar, and a bucket of ice was left in the room every afternoon. Bathrobes & slippers were also provided. Didn't partake in the hotel's restaurant, spa, or gym, but the small bar was lively every night and decent drinks were served by a friendly bar staff. A selection of complimentary daily newspapers was available at the hotel's front desk each morning. Both check-in & check-out were a breeze. All-in-all, The James is a hip, friendly, non-complicated, well-located hotel that is well worth looking into, particularly if you are able to snag a promotional rate. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James for four nights and loved it. The hotel was modern and was in a great location. The room was large and well equipped, massive bed, large TV and had nice touches through out. Our room overlooked the city as we were on the 15th floor with an amazing view. The customer service was good, concierge helpful and always on hand. We went to the hotel bar every evening before we went out and the only negative point for the whole of the hotel was the cold temperature of this area. It was so chilli that we sat there with our jackets/cardigans on which meant we often only stayed for one drink. Chicago is a great place and we loved the city buzz. We would definitely stay at the James again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - below expectations”
Reviews.Author: sebovoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The James for 2 nights. I was looking for a smaller design/ boutique hotel as I wanted to avoid the standard choices like Hilton etc. Hence, I ended up in The James which made a good impression from the website and the reviews. However, it was a very big disappointment. The overall impression of the hotel is that it's already a bit "worn down" and needs a make-over. Despite having booked a kingsize room including a confirmation from the hotel, I was put in a double twin room. Apology of the hotel was very standard and they didn't offer me anything to make up for it despite an upgrade to a room at an additional rate of more than 250 USD a night. Up in the room I was shocked from the poor design and the general layout of the room. It wasn't up to design hotel standards at all and I was rather disappointed. However, this might be rather a matter of personal taste. The broken window, the broken a/c, the loud noise from the street despite being in 11th floor and the dirt on the flow however aren't a question of personal taste. This was just unacceptable. I complained immediately at reception, however, they couldn't offer me an alternative room. An engineer came to fix the a/c. He didn't really succeed. It was extremely loud when switched on, has only one fan speed and when you switched it off it got hot in the room very quickly (although outside temperatures were in the low 60s). Moreover, the street noise was very loud and you could hear the traffic during day and night. Furthermore the walls of the room rather reminded me of a cheap youth hostel instead if an upscale hotel. You could clearly hear when the people on the neighboring room were watching TV or just closing the curtains. The maids on the floor also were very noisy and you could hear them talk from 7am in the morning. Doors and walls are just very thin and just seem to serve as a visual and not voice protection. In general the staff was rather arrogant and not very helpful. Having travelled the whole world and having stayed in countless 4 and 5 star hotels, this experience was one of the more disappointing ones. Clearly no recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfection (5 nights, awesomeness)”
Reviews.Author: thornhill_waterloo
Reviews.Content: Long story short...the James Chicago was probably my first ever stay at a luxury hotel and it was great! Near perfect. It contributed positively to my wonderful vacation to Chicago. Now the story...I stayed at the James Chicago for 5 nights, Aug 25 - 31, 2011 with my girlfriend. We booked a one king bed suite and just walking into the room was enough to make my day. The bed sheets were folded in an esthetically-pleasing way and the bed was so comfy. There was a small bench in a small cutout in the wall with a desk, a nice feature if you want to read a book or use a laptop. The washroom and closet were combined and separated from the rest of the room with a sliding door, better than and not as boring as your ordinary washroom door. Curtains did a good job blocking out the sun when we slept in on a morning. The hotel gives you a complimentary bottle of purified water on the night table along with two glasses. I enjoyed this civilized practice, better than drinking from the tap. Of course...in suite bar and snacks are in the drawer at extra price. There is free wifi in the room and free boarding pass printing (all other printing at a cost). All staff were very nice and courteous to us. There were at least two receptionists at all time, bellmen, a concierge and even floating employees (not bellmen) who were there to assist with anything from holding the door to helping store luggage. I felt like a king when one employee opened the door of our taxi back to the hotel and another opened the door into the hotel. My girlfriend and I were out and about a lot so we didn't have a chance to use the amenities. However, I did go downstairs to check out the fitness centre and it had an abundance of weight machines that any gym macho would feel satisfied with. There was a bar in the main floor that formal guests seemed to enjoy drinking at (even in the lobby), attached to a steakhouse. Overall, it was a great stay and I am sure anyone who can afford this will consider this money well spent. Regardless, this was a near perfect stay, but not perfect. The only knock I give this is that the bellmen seem a little too pushy when it comes to assisting with luggage handling. When we wanted to get a taxi to the airport, the bellman pretty much snatched the luggage out of my hands, called the taxi and loaded the luggage himself, all actions that a young man like me could do on my own. I tipped knowing that it was standard to do so, but they bellman should back off a little bit because not all guests wish for their services.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in chicago. excellent decor, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: loungedog
