Reviews.Content: The James is ideally located just a block off Michigan Avenue near Water Tower. Walking distance to great restaurants, great shopping and museums. Decor is modern and hip, and very comfortable. The rooms are modern and comfortable as well. The best thing about the hotel is the service. The staff really go out of their way to make sure your every need is met. I have stayed at the James a few times. This time, I was traveling with a young child, and he was made to feel very welcome. They gave him a Paul Frank children's book, some pajamas, and had a wii available to borrow. The only drawback was some street noise, but that is to be expected in downtown Chicago. I did not hear any noise from the hallways or adjacent rooms, and the hotel was booked solid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! The beds are Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Smoresgalore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James over Labor day weekend as our last hurrah before school started..It was FANTASTIC! First impressions are everything and they hit the nail on the head.. The exterior is very clean and the doorman was very responsive, the interior was tip top and very inviting, the front desk personnel were friendly courteous and professional.. When i booked our reservation online it gave me an option to upgrade our room if possible at check-in ( I highly recommend that option) When we arrived at our room it was awesome.! It was modern clean and very spacious. we had the loft king and for 2 adults and a 7 year old it was perfect for 4 days... It was a very cool room, my son rented movies (for free) in the hotel lobby and watched it in his nook on the wall which was projected from a movie player, he liked that a lot.. The beds are sooo comfortable my husband said he had the best sleep he's had in years, The only negative is that the air conditioner was a smidge noisy.. I don't use an air conditioner at home so maybe it was just me. All in all our stay was perfect... The James is located perfectly so we used the trains and bus system ( we bought the 3 day CTA pass) Stay here if you can you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: volyawithkevin
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Everything within walking distance. Friendly staff. Nice workout facility and spa. Enjoyed my stay very much

Reviews.Title: “Some issues which would not have expected given reviews”
Reviews.Author: travels40
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 Nights. Some staff are excellant and could not do enough others are only OK and don't care. We checked in after a late arrival and they advised they had upgraded us toa studio. We had booked a king room and when we got to the studio it was a queen and was a smoking room. When we rang down it was like sorry there are no other rooms in the hotel. Not quite an upgrade. Bikes for free are good and concierge efficient at directing. Rooms are Nice, Good size in the studi. Hallways and lifts and Lobby dated and smell a little. The steakhouse is excellant food. They gave us complimentary breakfast for the smoking room when I complained but it was only one thing on the menu and then they charged us on our bill. We went to stay at the W for the next 2 days and liked it better. We got a very good rate on expedia but if it was above 200 a night i would not stay here

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBud24
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in my travels and The James was the best Hotel ever. I'm a picky person and when I travel, I want the same luxuries as when I'm at home. The James Chicago has lived up to my expectations. The rooms were very modern, clean, comfortable beds, great Eco friendly shower/bath products, outstanding duvets and linens. The staff were friendly and always willing to go out of their way to help you. Example: Our mini bar fridge was not chilling properly. We called front desk and within a few minutes an engineer showed up to fix it. It was unable to be fixed and within one hour a new fridge was purchased and came straight out of the box for our room. If looking for a place to dine the steak house on the first floor has great reviews. I personally was a huge fan of the Lobby Martini Lounge which was a great place for a martini or two before you hit the city for the night. Good drinks and Great staff. I will continue to recommend this Hotel to anyone who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: rdr3636
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a hometown visit in June. I cannot say enough about this hotel. It was stylish, clean, and the staff was super helpful and accomodating. Also, the location was perfect for taking advantage of all the great Chicago shopping and restaurants. I will definitely be staying here again for my next visit this fall!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Luxury Rooms will bring me back everytime!”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed the past 4 years at The James for multiple nights over Lollapalooza. The location is great, the rooms are comfortable and all of the people are friendly and attentive. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but do not becomes what pretends to be”
Reviews.Author: ViajerosMAD
Reviews.Content: + Location was fantastic, from my point of view in the best area of the city. + Really Comfortable Beds! Would prefer shower had glass enclosure, rather than curtain and small closet (in winter will be really scarce of capacity) -Poor attention as expected based on great attention by e-mail. Because it was a special occasion for us. -Not as clean as modern looking as I expected based on the pictures. Poor value for money. Do not becomes what pretends to be. (low level of finishes, furniture and facilities) -The restaurant in the hotel, "Primehouse" too expensive and bad service (big basic mistakes) . Do not becomes what pretends to be. Would recommend this to consider it.

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs and pretentious service :-O”
Reviews.Author: omg75
Reviews.Content: We have some nasty welts up both arms and have been applying cream for the the bedbugs for the last few days. This, and unhelpful and pretentious service (especially from that guy called Chase from the front desk) was not expected from a 4.5 star property. The rooms are nice however more attention needs to be paid to customer service and cleanliness!! It really left a bad taste in our mouth to the point that we are not sure we would go to Chicago again in future!!

Reviews.Title: “Angered”
Reviews.Author: Lanie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011. The place was great...clean, modern and great location. When we got into our room we noticed our water was open and half drank. We notified the front desk and they said they would be sure to not charge us for it. After leaving I noticed a $3.33 charge to our credit card. I contacted the james and they said it was for the snickers bar we had consumed. If only we had consumed it. They will not take the charge off. Are you kidding me? I don't give a hoot about $3.33, but they don't have the decency to take the charge off when we spent a good amount of money there on the spa and at the lounge. I will not return do to this......seems illegal that they can charge us for something we didn't consume.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: ciaoamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the James Hotel for four nights over a wedding weekend. My highest praise for the hotel would go to the service women who cleaned our rooms every day. They were incredibly patient with so many of us coming and going getting ready for the wedding - they kept checking in on us making sure the trash didn't need to be emptied in the bridesmaids room and were extremely accommodating in terms of coming back in the late afternoon to clean our rooms. I was less impressed with the concierge service - I called to reserve a ticket and then picked it up and both times the man was a bit rude. Check-in and curbside greeting were both friendly and efficient in helping us with random requests and to find taxis. The rooms were very modern, yet comfortable. The bathroom could have been a bit larger. Only complaints were that the bathroom didn't have a fan and the tub took a very long time to drain. Overall, it was a great stay and we'd easily come again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: evelyn c
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have traveled extensively for 25 years. I have stayed in hotels from NYC, to Paris, to Copenhagen, etc. This summer is I stayed at the James for business. My company put us up at The Intercontinental, but we have stayed at the James in the past. I decided to buck the system and pay extra to stay at The james. I checked two bags on my last day while I still had business at the Mart. After meeting clients for drinks in the hotel bar, I went to get my bags. My bag with my Ipad, an Hermes scarf, my daytimer, gifts for my kids, hair straightener and various other items was gone. Total loss about $1700.00. The desk clerk and hotel manager assured me that they would replace the cost of the items. They told me to wait a week and the bag might turn up. After a week I called the manager and he pushed back saying the Chicago Inn Keepers law only holds them liable for about $250.00. After getting very upset and making a stink the Hotel agreed to pay $1000.00, a loss to of $700.00. I will not return to The James. I had previously left a sweat shirt and pants in the room that they claimed they did not have.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: learnedtraveler
Reviews.Content: We just got back at 4:30 am from Chicago. We stayed Monday-Friday and traveled by Amtrack. Our room at the James had one bed. One VERY comfortable bed. The location, as many others have reviewed was excellent. Two blocks from Michigan Ave and I believe three blocks from Grand Ave which leads to the Navy Pier. It was almost on the corner of Rush and Ontario and we walked everywhere, although the Museum campus is almost 2 miles each way. We found the James to have a posh side, but they were not snobby. For example, we did not want to have our covers turned down each night so we simply put out the "privacy please" sign on the door. We also did not want our sheets changed daily, so we let them know that as well. They still straightened everything daily and our room was very clean. Also, they checked us in 4 hrs early AND we checked out 4 hrs late (for $100 late check-out), which accommodated our train schedule beautifully. The only thing that keeps them from a perfect score is that the soap dispenser fell off the wall the first night. The maids took away the dispenser and the desk gave us shampoo because the shampoo dispenser broke in the fall. They were also some minor stains on the love seat. Without these two very minor issues, we would give it a 5. We loved the ease of walking everywhere but are physically fit (50 &51). Taxis are easy to get but charge about $1 a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a visit to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Refs09
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on Memorial Day weekend with our older teenage daughters. It was the perfect hotel! It is very conveniently located to visit Chicago, the staff is extremely pleasant, the rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean, and there is a pleasant feel about the hotel. We strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreqL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a very busy weekend - the hotel is very central just off Michigan Avenue which makes it ideal for exploring Chicago when you only have limited time. However, there are better hotels in this price range a few blocks further away which would be preferable for a longer stay. The room was nice, not spectacular. The bed was very comfy though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, trendy and well located”
Reviews.Author: ScrambledEggs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a the James for a couples getaway weekend. The hotel was recommended to us by a very hip local friend. Everyone at the hotel was polite and helpful. The Concierge did a great job recommending things to help and helping select options. The room was clean and very trendy. Comfy bed. It was a little more than I would have liked to spend but you don't always have a choice in some cities and I wanted to stay somewhere nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: mbw010
Reviews.Content: Typically our hotel of choice in Chicago, is the Omni Suites. But this time we thought we wanted something different so we reviewed the comments noted under Trip Advisor, on The James, and thought we'd give it a chance. We were a little hesitant at first, but that soon changed the minute we walked up to the hotel. From the door man (wish we could remember his name as he was awesome), to the hotel reception and then to our room. We were thrilled. My husband had called ahead of time and mentioned that we were celebrating two birthdays. In addition, one of our friends was running the 1/2 marathon. We walked into the room to 3 delicious cupcakes and the words "Happy birthday". In addition there was a bowl of fruit for our friend who was running the marathon. Awesome! We stayed were 4 days (3 nights) and the service didn't change. Everybody was extremely helpful, and friendly. The staff and location were awesome, and the rooms very modern, bed was so comfortable. They also provide courtesy transportation with the James car which is an Audi A7. It was a great change from the Omni and we would go back without hesitation. We highly recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “20th Aniversary- just lovely at the James!”
Reviews.Author: av01bps
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from three nights at the James; great service (all of the staff were great- the doormen, the housekeeping and concierge services were terrific) from in room massage therapists and especially Craig the driver. Craig drove us to several dinners. Lots of fun. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Rude doesn't cover it”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: My wife and two small children just arrived at the hotel after a long trip. My children 4 and 2 and my 4 year old is autistic. We arrived and they couldn't find our reservation even though we showed them the email confirmation. I thought no big deal, this is a 5 star hotel I'm sure they will take care of things. I was wrong! Im a pretty easy going guy and realize things happen. It was the hotels reaction and terrible rudeness that bothered me so much. The manager was just awful. So we are standing in the lobby for almost an hour with our kids going nuts. Finally we paid more than double what we booked the room for because it was almost 10 pm. NO sorrys no anything. We stayed at the Wit two weeks ago and the customer service was amazing. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!! and to top it off the rooms aren't even that nice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, small hotel right smack near the Michigan Mile...”
Reviews.Author: DZuki111
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the James for 6 days and loved it. Though I didn't use it, my hunny says the gym was excellent and the running routes provided by the concierge (24hr!) was beautiful. Our king bed was super comfy and love the little treats each night from our turn-down service. Excellent location and I highly recommend the free bike service.. we rode around chicago for 4 hours without a care in the world! i'd like to personally thank Meg W for doing such a great job helping me sort out my reservation changes and Krista K for advice before and during our stay. Our first time in Chicago and it was very well spent..! Thanks James.

Reviews.Title: “WOW'ed by The James”
Reviews.Author: ATjohnpapa
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, the staff was courteous, friendly and went above and beyond to make our stay special. We were immediately upgraded to a deluxe room (only 20 sq. ft. bigger than the standard, but felt enormous!) and also gave us a 40% off voucher at the hotel restaurant. That evening we left the hotel to go to dinner, (Moto) the doorman asked if he could secure us transportation, we agreed, thinking he would hail us a cab, instead he signaled to the corner of the block, and an Audi SUV pulled up. The hotel's complimentary car service blew our minds! Not only did it save us a $30 cab ride, but we arrived in style, the whole way the driver pointed out landmarks, and gave us recommendations for after dinner drinks. We utilized the car service twice more, for dinner again the next night, and for a lift to the Shedd aquarium. I also took advantage of the complimentary shoe shine service (almost), after I had dropped my shoes off to be cleaned, my evening plans changed. I realized that I would only have my gym shoes and was not prepared to wear them out to a bar, so i called the front desk and the manager hand delivered my shoes to my room in under 10 minutes. Everyone working at the James was fantastic, and they truly WOW'ed us at every turn. You've now become the ONLY hotel i'll stay at when visiting Chicago, well done, James.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot, and they even mailed me my iPhone charger!”
Reviews.Author: schampignon
Reviews.Content: Great, clean modern spot in a very convenient location. Being a little north of the loop had it's advantages. We really enjoyed the spots nearby like Grahamwich and the antique store Posh beside it. The people at the hotel very fairly helpful. It was raining and we should have booked out architectural boat tour through them because we would have been able to postpone! When I got home I realized that I had left my iPhone charger/cable in the room. They shipped it to me without question, no charge! I would stay there again, and look for JAMES in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tonz121
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel , very friendly staff and very well located

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Tiptop56
Reviews.Content: Having checked out of the pokey holiday inn we found this and what a find. Fantastic room, excellent service, free cycle hire. The bar was full of people full of themselves but isn't every big city ? After realising we could afford to stay there, the staff were very attentive. Would stay again if in chicago

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: inspecting
Reviews.Content: Our family had the pleasure of being at the James the week before lalapalooza. It was quite busy, yet the staff was friendly and helpful the entire trip. It us to be noted that this attitude and atmosphere is no doubt a reflection of how it is ran by Patrick Hatton. As the general manager he has this place running smoothly. We will definitely be returning as we do every year. As everyone has mentioned this place is clean, priced well and is perfectly located. This is the place to stay if you are picky about cleanliness. Thanks for making our family trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: onmyodyssey
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our baseball trip to Chicago and our stay at the James. It was easily accessible from the airport by subway, as were Wrigley Field and U.S. Cellular field. It's half a block from the shopping on the Magnificent Mile and an easy walk to both the Navy Pier and Millennium Park. The rooms are comfortable and attractive; it was a pleasure to return at the end of the day. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful, and their suggestions and directions were outstanding. We had a great time and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service yet.”
Reviews.Author: bnclam
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed with the James hotel from July 28 to 31. The staff were extremely customer service oriented and knowledgeable with their local surroundings. On an impromtu request for a fun late lunch the consierge was able to provide us with a recommendation that met exactly what we were looking for. And the front lobby staff went beyond the call of duty to save me a few dollars when I went looking for bubble wrap. The room was quite spacious and comfortable. Although when we checked in we noticed strands of hair on the sofa pillow and towels. These were changed with no question or problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KeppenK
Reviews.Content: Really nice lobby â€“ great location. Rooms are really nice, very trendy and cool. Sheets soft, confortable beds, and a nice bathroom. Overall had a great time here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Be!”
Reviews.Author: NatBToronto
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of a 4 night, 5 day stay at James Chicago. The room was beautifully appointed and bright and modern - lovely! The staff throughout the hotel were so friendly and accomodating. They always greeted us with genuine interest in our plans and our comfort. The hotel bar was a fabulous place to hang out - thanks Tao! The food was exceptional! We had the pleasure of a massage in the Spa. It was such a tranquil atmosphere and one of the most relaxing massages I've had. Thank you ladies! The concierge staff (Louis!!) were truly professionals. They helped to book any restaurant or tour we wished to attend - a lot of this was done in advance and the suggestions proved to be excellent. Their knowledge of the great city of Chicago was so evident and appreciated! The location of this great hotel makes the whole, exciting city accessible. Perfect! You will find the atmosphere of Chicago warm and the people so friendly! Chicago is a destination for everyone! Overall, the attention to detail at James Chicago is probably unmatched. You must make this hotel your 'home' while you visit this marvellous city! Natalie B., Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PK1978
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay this past weekend! Room was beautiful, clean and spacious. Free internet and maid service twice daily was a great extra! Awesome location! Only one block from shopping area and great restaurants. Also close to night life and walking distance to main attractions. Very attentive and personable staff. I was able to take advantage of a hotel promotion so great price was an added bonus! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - will stay there on next trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mason8341
Reviews.Content: Room met expectations and staff was always warm and helpful. Dimmer switch for bed light was inoperable but repaired quickly by very nice maintenance person, other wise all aspects of our stay were very pleasant. My pet peeve is nice Hotels that charge for wireless internet. James provides wireless at no charge. Complimentary bicycles were in top condition and made for a nice morning tour through the waterfront parks. Concierge staff was particularly helpful in fleshing out a first timers visit to the City. Location is excellent. A great reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: liarav
Reviews.Content: Was there for 5 night, great location and excellent service. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Restaurant in town”
Reviews.Author: GlobetroterCostaRica
Reviews.Content: We did stay here for a few nights in October 2010 before a weeklong stay at the Southwestern University outside Chicago. The location of the hotel is quite good, (note that the hotel is no longer related with LHW) within a few minutes drive by Taxi from all the important sites in Chicago. You also should note that the rooms are of smaller size and if you need a large room you have to go for one of the suite. The Hotel is clean and employees across the board are very friendly and helpful at all the times, however space in all aspects is very limited. Lobby Lounge and Lobby Bar offer great cocktails and snacks. The Steak house restaurant is a must to check out, we have had here a number of meals (from the fist stay and each time we are back in Chicago) and I can truly assure you this is the best Steak house restaurant you can find. I have been in many steak restaurants worldwide; this is one of the best of them all. Food, service and operational ideas & leadership are just mind blowing and truly worth to experience, as I said one of its kind. If it would not be for the Restaurant I could not place 5 star rating for this review. The Bellboy service is also worth noting, at all times friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, contemporary design”
Reviews.Author: onesix18
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, stylish, well-designed, with good service. If you're looking for a base that's convenient to Michigan Avenue and adjacent areas, this location should be perfect for you. I found myself wishing that everything--room, lobby, etc.--was a bit bigger. But that's what you get when you convert an early 20th C office building into a hotel. Don't get me wrong, the execution was great. The place didn't wow me, though. Also, since it's a low building facing north on an east-west street, there no views to speak of, even from high floors. I'd certainly stay here again, but I'd also review my options before committing to this hotel a 2nd time.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand1527
Reviews.Content: Company business trip. I was upgraded to a "loft" room and this room was absolutely fantastic. Full bar, mini-bar, and loads of snacks. The loft room has a movie room which is a comfortable bed with an LCD projector and Bose stereo CD/DVD system and the hotel has a long list of movies to provide you with for watching or you can bring your own. Staff were great, always accommodating and my only complaint would be that the bar closed too early. Our bar maid staff were extremely busy taking care of all of us and did a great job though, and the drinks were always great too - thanks. Thanks again for such a great time in Chi Town at the James.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Taxilady007
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend The James Chicago! For a NYC woman visiting my daughter for a fun few days in Chicago" eating, drinking, and sitting in cafes" The James did not disappoint. I loved the clean open spaces (though frankly I thought the art installation of the piled up suitcases in the lobby was heinous) the overall ambiance felt clean , relaxed, and comfortable which was what I was looking for. I asked for and received an upgrade to a suite and it was FABULOUS! Huge, overstocked mini bar, beyond comfortable bed, rain shower, picturesque view, basically a one bedroom apartment. The vibe is understated luxury . I appreciated the easy fall out of hotel into the downtown scene, the prompt helpful doorman cab assistance, and of course I had fun flirting at your "sparkling bar"! Where IS that guy?? James brought their A game and from now on it will be my Chicago Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if it were cheaper”
Reviews.Author: cajl15
Reviews.Content: Excellent base camp for magnificent mile. Rooms are modern, well equipped, but small. Possibly overpriced though. If booked with discount could be reasonable value for money

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay was just as wonderful as our first!”
Reviews.Author: writesabit
Reviews.Content: I truly have nothing bad to say about The James. This pretty boutique hotel is just around the corner from Michigan Avenue shopping, nearly next door to the delicious Grand Lux Cafe and directly across the street from Trader Joe's! The staff are gracious and helpful, the rooms are spotless and very comfortable and they offer up Kiehl's bath products to boot! The lobby bar is beautiful and a great place to kick off your night on the town. It gets busy and stays busy, so they must be doing something right. We've not dined at the Primehouse restaurant but again, it is usually busy so... There are in room coffee makers as well as free morning coffee in the lobby. Free newspapers too.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago! I'm hooked!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaneE2240
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute trip to Chicago a few weeks ago. My typical big chain hotel was sold out so I took the recommendation of a friend who said that I should try The James Hotel. I am an extremely picky traveler so of course I was skeptical. I have to tell you, I will never stay at another hotel in Chicago unless this hotel is sold out. I could not find one thing wrong with this hotel. The atmosphere is warm and friendly and the staff was like no other staff I have ever encountered in a hotel and I travel A LOT! I had a very important dinner for one of my companies largest clients. I was so impressed with the hotel, I hosted the dinner at the hotel restaurant David Burke's Primehouse. Our server Matt was friendly and knowledgeable and made the dinner fun and a huge success! I took the time to ask a few of the staff members what their backgrounds were and how was it possible to encounter this same "can do" and friendly attitude on such a consistent basis my entire week there. Almost every one of them attributed it to their manager and the General Manager. I was blown away! The next time I stay, I will make it a point to personally meet this General Manager and shake his hand for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Not tourist friendly”
Reviews.Author: mikesbecky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The James based on reviews from this site and one other. Showing teenage son Chicago for first time, my umpteenth visit to the windy city. Also attending 2 music festivals in the area. Front desk upgraded us to a junior suite right away, probably due to lack of 2-bed room. First room we were given smelled as though the previous guest was very sick and was given a new room right away. Consulted concierge first night regarding music festival next day and was given a very negative review of the festival and discouraged from attending--all I wanted was directions! Next morning asked for directions to 2nd festival from concierge who seemed put out to speak to a "mom" type and was given directions heading the opposite direction from the venue. Called manager on duty who responded with a comped taxi to the venue, but unfortunately this didn't entirely solve the problem and actually made some things worse. After this last straw, we used our IPad and IPhone to help us find our way around rather than consulting the concierge desk. This is probably a fascinating hotel for the average high-roller, expense account wielding guest, but I can't recommend it for tourists, even though the location is perfect for downtown. Won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our trip at the James!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the James 4 times in all. I have finally gotten around to writing a review. I think this hotel is priced perfectly and you get what you pay for. The rooms are very clean (in my experience) and I have always had a good nights sleep. The bed is extremely cozy, and I enjoy the simplistic but modernly furnished room. We plan on making a return trip in September of this year we enjoy this hotel so much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: phillywave
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. I loved the arty ambience of the lobby, with art works and installations peppering the space. The room with it's modern, clean decor was spacious and pleasant. The restaurant, David Burke's Primehouse, was another wonderful experience with innovative and interesting dishes that we have tried at the lobby bar and for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Yazen
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Chicago after a trip to Costa Rica. We stayed there from June 30-July 3. The James has two things going for it. The location and their employees. The rooms are clean and comfortable with a modern twist but very small bathroom and no closets. Waiting for a small cramped elevator wasn't the best but for a chic hotel with ultra "cool" people, it brought back memories. Our view was of a side of a building. A Hugh plus is the location. Doesn't get better. Great breakfast place across the street, shopping, short walk to.heart of the city. Scott, the tall concierge made our trip(hope the name is correct) . He sent us to a superb family run restaurant by the University. Maid service excellent as was front desk. Rates good for two nights, expensive for a Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “EDGY AND MINIMILIST BUT SUCCEEDS IN SERVICES AND GUEST ATTENTION”
Reviews.Author: jeromeoconnor
Reviews.Content: A gut re-hab of a former Twenties office building perfectly situated a block from Chicago's great Magnificent Mile and close to numerous restaurants and bars. Friendly and knowledgeable front desk with connecting popular bar and steakhouse. Rare for even a top deluxe hotel is availability of quality local and national newspapers seven days a week. Moderately sized rooms also minimilist in appearance with off-white walls, chocolate carpeting, separate seating nook, coffee maker, orange sateen recliner shows wear, nicely bright reading lights, very large flat screen TV (but not with HD). King bed overly spongy, but bed comfort is always in the eye of the beholder. Nightly turn-down and ice in deluxe rooms a considerate touch, one of many by caring management. No views, but none needed with so much happening immediately outside. Room also has CD/FM with surprisingly good speakers, and big bright alarm with radio. Even books are available to read in the room.. Average size bath is at least bright, but nearly flat sink looks nice but difficult to use, and very shallow bath is actually dangerous with it complete lack of hand rails. Some rooms were being re-decorated after six years of continuous use. Most Chicago hotels, including The James, are much more price attractive than similar hotels in New York of Los Angeles. The James works hard and succeeds with its mostly 30 and under guest list.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent except for room temperature”
Reviews.Author: hike4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The James 7/7-7/11. Pros: Loved the room layout. LOVED the bed!!! Huge comfortable pilows, thick mattress. Sitting area far enough away from sleeping area - both with flat screen TVs (though we never watched the TV). Front desk staff was polite and professional. We were able to check in early on Friday. Cleaning lady was personable. We either didn't have any neighbors, or the room was almost soundproof. Close to restaurants and shopping. Cons: Room temperature. There was a huge mirror propped against the air unit to hide the fact that the door was ajar and had been worked on recently. It never did get cool enough and we would wake many times throughout the night sweating. We mentioned it to the front desk and when we got back to our room that night, the unit door was wide open exposing wires and mechanic items. Could not get it below 72 degrees and that was in the living area, not the sleeping area...which was much warmer. One other issue was there is a single cup coffee maker - and a single cup for it. Two pkts of coffee, but only one cup, so only one of us could drink a cup of coffee at a time, then rinse out the cup so the other person could make a cup. Really? No fridge and though it's not a deal-breaker, it would have been nice. We ended up just going down the block to a Starbucks. Lastly for cons, when we arrived, the doorman collected our bags from the trunk and took them inside while we were paying the driver. We went inside, the driver left, and my hooded, zippered, DMB sweatshirt had been left in the trunk (along with a large striped umbrella). Doorman says he didn't see them - even thought the interior of the truck was light colored and there were no other items in the trunk. Thank goodness the front desk was able to contact the taxi service, who contacted the driver, who brought it back for me. So make sure you have everything out of the truck before the driver leaves - even if the doorman has shut it. Other than that, it was a nice hotel, but the room air really should have been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “How did they get it so wrong?”
Reviews.Author: Ths120
Reviews.Content: What appears to be a lovely, well designed hotel is simply a facade for a badly run hotel, that, in my opinion should only have three stars. To be honest we did no have any complaints with our room, except for s noisy air conditioner and a poky bathroom, with a tub designed for a toddler, not a five foot six woman of average build. The general upkeep of the common areas left a lot to be desired, it took 48 hours for housekeeping to vacum up plasterboard scattered on the carpet on the level 12 lift lobby, and only after we complained. However what annoyed us the most, the breakfast vouchers and the $14 dollar limit plus tax and tip allocated to each guest. What a load of rubbish, that gets you a coffee and some eggs, not even a juice, and if you want tea that will be $6. I have travelled all over the world and never experienced such a ridiculous system, that not even the staff could explain it properly and still managed to get wrong twice. In addition, if I paid for breakfast with my hotel reservation so why am I then charged tax again, when it is already charged for in my room rate? Clearly this hotel is all about income revenue, and not about customer experience, otherwise why would you? Perhaps they need to learn from more successful hotel chains, I am just grateful we are not staying with the James in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “DIsappointed by the stay and price”
Reviews.Author: nddt98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate a special day together. I was disappointed in the room overall. Chose the suite but really shouldn't have. The suite gives you a strangely shaped room addition (about 5' by 10') that really is more of an afterthought. There is a couch and a TV but the couch is so close your neck will be sore from looking up at it. The tiny TV was nothing to write home about either. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom adequate, but there really was nothing else worth noting. Some nice touches here, nice people, but not enough to be that costly. If you want to splurge, go for the Elysian. That hotel is beautiful and really will WOW you.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Patrick, Meg &' the Julies' at James Hotel Chicago. WOW!”
Reviews.Author: ThePalHotel
Reviews.Content: Had a good rate for two nights at Hotel Felix (most comfy beds, ever!!! and great staff!), BUT this review is about James Hotel Chicago. I wanted my last night to be in a nearby location to Felix. I was in Chitown location scouting for a film, and taking in theatre and Improv. I left a message for Meg, to see if they would honor or match the rate at the Felix, and they did that, AND SO MUCH MORE, AMAZING! I thank both Felix and James on this Chicago trip (both cool eco-friendly hotels:). The James really out did themselves though. They offered me an upgrade, without me even asking. I went from a cool queen to a very cool lofty king, literally a two bedroom loft (1221). It was exquisitely decorated and loaded with TV's, a movie projector, and even an old school boom box, with a modern ipod docking station (and a loaded bar, but I am on the wagon). James also has one of my favorite toiletries, Kiehl's (check out the Kiehl's NYC headquarters at 13th and 1st). Felix and James both have Spa Asha, very nice, great massages at both, BUT James wins out for you gym rats! The gym at James is loaded, and size matters, it's huge! (I almost didn't care that neither Felix or James has a pool). The Julies at James were amazingly helpful at the front desk (the whole staff was very cool and professional). James also wins out in the 'check-out' time, they are willing to accommodate most reasonable requests (I checked out at 2:30, that made life so much easier, I was able to even catch an Architecture boat tour! Ask the concierge for anything, just ask nicely, and tip that gang well, they deserve every dollar!). I was so impressed with James, I left a voice mail message with Patrick, the GM. He returned my call within an hour. I was already in the air, heading back to Austin. Patrick left a kind message, personally inviting me back to James on my next visit (fyi-James SoHo NYC is also fantastic!). So I say thank you James Chicago, and to you travelers (of all ages), check out James Chicago!!! Chi is the American birth place of Improv. I strongly suggest you check out Improv Olympic's "TJ and Dave" Wednesday @ 11:00 PM in the Cabaret Theater (tickets are $5. Call ahead for reservations!), also checkout "The Second City" (Old Towne), great late shows. Maybe you'll see an SNL future star or a past legacy of sketch comedy?! www.nativenewyorkerfilm.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: msptrv
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the 4th of July weekend and had a great time. The friendly staff got us in our room quickly and were helpful in directing us to our destination later that evening. The modern decor and spaciousness of the room, made for a very relaxing stay. We also enjoyed our brunch at the David Burke restaurant in the hotel. Give this hotel a try if you are exploring downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esther020
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We stayed here with our family of 4. We got a great deal om a loft romm, room 822. Great, spacy room, beautiful bsthroom, great workoutroom, excellent staff. Try to go when you are in Chicago. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room #1618”
Reviews.Author: sunkissed1908
Reviews.Content: In the 100 degree heat of a Chicago summer, it sucks if your air conditioner does not work. After 2 maintenance men attempted to rectify the issue I was offered a portable fan which on low speed sound as if a helicopter was hoovering over my room. I requested a room change and a not so polite, unsympathetic night front desk attendant stated that was not possible because the hotel was at capacity. Maybe a manager could help me in the morning. The next day went by and no call was received. At 7pm, I called the front desk. No one was aware of my problem. Approximately 45 minutes later, a manager returned my call and stated a double room was available. I accepted it was glee. Anything was better than a room that does not cool below 78 degrees in the middle of summer. I was paritally correct. The bathroom door of the new room did not close. Thank god my boyfriend and I are past the shy part of the relationship. As for room 1618, I believe I was not the first guest to complain about the air conditioner. What's unfortunate is they continued to place guests into this room. And did not offer any reufunds or perks for my sleepless night in the sauna! This hotel need a major overhaul!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with The James”
Reviews.Author: KatieMN422
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews, we were SO looking forward to our stay over the 4th of July weekend. That is, until we got there. We arrived after check-in time, and got into our room after about a 2 hour wait. They gave us free breakfast for the "inconvenience". Ok, fine. We remained calm even though we had travelled all day and then sat in the lobby. In the mean time, I watched and heard other people yelling at the staff...and they get upgrades! So frustrating! So, after sitting in the lobby for over an hour, I went back and they kept saying "it's almost ready!" Finally after 2 hours we got in our rooms - and it was HOT. We were pretty much told to deal with it. They did comp 1 night out of the 4...after that, they didn't want to hear any problems. We turned the air down to 50 degrees, and the room was between 65-75 the whole time. When it's 90 degrees out, that's not comfortable. All in all, it was too overpriced for these issues. If they claim to be a "5 star" hotel, they need to act that way. I tried to explain to them that we paid extra to stay at The James based on reviews. The lovely lady at the front desk told me "Well, some people have great experiences. Some don't." Not too professional if you ask me!

Reviews.Title: “Service blunders”
Reviews.Author: abnyc2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend for one night using a deal that was found on Jetsetter. It was the worst hotel experience I have had from a hotel in this price range. We arrived at the James shortly before check-in time and were told that we could check our bags at the front until they called us when our room was ready. There was no mention of a delay, so we decided to stay in the lobby bar until they called us. After 2 hours of waiting, we went back to the front desk to check on the status. At this point we were told that they were experiencing delays with their rooms because an elevator had broken down, and they offered us free breakfast the next morning. That was fine, except at this point it was already almost two hours past check in time (2pm). We checked back again and were told the room is undergoing "final inspection" and were handed the keys at 4:30pm. The room was very warm and humid upon arrival, and the service door to the AC unit was wide open with a mirror that was supposed to be in front of it positioned at a 90 degree angle. We called to ask why the room was in this condition, and we were told by housekeeping that the AC had been broken, so they had to keep the windows open all day to air it out. We cranked the AC down to 50 degrees, and it finally kicked on. Upon further inspection, there was also a towel that looked like it had been left behind from the previous guests. To top it off, the next morning when we called to get our free breakfast, the room service person kept arguing with us about the number of free breakfasts we were supposed to get. She claimed it was only for 2 people, but we had been given certificates for 3 people. After hanging up, she proceeded to mistakenly call us back and ask "how many free breakfasts is room #... supposed to have?" (she had intended to call the front desk). Totally awkward! The only reason I am giving the hotel 2 stars instead of 1 star is that they did offer us free breakfast and free valet service for our trouble. However, the hotel's terrible execution of service really put a damper on our one night in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money unless you don't mind the lack of sleep!!!”
Reviews.Author: ijplev12345
Reviews.Content: I booked our 4th of July trip with James because of the reviews I read on tripadvisor. Unfortunately, I failed to read the reviews that do warn you of the noise, the thin walls, old furnitures and all other things that would have prevented me from booking the suite. My husband and I brought our 2 year old with us. I am a law student and he works for the military. All in all we don't money to throw away. We have been waiting months to finally save up enough money to book a trip. We were incredibly excited and we don't have vacations much so we booked a big room through James (the apartment suite) which all in all was above 200 bucks a night. When we arrived, the staff that helped us was courteous, friendly, and nice. When we got to our room, it had spots on the couch (gross) that they could have easily cleaned with a spot remover, old and broken hardboards, and the furniture were all old looking. As much as they tried to be trendy with the ikea style design, it lacked the relaxing atmosphere we were looking forward to. We got over it quickly and left to walk around chicago. My son had a viral infection so we decided to come back early to sleep. We laid in bed around 9. Much to our dismay, we could not sleep. I was already a light sleeper, on the other hand, both my husband and son are not. They sleep like a rock through any loud noise BUT we all could not fall asleep because all we heard were loud obnoxious drunks, people yelling at each other, cars honking nonstop...I could go on and on. At this point I was frustrated, cranky and disappointed. For the amount we paid, it was comparable to sleeping OUTSIDE, of course with a bed. That's how thin the walls were. It wasn't like faded noise, it was LOUD LOUD LOUD noise. I called the front desk at 3 am and the lady was incredibly rude. I am assuming because they get that complaint a lot. She said that there were no rooms available an to wait until the next day. So we decided to try again. Still, all we can hear were loud people and cars so we requested some ear plugs. As for the food- breakfast was bland. We also ordered my son burgers and it tasted like crap. We ordered a chocolate milk sized SMALL and they brought up a large, plain milk. The milk itself cost about 6 bucks. Room service did fix it but it tasted like crap. Again, bland chocolate milk. Not sweet at all an you can barely taste the chocolate. The only good thing is their location. Everything else (except the doorman outside) was either mediocre or horrible. I definitely can say that we wasted our money. Honestly, if you are looking for a place to party or go to after bar hopping this is for you. You will be too drunk to even care for the noise. However, if you want a relaxing and enjoyable stay, I suggest you go elsewhere. Last vacation we had, we booked a junior suite with sofitel. The service there was outstanding. The food was amazing and the room was so nice! All for the same price! The only reason why we booked with James was because I wanted to try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot and perfect staff.”
Reviews.Author: BetoT
Reviews.Content: I spent the forth of July in Chicago and couldn't have stayed in a better place. Perfect location, very good staff. They were doing some remodeling of some rooms without any inconvenience for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Downtown Hotel for Family With Teens”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: Our family, including two teenage daughters, stayed at the James for our son's college graduation in early June, and were pleased with our choice. The James is within convenient walking distance to many of the attractions of downtown Chicago, and cabs to further destinations were plentiful. We had what I believe the hotel refers to as a "Media Suite", which means that one end of the suite has a projector DVD player so you can watch videos projected on the wall opposite a king-size bed situated in a fairly private nook (although it had no door). The other end of the suite had a platform king-size bed, and in the middle was a living area with a long couch that would have been fine for an adult to sleep on, had one of the teens wanted her own separate place to sleep. It was quite roomy for four people, and we never felt cramped at all. The suite was stylishly but comfortably decorated with contemporary furniture: leather seating, a table/desk with wire chairs, and end tables apparently fashioned from tree stumps. There was also a beautiful wet bar with some of the nicest glassware I've seen in a hotel as well as a mini-coffeemaker that tided us over in the morning. The James is an "art hotel", with some interesting installations in the lobby including a pile of about 45 suitcases containing torn-apart hotel beds. It's also a popular meeting spot in the evening, with a busy lobby bar scene. One of the highlights of the hotel was the David Burke steakhouse located on the first floor, which my family avowed to be the best steakhouse they've visited. The desk staff was polite and the doormen were very attentive and helpful for securing cabs and giving directions and advice. We felt very comfortable and welcome during our stay. Only two minor complaints: the bathroom had a sliding door that did not close all the way, leading to some grumbling from those seeking more privacy; and the room keys never worked more than one time, necessitating that we replace them FOUR TIMES in two days -- aarrgh!! Meaning that we would go to the room, no one's key would work even if they had not been near cell phones or anything magnetic, and we would have to return to the lobby for a replacement set. Four times. And we weren't even in the hotel that much during our stay. Many other guests were having the same problem, so it must have been a glitch in the system on that weekend, but it was still irritating. We would return to the James, especially for another chance to enjoy the David Burke steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it definately would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sarahknny
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, we stayed here just after christmas and for new years. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough everything about it was great. lovely rooms, spotlessly clean but what makes this hotel great is the staff every single person was polite and curteous they could not do enough for you. The location is excellent and the rooms are spacious. the only slightly negative is the slding door in the bathroom was quite difficult to open and close but other than that it was perfect!!! I would definately stay in this hotel again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible.”
Reviews.Author: PM16
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Chicago so we didn't know what to expect from the city, let alone the hotel. We were more than pleasantly surprised. Upon entering the James there were employees to help you with your luggage and immediately direct it to your room. The lobby was gorgeous! It was so homey like a living room, yet with an air of luxury. The rooms were modern looking and extremely comfortable. I LOVED the bathroom. Over all the service was wonderful; the front desk was so nice. Must go to the David Burke Steakhouse in the hotel, its deelish!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THELITTLETHINGS_11
Reviews.Content: Everyhing about the hotel was perfect! From the friendly staff to the chic decor, it was exactly what we were looking for. The hotel doesn't have a pool but you are able to use the pool at the Sheraton across the street. David Burke's Primehouse restaurant at the hotel was delicious. The location was perfect for shopping and restaurants/nightlife on Rush Street and Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: toronto09062008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 night with my wife and 4 month year old boy, I have to say The James was more than accommodating to our every need. I know it's the kind of place that doesn't have many kids staying here, but that doesn't mean they weren't more accommodating than any other hotel i have stayed at in this area. From the minute we stepped in the bell boy was superb, he even made our dinner reservations for us! The saw all our baggage and immediately upgraded us to a larger room and had the crib ready and prepped in minutes. This place goes as far as having a courtesy car to get you around to local places instead of waiting for a cab. Everyone was so friendly and ready to go out of their way to help. They definitely do set the bar for high standards and live by it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: XXTravel
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at James hotel traveling through Chicago. It turned out to be my best hotel stay ever! Finally a hotel that has found the perfect balance between extremely friendly staff (genuine and service- minded) great rooms with modern style, excellent food (breakfast is highly recommended) and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chefsteve
Reviews.Content: 4th stay at the James. Quick weekend getaway. This time we upgraded to a suite, the weather was rainy and planned to spend more time in the room. Always helpful service from the desk and concierge. Flat screen TVs in both large rooms, well supplied bar with glasses and tools. Trader Joes across the street to acquire happy hour supplies. The bathrooms in the regular rooms are small, so we appreciated the huge bathroom and large shower in the suite. Location on Ontario is convenient to everything downtown. We always stay here or the Sofitel. Sofitel is nicer (and larger), but prices are often better at the James. J Bar not quite as popular as it was in the past but still OK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 1234Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our Civil Union and had a wonderful time. The restaurant was quiet but with a good buzz to it on a Sunday night. The staff was attentive and efficient. Wonderful steaks and salmon was delicious. Go for the tempura green beans as a side. Room was spacious with Aveda bath products-which always smell so yummy. Comfortable bed with high quality linens. The sounds of the city may wake you, but that's the fun of it.

Reviews.Title: “Service is king”
Reviews.Author: Kalaekilohana
Reviews.Content: The James knows how to emphasize it's strengths. They don't have 50 stories with panoramic views of the lake or rooms with marble walk-in showers. What they do have and they offer it in spades, is service, location, clean rooms, and more service. Requests are handled personally and promptly. Concierge services are extensive and thoughtful, even if what you seek is outside their computer system. The doormen receive the highest marks for not only making you feel welcome but for engaging the guests in actual conversations while you are standing outside waiting for your partner or whatever. The bed was comfortable (we slept well) and the free exercise room was appreciated on the one day I couldn't walk on the lake shore. The free internet was something many hotels in Chicago still do not offer and and is a good perk. The location on Rush and Ontario is excellent, although not immediately on a bus line. We had a $14 3-day bus pass and wanted to use it, and they were helpful with route maps, even though they always thought we should just jump in a cab. We often use cabs in NYC, but we wanted to try the bus and train system in Chicago to see whether the pass was a great value. It was! Trader Joe's is across the street and was an excellent option for a light meal, wine, or beverages. Famous steak houses are right there for upscale dining, and there was plenty of shopping for those that love to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like an escape even for Chicagoans!”
Reviews.Author: kylierosey
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The James for Valentine's Day weekend just for something fun to do and to get out of our appt. The room was immaculate and extremely comfortable. The hotel is located in River North, an excellent spot for shopping, dinning, sightseeing in Chicago - which is always fun even for people who live here. I was impressed by the attention to detail, one example being Kiehl's shampoo and conditioner! In addition, the staff was inviting and friendly. Overall we loved our stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in our 5 day, 5 city trip”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoo4427
Reviews.Content: While we only stayed here one night, it was the best value of all the cities we visited... NYC, Washington, Chicago, Seattle & LA. The front desk and all the staff we met were both friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms were modern, nice sized and very comfortable. Flat screen TV (but mostly all analog channels). It was great to walk outside and have great restaurants all within a 4 - 5 block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: shaqquitta
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great for families, because there is a Trader Joes right across the street. Super convenient to pick up snacks for the kids and fast breakfast such as yogurt and bananas. Overall the hotel is clean and the bathrooms were new and spotless. Our room was a suite which was large and had two televisions. The hotel did provide a pack and play for us which was great, it did look a bit dated but sufficient for our stay. A couple of gripes that I did have was the cost of valet at the hotel. My friend dropped us off and for him to park 3-6 hours it was over 40 dollars. A little high, but I guess thats the price for being in downtown. Another complaint that I had was they charged us wrong when we ate at the Primehouse. It took three calls to the front desk before this could get straightened out. Kinda bad service considering the caliber of the restaurant and of the hotel. One more small complaint is that the curtains are not blackout curtains, so at around 6ish you can see the sun peak through the sides of the roman shades.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with great staff !!!!”
Reviews.Author: boogieshoes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed two times at this fab hotel , great service , bar , Primehouse , the valet were perfect !!!! The spa ...and in room massage , were wonderful !!! Have a drink at the bar ...

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but lacking a wow factor”
Reviews.Author: italiandude707
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my night at the James but it didn't leave a lasting impression. The check-in person was friendly but looked at me incredulously when I asked if my $329/night room included breakfast. The room itself was spacious and nicely appointed -- best part was definitely the pillows; they were great. My room was on the third floor and I could hear the noise of the street throughout the night. Checkout was quick and efficient, which was great. Had dinner at the Primehouse (in-hotel restaurant) -- the atmosphere was great but I learned that $70 steak aged in a Himalayan salt chamber tastes remarkably like the $25 variety from my local steakhouse... Overall, no problems with the hotel but it doesn't stick out as somewhere I'd seek out on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best Birthday"”
Reviews.Author: emeraldglobal25
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at The James Chicago my Birthday was amazing! The service was first class. They never missed a beat. The staff's smiles, hello's and have a great day made our stay enjoyable. The room was clean and beautiful. While staying at the hotel enjoy the Car Service, which was excellent thanks to Craig. The Concierge recommended great places to dine and tour. We'll be back to enjoy The James again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location--but spendy”
Reviews.Author: Jkatajhina
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights here for business. I booked into a suite and landed on the top floor, the 17th--and bedroom was in corner with windows on both sides. Terrific view. Service was top-notch, room very comfortable, suite was nicely decorated and served our purposes well. I think the price was nearly $500 a night for the suite, which is a lot of money, but Chicago rooms are expensive and we needed the extra room. They lend out free umbrellas when it's raining and location is really great. Across the street is a great little cafe called E.Leaven, a Starbucks, and aTrader Joe's. About one block from Michigan Ave. All in all, highly recommended if you have the money to spend. Oh, and they offered free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location--We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I just came from a seven night stay at the James and had a wonderful experience at the hotel The rooms were great, the bedding was wonderful, the staff was friendly, and the location was great. I was there producing a commercial and everyone on my team enjoyed it. The only two challenges we had were 1) a few days the internet was VERY SLOW. 2) In the bathroom, the shower controls are such that you inevitably get wet trying to turn on the shower (but nothing will change that short of a bathroom redesign). And...don't cross the woman in the restaurant and go in and seat yourself if you don't see her---you will be in "trouble." Other than that---a wonderful experience and hope to get back soon. p.s. I had never looked up at the hotel exterior until...the day we left. From the outside---the hotel isn't great looking----but is completely different inside. So if any brochures show the outside of the hotel and you think maybe "not"---ignore the picture. The hotel is wonderful and beautifully redone inside.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: taves4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on May 16-17 with my mom. I had a wonderful stay. Every one of the staff was phenomenal. They were helpful, friendly and quick. They made sure we had everything we needed. I didnâ€™t get to have drinks in the bar or eat in the restaurant but from what I saw and heard the service was great. I have lived in the Chicagoland area for 18 years and never really stayed at hotels outside of the major chains. This hotel has changed that for me. I definitely plan on coming back for a visit real soon. I loved the way the rooms were decorated and the atmosphere of the whole place was great. The only suggestion I have is to maybe get different alarm clocks. Iâ€™m not sure if it was just the one we had in our room or if they all are like that but it was hard to see the numbers on the clock. You had to tilt it in an odd way.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Beaudof
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely! The room was spotless and very modern looking. The towels were plush and the robes were great. We loved everything about it. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NewBrunswickChampoo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at The James. Pleasant and helpfull staff (the concierge gives out excellent suggestions for restaurants and other activities). On a rainy night, when taxis were hard to find, we got a ride to our restaurant with the complimentary car. Thanks to Craig, our very nice driver. The rooms are more minimalist in decor but inviting. Super clean. The bed is so comfortable. And it's only a few steps from Michigan Ave. Do get a mojito at the lobby bar (part of the steakhouse situated in the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelSimone
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, The James is in an ideal location- a block away from the heart of the Magnificent Mile (and 2 blocks from Garrett's Popcorn!). The service at the door and reception was excellent. Room service was also fairly fast (even though they would quote 30 minutes for breakfast delivery, it usually arrived in less than 15 minutes), and the breakfast was large and the bread was fantastic. The rooms were a decent size with enough extra seating, so that you didn't have to always sit on the bed. The big, flat screen TV had a huge selection of channels. I was happy they provided free high-speed wireless internet. The bathrooms were nicely appointed with a constant refill of Kiehls products. Although there were 2 fluffy bathrobes in the closet, I think it is odd that there was only one coffee cup and wine glass in the room. Also, even though there were 2 of us in the room, the turn down service only dropped off one small treat each night. I don't care too much about these things, but it is a sign that they are just slightly "off" when it comes to "attention to detail". We were lucky to have an outside room on the top floor with a king bed and an excellent view. I'd agree that the furnishings were just slightly worn, but that is to be expected at a hotel, and didn't bother me, since this one was a good price for the location, service and amenities. The bar downstairs was lively and a nice option for a drink before we went out. I will stay here the next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff with great service, comfortable rooms, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: bouncer6
Reviews.Content: It's almost a shame that I spent so much time away during the day because I would have been happy lounging at the hotel and trying out the aveda spa. My room was nice and quiet and I was a block away from the golden mile.

Reviews.Title: “Good but get an outside room!!”
Reviews.Author: EasyMancTraveller
Reviews.Content: The James hotel is in a great position, just off Michigan. It is pretty trendy and quirky for a large hotel.The 2pm check out time is very civilised - why don't more hotels do this?? A couple of downsides - the building is in a sort of squared off U configuration, so many of the rooms face inside. This means that if you are on the inside, the rooms opposite can see directly into yours, so basically you need to keep the blinds down whenever you are in it. Outside rooms may have the same issue from buildings across the road, but not to the same extent and are generally much lighter. Another odd one, and fairly minor at that is that there is a coffee machine in the room to make both tea and coffee - but only 1 mug (In a double room)?? Overall a good hotel, friendly staff, great position and pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “The James = Perfection in the Art of the Weekend Get-A-Way!”
Reviews.Author: heidiharris19
Reviews.Content: As a first-time visitor to Chicago, I expected to be blown away by this fabulous city...but I never expected to feel so at home in a hotel! The staff of the James achieves the perfect level of being attentive to your needs while at the same time giving you plenty of space. From the doormen to housekeeping, everyone was simply lovely! I only wish I could've found a way to bring home the bed from our room... it was heavenly. Can't wait to visit Chicago - and The James - again!

Reviews.Title: “The James--Classiness Personified.”
Reviews.Author: Kimperry
Reviews.Content: Everything about The James breathes Class, from the moment you enter it at it's terrific downtown location to the time you leave. How can an entire staff offer such superb service in so unobtrusive a manner? The rooms, particularly the Loft in which we stayed, are unique, everything is prompt, and The Prime House restaurant has a succulent menu. Their front desk folks can direct you anywhere in the city and offer opinions if you need them. Like I said, a Classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there were a James Hotel in every city”
Reviews.Author: kaiakegley
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the James for a Spring Break trip to Chicago and I recently came back for a work trip. I have to say that I'm a forever fan and wholeheartedly recommend to anyone looking for a respite in Chicago. The staff is the friendliest and most service oriented I've ever encountered. They're very attentive and not only take care of any needs or questions I pose, they foresee anything I need and take care of without me even knowing it was a need. When traveling with my young daughters, everyone was incredibly sweet to them, making them feel even more special than they felt by staying at such a cool place. We all felt incredibly welcome. One of my biggest pet peeves of business travel is paying for wireless access. Not at the James, wireless is free. The rooms are simple yet posh. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are quiet. The bath products are Kiehl's (a major selling point for me) and the little extras in the room made me feel like I wasn't just making another business trip in some generic hotel. All of this at an incredible value. It really isn't too good to be true. Thank you for making both of my trips so memorable and comfortable. I will never book another hotel in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Glorified IKEA”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in April and was looking forward to it based on the photos online. Overall, sadly, I wasn't impressed...while the service hit the mark, the quality of the room was below the mark. I've had far better experiences at a similar price point at several other Chicago properties within the same area. It wasn't horrific. Like I said, the service hit the mark...fast and polite check-in, helpful doormen and bellmen, desire to serve. Very well done on that front. The gym, while in a basement, was complete with a great range of equipment. The bed was quite comfy. But there were issues. The rooms are glorified IKEA. Totally cheap furniture that was badly worn. Chips in the coffee table, hinges broken, scuff marks, etc. And the room had no desk! While that might be fine for a leisure traveler, it is annoying for a business traveler. Rooms also had a barren look..all white, no wall hangings, brown carpet. I love modern design, but this place was put together on the cheap and the result is that it is showing wear and tear very quickly. Lobby is also a "scene." Not to the point where you don't feel welcome as a guest, like at some places, but combine the cramped quarters with the noise and I didn't find it very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: lingsj
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of a promotion (3 nites for the cost of 2) and it was definitely a bargain. Without this promotion, I guess I would probably be looking for something cheaper. Let's talk about the good things: 1. Location was superb, just one block away from the Magnificant Mile and walkable to many attractions in downtown Chicago . 2. Room is spacious, clean, comfortable and they provide Kiehl's toiletries. 3. Every night (without fail), someone will knock on your door and ask if you require housekeeping and ice. Before leaving, they will also give you a cookie. This is something quite nice and refreshing. 4. Check in / check out was fast and hassle-free. Door man was extremely nice and helpful :-) 5. One of the other reasons why I chose this hotel is the free wireless internet provided. I only have one complaint: The weather in Chicago was freezing, close to 1 degree celsius (even though it's supposed to be spring). I noticed that the heater was not working and I called the Room Service. Their first response was they do not have a heater (!!!). I was perturbed and told them I needed to have heat in this freezing weather. They sent an engineer and concluded that the heater was spoilt and they offered me a new room, so I had to change rooms at 7am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem! Believe the Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: sparky583
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel somewhat by accident. My wife and I are frequent travellers to Chicago, and we have stayed in various hotels in the downtown area. On our most recent trip, we had no preference of hotel, we just wanted to stay downtown. So, being somewhat adventurous, I booked a "mystery" hotel on a third party site, you know, the site that tells you about the hotel, but won't reveal the name until you book your stay. Well, my mystery hotel was the James. I immediately checked TripAdvisor and found the James had many rave reviews. I was thinking no hotel could be this good, but if it was half as good as the reviews, I would be thrilled. I'm here to tell you, believe the reviews. The James is truely a gem. When we pulled up in front of the James, we were greeted by the valet and bellman who both introduced themselves by name, unloaded our bags, explained the valet procedure to us, and directed us to the desk, where the desk clerk introduced himself by name and welcomed us to the James. The whole check-in process from the time we pulled up to the door to the time we were in our rooms and bags delivered was approximately 10 minutes. Our bellman was very informative and helpful, offering us several suggestions of things to do and directions if necessary. Our room was on the 14th floor, which was a surprize. I was expecting a small room on a low floor next to an elevator (what I usually get when booking on a 3rd party site ;-) What we got was a spacious room with a king bed and large screen tv. The bed was extremely comfortable, one of the best I've ever encountered at any hotel. There was also a fully stocked in-room bar with top shelf liquors at our disposal. I read in a prior review that the rooms did not have a clock. Our room did, and it also projected the time on the ceiling. The following morning we ate breakfaft at the hotel restaurant and ordered the James omlette. The omlette was awsome! But come hungry, it is a bit large. In my book, the James omlette is a must-do! Unfortunately, we did not have dinner at the steakhouse, due to our busy schedule. We do plan on eating there on our next trip later this summer. Everything about thie James is first-rate, the accomodations, the food, and especially the staff. Everyone was friendly, attentive, and competent! And the location was great also (a bonus)! We will definately be returing to the James on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!! Over the top staff!!”
Reviews.Author: KaraDig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The James for the first time while in Chicago and I was not dissapointed at all. When I got out of the cab the doorman addressed me by name and welcomed me to the the hotel. (HOW DID HE KNOW WHO I WAS?) once inside I was welcomed by all. Room was well appointed and CLEAN (very important for me), staff went out of their way to be friendly, just over the top kind and helpful. Will DEFINATELY stay here again. I travel often and they really made an impressionon me. Great Choice while in Chicago Location great too!! What a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded but not in a bad way"”
Reviews.Author: apple310
Reviews.Content: I picked the James randomly to stay one night while visiting a friend in Chicago. Everything was top-drawer. My room was quite large -- although I was a little concerned about the linen supply being right across the hall, it didn't get noisy. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was clean and well appointed. I truly appreciated the in-room coffeemaker the next morning, after I'd sampled 2 of The James cocktails! My friend and I didn't have a reservation at the Steak House for dinner, but thanks to my guest status we were whisked right in to a great table, and enjoyed a superb meal. My only question - it seems odd to me that there is no clock of any sort in the room. I don't like having to turn on the TV to check the time, nor keep checking my Blackberry. Oh, also - I checked out the gym, which was great, and admired the separate yoga/Pilates space. To make it truly perfect: add a ballet barre as well. Thanks, look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “St Practice Day in Chi-Town”
Reviews.Author: DeeDel6-2
Reviews.Content: The James Hotel is a lovely boutique hotel in the middle of the action in Chicago. It's situated within walking distance of a lot of the sites and offers many wining and dining options. The hotel staff are very welcoming, and the service was top-notch. The rooms are what one would expect in a boutique environment - cozy but not too cramped, minimalist furnishings, and trendy design. Very comfortable bed and linens. Amenities are special - nice touch to wrap a cozy robe around oneself after a fun day in the city. I'd return here - and you should visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: clairefgraham
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The James Hotel in Chicago! We stayed for three nights in March 2011. The location is perfect! Walkable to many Chicago sites, including just a block from the Magnificent mile (Michigan Ave). Famous deep dish pizza is less than 2 blocks in nearly every direction. The service was great as well! Typical Mid-West charm. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best. Birthday. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: ChicChels
Reviews.Content: Do you enjoy being pampered, unbridled 5-star luxury, and prefer service being served with a smile? If you answered YES to any of the above, then The James is the place for you. This past weekend I spent my 23rd birthday in Chicago. After scouring the 'net for hotel deals (for some reason people avoid traveling to areas where it snows in the winter--being from Texas, I relish it), I came across The James at $139/night through Travelzoo.com.
