Alone this would be a total steal (rooms generally run ~$250/night), and ON TOP of that a $100 food/beverage voucher was included for use at either David Burke's Primehouse, their in-house bar/lounge JBar, or In-Room Dining (more on that later). A separate spiel must be made for their concierge service/staff. A week or so before arriving I had e-mail correspondence with Daisy (such a pleasure to communicate with), to have "The Anniversary" amenity (a bottle of champagne along with these delicious bite-size brownie morsels topped with raspberries) awaiting my guest and I in our room before arrival. However, when we arrived--the amenity was not in our room. Not a big deal, I called down and they had someone send it up in under 5 minutes. But, the little card to accompany the surprise was not included. Again, no big deal. Thought nothing of it. Fast forward to the next day, my actual birthday. My guest and I hit the town for the majority of the day, returning early evening. Upon entry, I notice the card from yesterday WITH a plate of cookies (how thoughtful, I say to myself). THEN, I turn the corner to find a plate of birthday cupcakes with my OWN card signed by the entire concierge staff? Yes indeed, the sweetness overrunneth. FINALLY, as my guest and I sit down to enjoy piping hot Giordano's (the best in the city)--there's a knock at the door. It's Mirna the head concierge to apologize for forgetting the card yesterday and for the delayed delivery of the champagne with a tray of breadsticks and ice-cold beer !!! How did they know this would be the perfect addition to our meal?!? I have no idea, I just know I love them for it. Other Pros: Kiehl's bath products. Luxurious. Nightly turn-down service. Stayed two nights, two different cookies on my pillow. Room Service. See below After spending a few bucks at JBar before hitting the town the night before, we still had the majority of our food/beverage voucher to use the next morning before checkout. We. Went. Crazy. James Omelette for me (tri-tip steak, mushrooms, truffle oil, asiago cheese), Belgian Waffle for my guest. Hashbrowns, ham, juice, milk, & coffee to share. In a word? Delicious. Best room service I've ever eaten. They serve 24-hours a day too, including an enticing "late-night" menu which I'm surprised my guest and I didn't take advantage of--I think we passed out on the 300-thread count sheets before we picked up the phone. Cons? That I had to leave. You'll be seeing me again soon, James. Thanks for everything, you were the perfect start to a new birth year.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: MissHillNyc
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here for biz and pleasure. It is always a great stay. The rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are ultra comfortable and result in a solid sleep. The rooms are quiet as well. Great room service menu and close to city center. For all they offer I think a good value as well!

Reviews.Title: “Modern but not cold”
Reviews.Author: m0rrissey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near the Mile. Excellent facilities with an outstanding gym. Rooms, beds, bathroom, etc all clean, modern and fresh. I've been staying here for several years now and plan to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: 123gotraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are modern and clean. More than a good rest and a great shower, this was a comfortable place to relax between events.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahtaguemiller
Reviews.Content: The James Hotel provided all the amenities and service that one could wish for in a hotel. I stayed only one night but was amazed by the warm welcome, incredible staff and concierges suggestions. I would recommend this hotel with the highest praise to anyone looking for a wonderful boutique hotel in the center of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with TravelZoo promotion”
Reviews.Author: joshua_78Toronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the James Feb 19-22 with a friend while using a promotion code we found a month earlier on TravelZoo that gave us a fantastic room rate with free valet parking (they charge $48 a night for valet alone). The deal couldn't compare to anything else we found while researching hotel options in the location. After seeing the hotel and the room we were assigned, we were blown away by the value we got with this promotion. The hotel itself is in a perfect location with pretty much everything you can think of close by - or just a short cab ride away. The building doesn't look like much from the outside, but once you step inside you realize immediately that the hotel is something quite different from the rest. This isn't like any hotel we ever stayed in before and the chic modern design and attention to style made our stay that much more special. There is a great pizza place just a couple blocks away (Giordano's... with a 1.5 hour wait that was definitely worth it) and there's a Starbucks, bank and grocery store right across the street in case you happen to have any urgent need for caffeine, cash or goodies. All the staff at the James we dealt with were great - they helped us find our way around the City and even loaned us a couple umbrellas on the rainy days. The only complaint we have is that the free WiFi service in the hotel is inconsistent and there were a few periods over our three night stay when we were not able to access the Internet to look up City information from our rooms on either of our computers. My friend said she was glad she wasn't there on business since it would have been very disconcerting. There were, however, computers in the lobby for guest use so we were able to obtain the information we needed easily. Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: tulip2222
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about the James. From the room, to the concierge Bill and Toni to the wonderful staff throughout the hotel, gym, etc., this hotel is a hidden gem two blocks from Michigan Avenue. It's beautiful, comfortable, and professional. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else. This is my second time staying there and I was welcomed back (They remembered). They catered to every need we had and were very informative. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: kinz1986
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The James several times over the last 3 years. Every time our experience has been simply amazing! The large modern rooms are extremely clean and very comfortable. Dining at the steak house is fantastic and the bar is just a cool atmosphere to wind down and have a cocktail. As they say location is everything and The James is perfectly located for shopping, dining out, walking around and night life. We would have to say that hands down the extraordinary services are first class! Everyone went out of their way to be helpful and service friendly. We hope you can enjoy The James experience as much as we have! Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lhamons
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for our Anniversary. This hotel had very friendly staff starting at the entrance. Never once did we have to open a door, they even watched our bags as we were checking out. Highly recommend valet parking. These guys are quick and friendly. Our king suite had a roomy little seating area and plasma tv. The decor is fresh and inviting. The bed was very, very comfortable. Can't beat the location, right off of Michigan Ave. Across the street from Trader Joes. And Jbar was very cool. The music was nice, and drinks are good too. The Pink Chocolate was delicious. Reasonably priced hotel with awesome service. Our stay of choice. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice trip”
Reviews.Author: bigbluefan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James in early Dec. for our annual girls shopping trip and the location was great for shopping on Mich. Ave.Check in was great as we had an early arrival and were able to go ahead and check in.We had a double room with queen beds,that were wonderfully comfortable.The bath was spotless and the amenities were nice.The evening turndown was wonderful!It was a little awkward for the TV to be behind the sofa, as you couldn't set on it and view the TV,but from the beds the viewing was fine.If I could make a suggestion, it would be better lighting and another chair in the room would be extremely helpful for viewing the television.We hope to stay again this year and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else is below par. Worst domestic hotel experience yet.”
Reviews.Author: Tr4v3lW1sh3s
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat (steps away from Michigan Avenue) with a couple great spots for meals nearby. Very close to bus stops to make sightseeing effortless. Everything else was below expectations - - Thin walls, could hear normal conversations in nearby rooms - Very small room - no comfortable seating, strangely angled couch) - Televisions hang over the bed (makes it tricky to navigate around). Several years old. - Incredibly uncomfortable bed. (Slept on the floor after the first night) - Room service delivered propmtly but wrong items sent - In-room instructions for wireless, etc. were incorrect. Easily straigtened out with the front desk but documentation is outdated - Bath linens were threadbare and bedding was lacking - Peeling wallpaper and loose or missing baseboards make the hotel appear rundown - No views to speak of (windows directly across from apartments) For the price and ratings I expected more. It seems like the James' best years are behind it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Damn Good”
Reviews.Author: Late-Epicure
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, good vibe, nice rooms and fittings done with style. Reception staff helpful but somehow just lack that 'personal' touch, but that's being picky. Visiting the pool across the road really puts this place in perspective. Stay here and enjoy Chicago's offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: DaveOliver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the James in preparation for our wedding, as did most of our family. The hotel is a perfect location just off Michigan, and was swanky enough to suit all tastes!! We were there for a while and the staff were always superb. I can't recommend high enough for anyone looking for a city break!! (and Trader Joes opposite is always good for a healthy or not so healthy snack!) The J-Bar attached tho was not so good - you might hear that its a celebrity haunt. We found it to be a pokey little room, with expensive drinks and rude clientele. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: emm998
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The James for two nights this past New Years Eve and it was fantastic!!! The view was incredible and so was the room. We also got engaged on New Years Eve so spending New Years Day lounging in the room was great. David Burke's Steakhouse was a hit....so delicious! We will for sure be back to the hotel and restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 6 night stay”
Reviews.Author: clarehelen23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in November and the staff couldn't do enough for you. When we initially checked in they gave us a smoking room. We phoned the reception desk and they immediately sent someone up to show us a non-smoking room and moved us very quickly. They couldn't have done enough. The hotel is in a excellent location and within easy walking distance of major attractions and excellent restaurants not to mention in the heart of magnificent mile. From the reception staff to the door staff all were excellent and incredibly friendly. We talked to the door staff every day and they were very knowledgable with the area and gave us many recommendations for good restaurants and places to go. We did eat in David Burke's Primehouse which is located in the hotel, and we did have a very disappointing dinner. I certainly wouldn't recommend the expense of eating at this restaurant, however, this had no reflection on our enjoyment of our stay at the James. The hotel bar is very good with prompt and excellent service as well as some very nice cocktails. We certainly wouldn't hesitate to recommend the James and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: muenginerd
Reviews.Content: The James is by far the best hotel Iâ€™ve visited in Chicago. From the moment we walked in the door we felt at home. The Bellman and Front Desk Staff were very helpful in getting us checked and recommending great shopping spots. After arriving back from shopping our room was turned down and very comfortable, we didnâ€™t want to leave the room was too cozy. All the staff was very welcoming, even the passing mechanics in the hall stopped to say hello. The quietness of the rooms is what shocked me the most. The weekend we stayed the hotel was sold out with many holiday parties. Walking from the elevator to the room you could hear most of the parties going on. Once we closed our door you would have thought the whole hotel was asleep, not a peep. Open the door we would hear noise, close the door nothing. I was shocked, traveling all over I have been to a hotel as quiet as The James, or one that has had beds as soft. We canâ€™t wait to go back. And for the dog lovers, your pooch is welcomed too. They even have dog treats and water bowls waiting at the front door. Iâ€™m just sad my dog is not well behaved enough to go traveling.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lynx74
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a perfect spot in Chicago. A boutique hotel that welcomes kids! They even had a kids' library - but enough grown-up style that everyone was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo!!!”
Reviews.Author: NuPwr319
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through TripAdvisor's new service "Snique Away" (which was fabulous) offering a GREAT deal on this wonderful hotel. I was traveling to get some R&R for my birthday. Check-in was a breeze and Greg, at the front desk, was VERY friendly and customer-oriented (as was the doorman who greeted me with a HUGE umbrella to keep me out of the pouring rain, and the staff in the bar and restaurant). Greg arranged a wonderful birthday surprise--three delicious mini-cupcakes (red velvet with cream cheese icing-YUM!!) delivered to my room. The hotel is ideally located for shopping and dining--most everything I needed was in walking distance (the West Egg is perfect for breakfast). The gym was well equipped and the staff at the hotel's spa were gracious and accommodating. The contemporary room was spacious (I had a studio suite) and clean; the bathroom was spotless (the bathrobe was comfy) with excellent Kiehl products. The bed was heavenly--a good night's sleep each evening--and the turn down service is a nice touch. The mini-bar was well-stocked with great items (of course at the usual high mini-bar prices). The business center had both Mac's and PC's and the free wi-fi is a plus. If I had to give any critique, it would be the following: The bathtub was starting to peel a little bit. Also, if you want a view from your room, be sure to request an outside-facing room. The inside-facing rooms (which I had) have no view (you look directly into other rooms) and it makes the room very dark--even on sunny days. Still, these things did not detract from a wonderful stay. I'd like to take a quick moment to thank all my fellow TripAdvisor reviewers--it's also because of your willingness to share your honest opinions that I've had some of the best trips ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a Solid Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonDavid
Reviews.Content: Great River North location and a better than average boutique conversation can make this an excellent deal. It seems like there are great deals to be had for weekend stays . Under $150 or so this is a very good deal. Quality linens, mattresses and very good common spaces. The finishes are a step up from the IKEA type finishes that many developers put in boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, decent room”
Reviews.Author: markde
Reviews.Content: Good location, about two blocks from the Grand L station, which is nice in winter. But given the high rating of The James, I was a bit disappointed. As much as I love modern design, I found the room interior a bit cold and sterile. Very comfortable bed, but nothing special otherwise in the room. And the sliding hanging door to the bathroom was a classic example of design over function - it fell off the rails, was hard to open and close, and even a note to housekeeping didn't solve the problem. So good for location, as noted, but I wouldn't pay over $100 a night otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 stars, the James?????”
Reviews.Author: jwm44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the James for a weekend getaway Dec. 3-5. I found a much cheaper rate of AA.com but the James would not honor it. Why have a Best Rate Guarantee when the hotel won't abide by its own terms and conditions? We stayed anyway as the rate was less than generally available and included one night parking. The hotel has positive attributes - great location, amienable staff, clean rooms. Negative - rooms small ( I know its Chicago ) no ice machines ( purchased can of soda had to wait 20 minutes for ice and had the soda drank before ice arrived ) room furniture shabby = appears to be art deco but more resembled art junko, no vending, small lobby, parking a mess ( had to wait 45 minutes for vehicle after calling from room - message didn't get to valet ). For a hotel that purports to be a luxury brand much was left wanting. How this hotel received 4.5 stars on trip advisor is beyond us.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern hotel in the perfect location with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: SullyF
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay at The James anytime I go back to Chicago! The rooms were incredibly clean, and the beds were so comfortable. The concierge was exceptional! She got us reservations at all the coolest restaurants and was so accommodating. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel!!! Not to mention, the location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff.....great location...”
Reviews.Author: Interlochenkids
Reviews.Content: 6 of us futzy 60 something friends stayed at the James for the past 3 nights. Location is perfect, one block w. of Michigan and a few short blocks n. of the river. Staff is welcoming, attentive; Concierge Keaton (hope it's spelled right) was extremely welcoming and helpful. The lobby is quite beautiful in a subdued, modern way. Rooms are spotless, and the cleaning staff seemed tireless in their efforts to keep our rooms just so. Beds extremely comfy. Appreciated the pretty console/fridge/good window shades/great look of the bedrooms..... Downside: our rooms (two double beds) had no individual reading lights over each bed, unless we just didn't figure out the system. The "reading corner" had no lights. I suppose it's designed for laptops, but a light would have been great. Pretty bathroom, but the door between it and the bedroom was cumbersome and kept coming off track. Would have appreciated a mirror in the bedroom, so if the bathroom was occupied, one would still be available. The reading corner could be a great place for a built in vanity or desk, with lights. Closet was in the bathroom, so if it was occupied, again, you were out of luck. No exhaust fan in the bathroom. I'd still recommend this place, particularly for singles or couples, and I would certainly stay there again. Just a few changes would make it topnotch. The staff, location, lovely modern design and cleanliness made up for the few glitches.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad Ugly”
Reviews.Author: circleboy
Reviews.Content: The Good: Great location....Helpful staff....great bed The Bad: Had an apartment suite....The bed had only 6 inches of room between the mattress and the wall on each side. (true). you had to be a contortionist to navigate out of the bed to go into the main area...In the other room they had a bedroom area with a large bed/mattress on the floor for lounging I assume. It was framed and had pillows and was semi enclosed. The bedspread was so gross and filthy I would not even lay down on it to watch DVD's which played on the wall from the projection style DVD. The room was tired and needed an update. Breakfast room service never brought up 3 of the items I ordered. The ugly: Had the concierge get me reservations at one of the toughest restaurants in Chicago. Got confirmation from concierge. Went to restaurant....they had no record of reservation. Not sure who screwed up but concierge was no help when I called hotel from restaurant. Summary: Any Marriott in Chicago is just as nice and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and comfortable rooms with exceptional amenities and location.”
Reviews.Author: CinderChloe1
Reviews.Content: The James staff is totally geared to friendly customer service. The hotel rooms are comfortable, spacious, and quiet if you are on the interior of the hotel (not the Ontario St. side) and the "minimalist" design is very appealing. They have a wonderful fitness center and lobby with computers and a very helpful concierge. The morning of the Chicago Marathon (10/10/10) they had a wonderful breakfast for everyone in the bar beginning at 6am (or maybe earlier!) with healthy food and good coffee and fresh oj. I can't say enough about this hotel. This was our 3rd stay here and we will return. It is so nice to have a hotel that combines location, service, comfort, and quiet in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “close to michigan avenue. comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: gardenia808
Reviews.Content: We liked the style of the hotel and the location was great. We booked the hotel at a discounted rate which worked well for our budget. The hotel was nice but the bathroom door would not slide to a closed position as it was off the track and the towel bar on the door was already broken. Also, the sitting area did not have a light so it created a dark alcove to sit in which we thought defeated the purpose of that part of the space. For the price and location, the hotel was a good choice despite the bathroom door issue and no light in sitting area. We also enjoyed the comfy bed, quiet hallways and the Kiehl's products in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Am staying here as I write this and am crying over having to leave this afternoon. The location is great, the restaurant is superb - even when they cater a meeting - and the staff is helpful. Rooms are minimalist, and at first I didn't like that there was no desk since I had work to do. However I soon became accustomed to the smallish oval table in front of a cozy bench and was able to comfortably work on my laptop. Very much appreciate the free wireless. Beds are divine. Bathroom is short on counter space, and the closet rod is a bit short. When the hotel is doing some tweaking, the closet area could use some more light. I didn't hear a sound from the hallway or elevators. will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret it.”
Reviews.Author: Roobot
Reviews.Content: Worth every cent. They've considered just about every detail. Great location for tourism, friendly staff, quality bar/restaurant and a well equipped fitness centre (with free earphones).

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: weezie1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The James, in June 2010 This was our second stay at the hotel. We chose to go back for several reasons, The location is great and service was good . We were just as pleased the second time as we were the first. It is a trendy hotel, very chic . We ate at the David Burke Primehouse, which is the hotel restaurant. We had a wonderful meal and would recommend dining at this fine establishment. Overall we had a great stay.!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Krystle0819
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The James for one night as a little getaway and it was great. The rooms were nicely decorated, very modern. The beds were so comfy we wanted to take them home! The location was great - not far from Michigan Ave., the train was close by and the staff was very nice. I would recommend staying here. The parking at the hotel was expensive - $48 so we parked a block down at the self parking garage which was $34. This was the only downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing accomidations for young honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: RoxieSwank
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The James this past summer for our honeymoon. We had never been to Chicago so we really utilized the hotel staff in planning our adventures. Everyone was so friendly and helpful offering suggestions and directions. The room was incredible, and the in house bar made some great martinis!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Clemster10_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AWESOME! I booked through expedia and got a great rate. The location was perfect, just off Michicgan Ave, just a few block to Navy Pier and just a few blocks from a metro station. The room was very nice, sort of a hip, cool vibe...but not too edgy. There is twice daily housekeeping, with a "turn-down" service at night, makes you feel special. the room was spotlessly clean. The front desk and door staff went out of their way to be helpful. They add a lot of nice touches. I wouldn't hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “okay...just okay”
Reviews.Author: crys0606
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a weekend in Chicago for our birthdays the weekend of October 2nd and 3rd. The night before our stay, I called the hotel to make sure that we were NOT in a smoking room. I had read a previous post on trip advisor from someone who had gotten stuck with a smoking room. Since I am currently pregnant, I didn't feel like taking in some second hand smoke. The young lady who answered the phone assured me we had A NON-SMOKING KING ROOM. Well fast forward to check-in, guess what??? We were in a smoking room! I explained to the man at the front desk that I had called the day before to confirm and he said "that's what you get when you book through Hotwire." Nice. So we had to pay $60 for an "upgrade" of the exact same room we were going to be staying in to begin with. We just moved up 2 floors...wow. Our room by the way was definitely not equipped with a king sized bed. It was obvioulsy a queen. The hotel decor was very modern but honestly not that impressive. The elevators were teeny tiny and you always had to wait FOREVER since they only had those two tiny elevators which had to make stops on like each floor. Room service was super expensive, but luckily I had read that the breakfasts across the street at E'leven were awesome. And they were! So overall, I'm very dissappointed with this hotel. Maybe it was because we "made the mistake" of booking through hotwire. And I still don't understand why we had to pay for an upgrade, yet we ended up in a smaller room two floors up?!!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathros
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotel i have stayed in. Great location. We walked everywhere. Room was spotless clean and the bed was soooo comfortable. Didnt eat in resturant but menu looked lovely. Was a lovely treat coming back to hotel after days sightseeing to have a yummy cookie/bun on bed after tturndown service. There is a really good place for breakfast called eggsperience which is only 2 streets away. Also Starbucks across the road. Would definetly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely updated hotel”
Reviews.Author: purduesara
Reviews.Content: The James is a nice hotel in a nice location. It has clearly been significantly updated. I don't know Chicago too well but the location was perfect for my visit. I got a great deal on the room through JetSetter so I jumped at the chance to stay there. The hotel is perfectly nice but has clearly been updated. It is almost as if they brought really nice, modern furniture and fixtures into an old hotel in need of a makeover. You can tell in the elevators and hallways that this is an updated hotel. It didn't bother me but had I paid full price for the room I might have been disappointed. The beds are very comfortable and they have Kiehl's products in the bathroom which is a plus. Nice flat screen TVs and a very modern feel. My visit was so fast that I did not go to the restaurant or gym but I did order room service which was good. I would stay here again but only if I got another great deal. To be honest, I expected a little bit higher quality hotel for a JetSetter pick but I would still recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel--just a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: Notaprimadonna
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the James which is about 1/2 block from the big Marriott where the conference I was attending was being held. I found a significantly better rate at the James than the conference rate offered at the Marriott, plus at the time I booked the James offered a free room upgrade and free breakfast every day either in the restaurant or in room. All in all, I was very happy with the choice I'd made. My upgraded King room was spacious and I really liked: the spare modernist furniture and fixtures; ;the nook with a small table where I used my computer; the design of the room which made best use of the space, including an ample closet with built in cubes/shelves; the art work (though I didn't much care for the used suitcase installation by the lobby elevator); the fact that my window could be opened; and the nightly turn-down service with a different type of cookie every night. There is also an exceptional gym for such a relatively small hotel with dumbells up to 75 pounds and a fair collection of quality equipment (though it's in the basement with no windows). My quibbles concerned the wireless internet service--free!, but painfully slow. When I registered my feedback with the internet provider--never botherd to tell the hotel staff--the internet provider sent me an email stating they had checked the service and it was perfectly fine, and that other guests were happily surgin the net with no complaints. I know that was BS as the speed on the desktop computers provided in the lobby--(they even had a Mac--was no better when I used it to print out my boarding pass. Other quibbles: my room definitely smelled of stale smoke, but I told the front desk when I went out that evening and they managed to improve it about 90% while I was gone. Also, my tub drain didn't work, but they fixed that too. Did not care for the flat modernist bathroom sink which was not very functional. Also I thought a boutique hotel of this caliber should have had an Ipod docking station instead of a CD player on the radio. On the other hand, the radio worked much better than most and pulled in the NPR station well. i should also mention that all the staff with whom I dealt were exceptionally nice and helpful, including the housekeepers and the room service person on night duty. I hat paying retail for expensive hotel rooms, but I'd have to say the James provided fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicho123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The James in early September 2010. We arrived quite late at night but were well received and up to our room in minutes. The room was a good size with a king size bed, extra seating area and a long bench for both our bags (hallelujah, no one ever has that). The room had a big high window which let in lots of light - or none if you rolled down the blind. Unfortunately our view looked down on airconditioners on top of the building across the road, but if you looked up you could see the city buildings - no biggie. The room was very modern and had a stereo and a big flat screen TV. The bathroom was pretty cool, very modern and clean. Our room was very quite at the end of a hallway. Our only complaint was that the entrance door and the door to the bathroom were very screechy which was a problem if one of us went to the toilet in the middle of the night (should have mentioned that to the hotel but we didn't). Our room included breakfast in the restaurant on the ground floor which had great service and beautiful food. We ate out for lunches/dinners. There was complimentary internet access in the foyer (love that) and the concierge staff were very helpful on a couple of occasions when we needed transport info to get to Wrigley field and a few other little issues. The hotel is close to lots of restaurants and only one block from the Magnificent Mile. The hotel doesn't have a laundry for guests who wish to do their own, but we were referred over to the Four Points Sheraton across the road, where we told them we were staying at The James and they arranged for us to go up to their laundry room (they only had one washer and one dryer, but there was no one there when we arrived). They also have a little shop beside reception where you can buy powder and they'll also give you change for the machines. Overall we had a great stay in Chicago and The James is somewhere we'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Learned the Hard Way that they still have Smoking Rooms”
Reviews.Author: justjayce
Reviews.Content: I had business meetings at the James. The hotel is in an great location and is an easy walk to many shops, nightclubs and other attractions. The lobby is simple and functional the folks behind the counter were very courteous. My corporate travel department booked the king room for me. I went up to that room (the elevators are a bit small) and the room was huge, with a nice bed, big bathroom, an unusual couch and other nice amenities. It was right about then I noticed the stale stink of cigarettes - and then noticed the ashtrays. I called down to the front desk and asked them to switch me, they did not have another king room and told me the only thing they could do is downgrade me to a room with two double beds. Knowing that I would be miserable in that smoking room I took it - and reminded myself to find out why my corporate travel folks did not make sure my preferences were met. The double room was small but adequate. The double beds were comfy and the shower was good. The sink was a unusual, it was flat instead of being a bowl and the water just kind of hung out in the sink. The closet in this room was tiny and I chose to live out of my suitcase. The television, while being a nice flatscreen, had too few channels to choose from. The room had a full bar and the turn down service at night provided me with a cookie on each bed and a full ice bucket. The blinds in the room were a nightmare - they rolled up just fine, but rolling them down was a huge pain and I needed to get a towel out of the bathroom to keep the metal balls on the chain from cutting into my skin. Overall a decent hotel, a bit kitschy for my liking, but if you need a non smoking room make sure its booked correctly otherwise you may be downgraded like me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all around”
Reviews.Author: wagnerlk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at The James. The room was beyond comfortable, the service was great as were the amenities. Great location, central to practically everything a visitor could want to do in Chicago. We didn't want to leave! (If there's anything I at all that I'd call out, it was that the room service breakfast wasn't completely delicious. It was nice, just didn't meet or exceed expectations)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT !!”
Reviews.Author: Coffee27
Reviews.Content: My twin sister and I stayed at The James and absolutely LOVED it. It was our first trip to Chicago and the hotel concierges were very helpful and very friendly helping us navigate our way around the city. They recommended great restaurants as well. The room was very modern but simple. The beds are super comfy. Thank you to The James staff for making our first trip to Chicago a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - well located”
Reviews.Author: bigb77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the James for 5 nights in August. Check in was a breeze and our luggage was waiting for us in our room. Very helpful and friendly staff all round. The room itself is nice and modern, the bathroom was large which made a change! However the only thing with the bathroom was the sink, it was pleasing to look at but was too big and flat and as a result it didnt drain properly. Beds were large and comfortable and the room we stayed in had a little nook with a couch and table where you could set up your laptop/write postcards etc.... Very well located, just a block from Michigan Ave and close to bus and train stops. It was a blessing in disguise that we didnt receive free breakfast as E'leaven across the street serves the most fantastic breakfasts (try the french toast!) All in all a very enjoyable stay and would def recoomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Fab location”
Reviews.Author: SantillanIgn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great service, smiling receptionists. The room was very nice indeed, very trendy and modern and super clean. I asked about late check out and they were immediately obliging giving me until 3 pm (after saying that since the room was free, it was no problem -never have I heard that before, it's always a begging exercise, not so at The James). The bed was superb, great bed clothes and the amenities in the freebies were lovely (Kiehl's). The location could not be better. Close to everything and wonderful to come back to the hotel through those doors. All in all it was a fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place that feels like home”
Reviews.Author: detigel
Reviews.Content: I am an architect and we live in a modern home which I designed. Though our house is a bit more high end than the rooms in the hotel, we really felt at home. Gone is the ugly cheap wood made to look like mahogany and bright brass fittings found in so many other hotels we have stayed. All white linens, light walls and a bathroom which is nicely designed. In addition, this place is clean. Location is wonderful, we had a mix of business and fun to attend to on this trip and all was within walking distance. The service was excellent, free Internet in the room, computers and a printer in the lobby. This was (in my experience) the first hotel where a perfect balance between unpretentious service and value was achieved.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Britboylovestheus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August. Hotel is modern and in a great location, with all the famous brand shops and department stores on your doorstep. Check-In was fast and efficient. My friend had forgotten her i-phone charger so they provided one even before we reached the room. I asked for hypo-allergenic pillows and ones were sent up in minutes (Trust me this has never normally been the case when requesting them in other hotels, im usually waiting forever!) Our room could have done with a very quick lick of paint to be honest. There were various scuff marks on the wall, a picture from above the bed had fallen down and the handle for the sliding door in the bathroom kept on coming off but these are only slight gripes and had no impact on our overall experience, im only putting it out there because for a hotel positioning itself in the luxury market these are the things that should be attended to! Would definately recommend the James Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: OrionSouthEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located for visiting the major tourist and shopping sites in Chicago. It is jus ta block or so from the Magnificent Mile with all its top notch shops and within comfortable walking distance of Hancock Tower, Navy Pier, Chicago River and plenty of nightlife spots. The entrance lobby was less impressive than expected but check in was quick and although we'd arrived very early the staff were helpful in trying to get us quick access to a room. We stayed in a junior suite which was of a good size, well-appointed and importantly clean and smartly decorated. The room had a well-stocked minibar which although we didn't use it was competitively priced compared with most hotels I've visited. The room had two TVs, CD/radio, safe and a comfortable bed. All in all this proved to be a perfect place to stay and we were very well looked after by the helpful hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: PB62757
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights at the James in early august. I recieved a complimentary updgrade on one of the rooms and was very pleased with it. No updgrade was offered on the second room. Nice sitting area, large bathroom and comfortable bed. I was disappointed that the bar closed at 11 but there are plenty of other places to get a late night drink. The 2 oclock check out is nice. It is within walking distance to many sites. The staff was helpful, offering a complimentary ride to Alinea where we had dinner reservations. I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse was Amazing, King Room was 'Meh'.”
Reviews.Author: retrophit
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to one of the Penthouses (on the second to top floor, why?) because of a late check in and it was *out of the world*. One of my top 5 hotel rooms ever -- automated blinds, huge tub, giant bathroom, full dining room, it goes on and on... Our second night (which we booked the next morning) we had to downgrade to a king room. It was your basic modern hotel room in a big city. Little of the penthouse feel carried over. Also, the restauarnt is great, Try the "brunch boxes'!! Yum.

Reviews.Title: “We were on a couples vacation from Tampa...”
Reviews.Author: Sizzlinwok
Reviews.Content: We were on a couples vacation from Tampa, FL. Great hotel for the value in combination with flight thru Expedia. Great location in the heart of downtown. Room was nice & the staff was very friendly. Flight arrived early & was able to check in to our rooms early. Amazing 24 hour complimentary gym. 1 complaint about the rooms, even though we were on the 15th floor we can still hear the street traffic so you can imagine the lower levels.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: MissPT
Reviews.Content: My partner and have just returned from a holiday in Chicago; 2 weeks at Hotel Monaco and 1 week at The James. There had a been a couple of snags at the Monaco (neither serious, good stay overall) so we were looking forward to the James. On arrival we were checked in promptly, and were told that we being upgraded. When we went up to the room we were intially a bit disappointed- it was a bit on the small side (but adequate), and on further inspection there were signs of wear; furniture scuffed in places, messy sealant round the window, a freyed bathmat and a hole in a pillow. We had to ask for an extra robe and slippers, both swiftly resolved. None serious and didn't impact upon our stay (bathmat and pillow covers replaced. Forgot about sealant). The design ethos, minimalistic, was perhaps a bit bare but it was modern and relaxing- Monaco had stripey wallpaper and red upholstery, so James was a nice change. Couple of other small things; late check out not possible (we asked for 2 additional hours. But they did keep our bags, so again, resolved) as the hotel was fully booked and the bikes were not available (as much our fault for not booking sooner). Overall our stay was positive. In the evening the room had a nice view over the city lights, turndown service with treats (tasty choc-chip cookies), very comfortable bed and the location is great. Plently of eateries and bars round about (we ate twice at Mia Francesca on Chestnut and Bandera on Michigan. Rockbottom Brewery is good pub option, food OK). No problem with noise, we were on 14th floor, but it is the middle of a city so expect to hear sirens etc. The bar makes a good cocktail, although one of the staff members was a bit weird and kept asking if we had a tab or if we had paid. Cocktail prices were reasonable, $10-12. We didn't use spa or gym. Spa quite pricey- as in UK hotels- but loass of places round about offering a mani and pedi for $40, but don't expect luxury! Trader Joe's across the road is good for supplies- health food bent, Whole Foods market about 5 minutes. We had breakfast, and very good coffee, from Eleaven across the road; bagels, muffins, omlettes etc. Further up on Clark there is a place called Tempo Cafe, classic American breakfasts which are available all day. Transport not as handy as the Loop, but OK. Most things within walking distance anyway (within 30 mins walk). In short, I'd recommend the hotel as long as the price was right (we got an offer through hotels.com). Room was nice, products lovely, service on the whole good and good nitelife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: etzv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the James in July for a family vacation. Very nice accommodations. The hotel is in a great location. I received a great rate through Hotwire. I believe the hotel can be quite pricey, so you may want to try Hotwire. Hotel provides robes, turn down service, and cookies each evening. Nice size flat screen tv, and bathrooms were very nice as well. We enjoyed our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “flawless !”
Reviews.Author: BroniaV
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Location was fantastic - we could walk to everything we wanted to see. great pillows and mattresses, room amenities and staff. Contrary to what I'd read here, we were treated like first class guests though we got a terrific deal on Hotwire. We had lots of questions and requests and the concierges handled everything for us - including getting tickets to a 'sold out' baseball game. The gym was beyond expectations - obviously someone very knowledgeable. Though, apparently hotels need to have a spa and/or pool for 5 stars, but other than those things, this place had it all.

Reviews.Title: “James hotel could use some color!”
Reviews.Author: dianegggg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James hotel for a 40th birthday. The location was excellent for shopping and restaurants, but also very loud. The room was horrible. VERY SMALL. We had a double/double and it was the size of a college dorm room, plus completely white walls and linens. Absolutely no color except for one accent pillow. It was very sterile and uninviting. We were on the 11th floor and the lobby for the elevator was dark and done in red and balck with minimal lighting. It looked like the entrance to hell, if not a haunted house. Staff was very nice and accomodating. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and elegant with excellent service but Very expensive”
Reviews.Author: pmsocc17
Reviews.Content: James is a beautiful hotel. Excellent location and clean, well-furnished posh rooms. Only the best toiletries, softest towels, cleanest, fanciest sheets. Staff was excellent - helpful and ready to do the extra thing at any time. On the negative side - this place is very expensive, separate charges for parking your car (and its not cheap!), no free internet (but they have a business centre that you can use). The restaurant in the hotel is nice enough but as is often the case, even the simplest breakfast items is ridiculously expensive. But there is no dearth of good eating options in the area. Recommended only if you feel like splurging a lot for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Get the suite if you can!”
Reviews.Author: EvanAgee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites and couldn't believe the view, the decor, or the bathroom! Everything was incredibly clean and modern. The amount of space made it feel more like an apartment than hotel. One of the best aspects of the hotel however is it's proximity to some of the best shopping and restaurants in Chicago. The valet parking was a nice service as well since parking in Chicago is such a nightmare. My only complaint about the room was the street noise which even at the fourth floor level was sometimes distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: probably the most contemporary hotel we have visited. Very comfortable bed, very modern furniture ( only had 1 chair in room, a red vinyl chaise) A few blocks from Michigan - very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern boutique hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: galetje
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful from the artwork to colors & fixtures & lighting. Were greeted by extremely friendly staff and accomodated with an early check-in request despite a busy weekend. Door-staff some of the best I've experienced (especially Scott). Beds are extremely comfortable, bathrooms immaculate with Kiels toiletries. Giant LCD television, stereo, wet bar & cute breakfast nook in room. Turndown service with room freshening in evening. Hotel is close to everything in area. Not soundproof so light sleepers/non-city dwellers may have issue with siren/city noises but not loud at all. One tiny complaint: poor quality hair dryer provided, no power or heat, take your own if you have any hair.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel does everything right”
Reviews.Author: IrishRovers17543
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the James Hotel for six nights in July.Although not a member of Leading Hotels of the World any longer,the hotel honored every bit of our reservation including a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite which was comfortable,quiet with a well stocked fridge and the most delightful, comfortable bed and bedding you can get in a upscale hotel.The shower is fist rate with excellent pressure. We arrived at 10:30 am after an early morning flight and to our surprise we were checked in immediately.During our next six days you begin to realize why the hotel receives high marks.Wi-Fi is free both in the lobby and wireless throughout the hotel.Free morning newspapers including the New York Times.Staff smiling and always helpful.Breakfast was a delight.Food was always well prepared.We had continental breakfast as part of our rate(a $26 daily value) which was also allowed to be applied towards other breakfast items such as eggs,pancakes etc.This was a nice touch. Location of the hotel allows you to walk almost everywhere.The El is two blocks away.Michigan Ave is one block.Chicago is a terrific city and our stay at the James could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at the James”
Reviews.Author: Robo34
Reviews.Content: The James was decent hotel about a block off of Michigan Ave in Chicago. It was close to all the shopping which made it nice. I've stayed a little bit further north on Michigan Ave a couple times and liked it better, but this location is not bad. As for the hotel, it was clean and comfortable. It was kind of a cool room, nothing over the top, but a little more trendy than a lot of other rooms. Our room had a King bed, and I would describe the room size as spacious for a downtown hotel. The service was mostly good. Check in was quick and easy. We needed extra towels and someone had them to our room in less than two minutes. The only problem was that our air conditioning was running at full capacity on a very hot weekend. It was a little warm, but they did try to fix it and got us a fan when we couldn't get it cooled down. No big deal, but we're not real high maintenance! Overall a good stay. Did the self parking about a block down from the hotel for $34/night.

Reviews.Title: “WE loved the James, you whould too.”
Reviews.Author: sschafe48170
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James the 4th of July weekend and loved it. The only, only negative that we had was that the beds are doubles and not queens. However, as most couples would select king size beds, and the 2 beds would be for corporate travellers sharing, this is understandable. From top to bottom The James is first class. Location is perfect, one block off of Michigan and 5 blocks from Water Tower Place. The staff made you feel welcome from the sidewalk on. The rooms are very nice, modern and well sized for Chicago. One very minor maintenance issue was handled promptly with just a mention tot he staff. They even have water and treats for those taking their 4 legged friends for walks past the hotel. STAY AT THE JAMES, YOU WON'T REGRET IT.

Reviews.Title: “Lively and Trendy !”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsPeter
Reviews.Content: Once you walk into the door and the reception area, you are impressed by the lively atmosphere...this boutique type of hotel lives ! Friendly welcome. The rooms are startling...you do not expect this type of room...very contemporary and unusual...the lofts have a separate media room ( type of bunker bed). A good steak restaurant is also on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “I was very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Debra0183
Reviews.Content: Apparently the building or doorframe had shifted making the door to the room very difficult to close. When I complained, the staff simply stated with a shrug that the door would have to be taken off the hinges and shaved down. Well it wasn't as if the problem started the day we checked in! The room also smelled of stale smoke even though it was suppose to be a nonsmoking room. Room was very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “luxury liberated from tradition”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: For the past few visits to Chicago, we have been staunch Ritz Carlton fans (see separate review). For this trip, however, we decided to split our stay between the Ritz and the James, enticed as we were by a bargain rate from a private sale website, favourable TA reviews, and the James' own attractive website. We were not at all disappointed. The two hotels have entirely different vibes but have great, friendly service and amenities. The James' motto, from their website, is "luxury liberated from tradition", meaning without the "traditional bonds of formality...constrained by excess and empty ostentation". As such, the hotel is contemporary and stylish, with interesting artwork in the public spaces and rooms. The hotel was redone as the James four years ago--it was another hotel prior to that, so this is an older building, as demonstrated by the 2 small elevators that are not too speedy. Think of the W hotel chain, but with overall better service. And the hotel's staff is a major strong point--they are uniformly young and attractive, but very friendly (some effervescently so), competent, and well-trained--all we encountered lived up to the hotel's motto. The place is pet-friendly too, with a bowls of treats and water at the entrance. The location, one block west of Michigan Ave. on the corner of Ontario and Rush St., is great--lots of restaurants and shops just steps away in any direction. A big plus--a Trader Joe's market is across the street. I would not consider this a hotel with substation views. There is and adequate fitness center and a small spa in the basement (no pool). There are a generous 5 guest-accessible computers. We probably had one of the smaller room categories, and it was fine--large enough for a sitting area with a built-in settee and table/desk, plus a Mies van der Rohe-like chair and ottoman done in red vinyl. The bathroom was small but stocked with Kiehl's products and eco-friendly soap. The bed was fabulously comfortable, and the turndown cookie treats delicious. We had wanted to try the restaurant for breakfast, but it didn't work out. We did order room service twice, and it is provided by the restaurant. The menu is an abridged version of the restaurant's--the food was tasty but not outstanding--certainly better and more interesting than standard room service fare. There is no newspaper delivery to the rooms, but there are complimentary copies of several papers in the lobby for the taking. There are also several cute Paul Frank bikes in the lobby guests can use for free--alas, we had previously rented bikes elsewhere for the duration of our visit, but the hotel gladly stored them for us. All in all, we had wonderful stays at both hotels for this trip. For a luxury chain like the Four Seasons (which manages the Chicago Ritz), traditional, formal service is a better fit for us. But it is always a pleasant surprise when a boutique hotel like the James can pull off a similar level of service with a more casual, modern air.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Modern Casual Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Happy_TravelerMPLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James Hotel for a long weekend and it did not disappoint us. The hotel location is ideal. We were able to walk to everything from the hotel without taking a cab, with the exception of a couple of restaurants in the evening (nice clothes, heals -it's better to take a cab than to rough it!). The concierge at the hotel was very helpful with restaurant reservations - he was able to get us a table at the famous Charlie Trotter's restaurant with only a couple days notice. I'd say the typical clientele at this hotel was younger (20-40s). There was a lot of energy at the hotel during cocktail hour with the bar being packed every night. Even though the bar/lobby was very popular it collectively had a low key vibe that made it very inviting and comfortable. We will definetly try this hotel again with our next trip to Chicago! RESTAURANT NOTES: Charlie Trotters: Although the service was exceptional, and the food cooked perfectly, the taste was nothing exceptional and we found that it was not worth the price or rave reviews this establishment has received over the years (we are foodies and are more than willing to pay for great food). Japanais: Asian Fusion and Sushi restaurant. Very trendy decor, good food, and romantic ambience. I wouldn't classify this as an authentic asian experience, but it was a fun restaurant that I would attend occasionally if I lived in Chicago. Le Lan: Smaller Vietnamese restaurant a short walk from the hotel. Intimate decor and ambience and excellent food. If you enjoy a non commercial dining experience and Asian food, this is a good choice while in Chicago. TRU: Very Expensive, but in my opinion woth every penny. We went to TRU many years ago and I still remember it like it was yesterday. The service is second to none ( I had a chair for my purse, and I was escorted to the bathroom - a little over kill, I admit). The waiter to customer ratio for us was 1:1 for serving the food; we had 6 in our party. The waiters placed and took away are plates perfectly choreographed as a team. The food was excellent, but not the best I've had. If you want a unique experience with one of the highest rated restaurants in the country this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Mag Mile Hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlando_traveler62
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a 4 day stay at the James. Very impressed with the details. Room is serviced twice daily, the hotel bar and restaurant are actually very good (specially for dinner and breakfast). Room decor is very modern with a white/brown theme. Free and speedy wireless (like all hotels should have). Staff is attentive and friendly, making you feel at home inmediatly. The only thing that I didnÂ´t like is that on the first night there was noise from police and/or ambulance sirens. I know downtown Chicago is noisy, Â´cause there is a hospital nearby, but on that particular night the noise woke me up twice. I think that the rooms windowscould probably need a little extra insulation. The bathroom products offered are high quality, organic products, way above the typical hotel offerings. It probably will cost a little more than another chain hotel in the area, but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “If you value great service..”
Reviews.Author: Princeton_Man
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The James for four nights in May. Great location and got a great room rate ($159) on hotels.com. The hotel has a very modern decor and there's great artwork all over the place. What really sets The James apart though is the level of service. Everyone who works there is very friendly and helpful and really goes out of their to make you feel welcome. This extends to pets as well -- they keep a bowl of fresh water and a jar of dog treats next to the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay at the James with an added touch of class!”
Reviews.Author: stellastarNY
Reviews.Content: Just back from Chicago for Memorial Day weekend with friends.....and a late celebration of my birthday.. My second stay at the James. I found a awesome rate that included breakfast voucher....first time at the restaurant and I will say the BEST selection of hotel breakfast menu that I have ever seen. Overally, the James is top rate. Very professional, friendly, attentive staff. Love the comfy beds...great location jus toff Mag Mile and tons of restaurants and across the street from Trader Joe's in case you need snacks for the room. The guest services staff included a nice greeting and cupcakes in the room to wish me a happy birthday. Nice suprise/touch! HIGHLY, highly recommend the James!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FastidiousZoe
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Chicago. I chose the James because the reviews were good and the rate was reasonable. We were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was extremely pleasant and very helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bath products were awesome. The bed was great. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: R_Danielsson
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early but we got one of our rooms right away and the other less than 2 hours later (still before normal check in time), and I believe the wait was only because we asked for two rooms in close proximity to eachother (got 1414 & 1416 - I prefer 1414, it felt slightly more spacious). Everything was just great, from the car service they use to the bath room products. And for a very reasonable price too. We had to take our son to the ER while we were there and the guys at the door really made an effort getting us a cab quickly and making sure the driver knew where to take us. Two minor hick-ups: 1. We asked for a crib, but never got one, but since the room had two large beds we never reminded them - our son would probably have ended up sleeping in our beds anyway. 2. I Got a call from front desk at 4.40 in the morning on the day of our departure, because apparently somone on the floor above (room 1515 irc) thought we were making too much noise. We weren't (we were sound asleep), and neither was anyone else in that section of the 14th floor. If they'd checked that first they wouldn't have had to call me and I would have gotten a much needed good night's rest before the flight home. Nice interior, full wet bar (and a minibar), very good housekeeping. I actually liked not having a desk in the room - but then again I was on vacation. WiFi included, might seem like a small thing, but I really cant stand it when hotels charge extra for an internet connection. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant (Primehouse) and enjoyed it - it is however a bit pricey. But, if you're travelling on a budget there's a Trader Joe's right across the street, a Whole Foods a few blocks northwest and another grocery store a few blocks southwest. There's even a McDonalds quite close. Check out time was 2 pm, which meant we could keep our rooms until we left for the airport. Normally we have to ask for a late checkout or storage room for the bags at least, it was nice not to have to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mczen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Deluxe King Suite. No desk to work at or to sit at to eat room service meals. The only table was coffee table height and the couch was some strange futon that was lower than the coffee table (!) and canted forward. Incredibly uncomfortable to sit at and ridiculous for room service meals or to work at computer. Since my room was configured like all the other Deluxe King Suites depicted in on line photos, I have to assume this design flaw with the couch/futon runs throughout the property. Bed was fine and bath was fine but I can't imagine why business travelers would rate this property well. The couch/futon seating is the worst I've encountered in a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: belletracy
Reviews.Content: This hotel had it all, great location, fantastic staff and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The James makes you feel very pampered, I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “High value gem”
Reviews.Author: PadieO
Reviews.Content: My first trip ever to Chicago ended with me staying here for 5 nights. Great location right in the heart of everything, really comfy rooms that feel a little like home and great service. I would whole heartidly recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TripAlwaysInWork
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago for my 30th birthday girlfriends getaway. I booked The James through hotwire.com for a great rate of $124/night. The location was perfect...all the shopping and eating we did were within walking distance. We only drove to clubs. Speaking of driving, the parking rate was expensive which is to be expected in downtown Chicago. The service was impeccable from valet, to the front desk, to concierge. Housekeeping did leave the dirty towels we left of the bathroom floor to be removed when our room was cleaned. The beds were extremely comfortable as we found it easy to take naps and difficult to arise from them. We stayed in a standard double room with no view which wasn't a big deal. I don't know how i feel about the flat square sink but it was in sync with the style. The in room bar was very tempting as they provided martini glasses and a shaker. The flat screen was cool as well as the channel selections. We loved the seating nook in the room and found it easy to adjust the room temperature to our liking. I could tell that the walls were thin but we didn't have issues with noise. I definitely recommend staying if you can get the a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Central, luxe and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: annbury
Reviews.Content: We spent four lovely days here, right in River North, which is to say central Chicago. We were able to walk or cab to all the sights and restaurants. Service was excellent and they take pets and gave our hound treats every day. We would definitely return. We were able to get a really good deal on Hotels.com which saved us about $70 per day.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: leitigre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mutton dressed as lamb. We're talking noise of the worst kind.. wild parties.. Our first room was located under a 'swanky' bar. There were people screaming and cars honking throughout the night. It was impossible to sleep. After complaining, we were moved to another room...there were a group of young men who thought nothing of coming back to their hotel room at 4:00 a.m. and partying like they were in the middle of a football stadium. This is the loudest most obnoxious hotel I have ever stayed at and, at close to $200 a night a complete and total rip off. You would be better off sleeping in a park, I'm sure you'd have a better night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: atraveller09
Reviews.Content: Rooms were well furnished and very comfortable. Comfy bed. Great mini bar that wasn't crazy unreasonable. They have Kiehl's toiletries. Staff was great. They have a small aveda spa there and my husband and I got 2 of the best massages we've ever had. Huge gym if you're ambitious. Location is perfect. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: EurekaSpringsFoodie
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, trendy modern vibe. Great location downtown, can walk everywhere. Had breakfast in David Burke restaurant, best smoked salmon ever, teas are overrated though. Nice trendy bar area, staff cordial and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful room, great service, awesome food”
Reviews.Author: travelling_mguest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after arriving in Chicago from the UK. We had a loft suite which was great for us and our 2 daughters (aged 5.5yrs & 2.5yrs). A low bed was in an alcove, complete with projection screen, DVDs were available to borrow from reception. The room was a reasonable size for a city centre. Room service food was awesome - the fries with truffle oil were the best! I did find the noise of the hotel a little distracting, we were pretty jet lagged, so wide awake in the small hours but not wanting to move, the hum of the aircon, the noise from the street, the room above turning their shower on etc. The service was amazing, everyone was very polite, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place, will return!”
Reviews.Author: Ticorella
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago, I flew there for a two-day meeting with colleagues from around the country. This boutique hotel blew me away. The service was top notch, every staff member I interacted with behaved as if they have been waiting all their lives to open a door for me or answer my question. My suite was so beautiful I wanted to move in permanently; two loft beds and funky, sleek modern furniture. Room service from the restaurant downstairs was of the highest quality. Meeting rooms were comfortable and the catered lunch and breakfast were excellent. The hotel is a quick walk from Michigan Avenue. I plan to come back with my husband, and book future meetings there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimrob47
Reviews.Content: Took my 18 year daughter for a mother/daughter weekend. The James Hotel was perfect for us. Modern, clean and very friendlly staff. We shopped all over downtown and this hotel was a perfect location to shopping and restaurants...Would highly recommend.....

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TabithaEastbourne
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel, it was everthing we hoped for and more, the staff are extremely friend, the hotel was very clean, in the bedroom, bathroom, the gym and restaurant. There were lovely finishing touches to the service like a little biscuit each night with a sweet treat for sweet dream message.

Reviews.Title: “If you can find a good deal for around $120/night (winter season) or $150 (summer season) then it's probably worth it.”
Reviews.Author: lacmck019
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Really long and detailed review... had some time on my hands today :) MY EXPERIENCE WITH THE JAMES HOTEL CHICAGO During the last holiday season, The James Hotel was offering a "Cyber Monday" special where you could buy their "James Credits" online to use toward your hotel stay, and the hotel would then match that dollar amount in "complimentary" credits (E.G. if you buy $500 worth of credits, they will give you another $500 worth for free). This sounded like a pretty good deal to me. The day before Cyber Monday, I went onto the James Hotel Website to read about the credits-- the fine print stated that the credits were good for one year and didn't mention any blackout dates or restrictions. Ok, that's good because I wasn't planning our trip to Chicago until mid April 2010. The next day I went onto the website and bought $500 worth of credits. I didn't even notice that they had added one or two new sentences to the "terms and conditions" section- which now stated that complimentary credits were good until March 31st, 2010 and subject to certain blackout dates and restrictions, and can't be used in conjuction with any other offers. I guess my mistake for not re-reading the terms. So as soon as I realized this, I immediately called the hotel and explained that I hadn't noticed they added to the "terms and conditions" section, and could they please either let me use the credits two weeks past March 31st, or refund my purchase. The hotel would absolutely NOT budge or try to work with me in anyway. So I was down $500 and stuck with $1000 worth of credits to a hotel that I had to use by March 31st. My husband and I are currently living in Europe where he is employed at the moment. He has a break and we're going back to the States for the month of April. We both love Chicago and vacation there often, so that's why I bought the credits in hopes to use for April. I always think I'm being a great bargain shopper, but it often times backfires in my face and I end up wishing I would have just paid full price! So now that I was stuck with these James Credits, my husband and I talked it over and decided they should not go to waste. He said I should go to Chicago with a friend of mine so they could be used before March 31st. So my friend and I took the vacation that my husband and I were supposed to go on in April! I'm lucky he was so understanding. When I went to the James Hotel website to book our room, I saw they were selling rooms for less than $130/night... and on another travel site those rooms even included perks like a $50 GC to use toward the restaurant/room service! But because I was using my "James Credits" I was forced to book the highest rate which was over $200/night- so I wasn't even getting much of a deal at all! Upon check-in, I asked the front desk lady if there were any rooms larger than the others because my friend and I would be staying for 6 nights and I had heard from reviews that some rooms were bigger, and if you ask for them you can sometimes get those ones. She was pretty rude and just raised her eyebrow at me and said they're all the same. The room we got was tiny. I don't know if the lady did this on purpose because she was angry I asked for a bigger room, or if they were all just that small. Now my friend and I were both coming from Europe where everything is a bit smaller, but every hotel that I have stayed at in Europe has had a bigger room/bathroom than the James Hotel. My friend and I decided to upgrade to a loft suite for an extra $80/night. The suite was nice, although some of the furnishings seemed a little cheap to me. PROS: -Great location. If you don't care what your room looks like or how big it is, and you can find a good deal, may as well stay here because the location is one of the best. Starbucks, Trader Joe's, a sushi restaurant, and cute little breakfast place right across the street. The hotel is a block from central Michigan Ave, and a block from the Luxe Cafe... where we definitely ate a couple times.... -The housekeeping staff did a great job and were very friendly. They even organized my bathroom stuff that I had left out all over the place one day. Everytime we got back to our room, it seems like it had been magically cleaned. I think they did service twice a day (I don't know if that's because we had a suite or if they do that for all the rooms). And they somehow always knew when we weren't in the room because they never bothered us like at a lot of other hotels where it seems like they're banging on your door at 7 am and yelling "housekeeping!!!" or walking into your room when you're in the shower. -Beds are really comfortable (comparable to the Westin Heavenly Beds) but I like soft and squishy, so if you like firm mattresses, these may not be for you. -Kiehl's bath amenities were a great perk. I never use the toiletries that hotels provide, but this was the first time I actually wanted to use them instead of my own stuff. Really high quality products. CONS: -The whole debacle with the James Credits, which alone, will probably prevent me from returning to this hotel in the future. The lack of flexibility they showed, especially since this is a boutique hotel and not a huge chain. It would have been easy to contact upper management and make an exception to let me use the credits in mid April. Usually boutique hotels can offer this kind of "special treatment" in certain circumstances. -Small guestrooms, small bathrooms, small closets... the double beds even seemed to be somewhere between the size of a double and a twin, and not a true double -Much of the furniture in the guestrooms and even in the loft suite seemed cheap and flimsy... I'm pretty sure a lot of it was from IKEA -Rude and somewhat arrogant front desk staff -The bar/lounge in the lobby doesn't stay open late enough. I think it closes around 10 pm which then forces you to go to J Bar, which is more of a club than a lounge where you can just sit and have a casual drink -J Bar had kind of a pretentious vibe. Definitely saw a lot of creepy old men with what looked like Russian mail order brides-- not the hotel's fault though, obviously OVERVIEW In my opinion, this hotel has been over-hyped in reviews. It's a very average 4 star hotel, nowhere near 5 stars. It's location saves it... as well as the awesome housekeeping staff. Stay here if you can find a good deal and plan on spending most your time outside of your room- which most people do anyway- but I always love coming back to my hotel room after a long day out and about, and feeling like it's so much nicer than being in my own bedroom... and this place did not give me that feeling, I would have rather been in my own bedroom than the small, starkly furnished/decorated guestrooms at The James. I never used the gym or spa, or ate at the restaurant, so I can't comment on them. Other hotels I have stayed at in Chicago- I will list them in order of the ones I liked best: *InterContinental on Michigan Ave- great location, feels very luxurious, great breakfast buffet *Westin Michigin Ave- not quite as luxurious as the InterContinental, good sized rooms, our dog stays for free at is treated well, good location *The Talbott Hotel- now this is a true boutique hotel, smaller rooms but still felt luxurious, had evening snacks like cookies/hot chocolate which was a nice perk *The Hyatt Regency on E Wacker- great customer service, mentioned we saw a beetle in our bathroom upon check-out and they comped our parking for the entire stay (don't take advantage, people!), good breakfast buffet, unfortunately they don't allow pets and we usually travel with our litte guy I would probably choose The James over these two: *Swissotel- nothing really stands out, a bit further off Michigan Ave *Radisson Michigan Ave- not very nice rooms according to my memory Next time we travel to Chicago, we'll either stay at the InterContinental, Westin, Talbott, or try Hotel Monaco or The Fairmont- I've heard good things about them. And on the next SPLURGE trip, I would love to stay at The Penninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place"”
Reviews.Author: abomb526
Reviews.Content: Took my hubby there for his birthday, nice chic modern hotel. The room was medium size and it had a great gym in the basement. The folks were very professional but not as friendly as I would have liked. The concierge didn't have a lot of suggestions so we found a lot of stuff on our own. There is a Trader Joe right across the street to get supplies which worked out amazing. The bar area was nice, some vibe but not a lot. Gret location, close to a lot of places to eat and things to do. You can walk anywhere in Chicago, it's easy to get around. Hotel was safe walking back late at night and I loved the quiet of the room. Good choice for couples, friend getaway but think not a family place.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: wanderwoman10
