Reviews.Content: The James is a cute, mod boutique hotel. The modern furnishings are nice. The room and hotel has nice small touches. The fitness room is quite nice. The staff are very friendly, very helpful. There are also spa, bar, lounge area, restaurant and it has a nice central location. It has far more character than a chain business hotel. Only two small complaints: no full-length mirror anywhere in my room and it is a bit dark. But all-in-all, I would absolutely stay here again. It was also a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Windows = Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Thalina
Reviews.Content: I would come back to this hotel except for the fact that thin windows allow road traffic noise in at an intolerable rate. We were on the 10th floor, and hearing the details of a dump truck at 5 am or a cop car at 2 am wasn't appreciated. Thicker windows would help block out the noise. The work out room was top notch. Kiehl toiletries were appreciated. There's a Trader Joe's across the street (good for picking up healthy food).

Reviews.Title: “Nice because it's a bit different”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great central location. Staff is extremely friendly, especially the doormen and porters. Rooms are of an unusual shape, a bit like a caravan and spacious. The "mini" bar is a full stocked bar with large bottles. Bathrooms are of good size with amenities from Kiehls. The decor is very modern so if you don't like modern hotels you won't like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ecb080
Reviews.Content: We were VERY pleased with The James. Everything from the rooms to the service was perfect. The staff was really helpful and the location couldn't have been better! Not a big hotel but certainly a lot to offer! We were able to check in almost 3 hours early with no problem. The concierge was VERY helpful with dining suggestions. Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: 1cabin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The James while attending the Housewares Show...this hotel is a great find! Great location right off of Michigan Avenue....plenty of places to eat within walking distance. Clean....clean....clean.....We got a great price on Travelzoo and will definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: aks21
Reviews.Content: From the start our stay at The James was amazing. We received a great deal off of Travelzoo for $129/night, PLUS $50 in food and beverage coupons. Upon arrival we were checked-in well before the correct time and received a high room, which was great. We had a great experience with the servers at Prime Steakhouse and they had fantastic food. J Bar was ok, it was a little too "cool" for me, but everyone there was pleasant. The hotel is a block from Michigan Avenue, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: renrutac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king room at this hotel, the bed was very comfortable. The rest of the hotel room is quite small, which is to be expected in a boutique hotel. Everything was impeccably clean, and we had excellent front desk and in-room service. Also, the Kiehl's bathroom amenities were a nice touch and were of excellent quality. Our only complaint was that the heater in the room was pretty loud and there must have been a hospital in the neighborhood because there were sirens on the street all night, every night. Also-parking is quite expensive ($40/night), but the hotel has such a great location that you can walk to many great shops and restaurants within a mile or so of the hotel. I was happy to pay the parking fee to not have to pay additional parking fee everytime I wanted to go out to eat or shop.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: printcess64
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival you know you are somewhere special. Every employee is courteous and knowledgable. Rooms are amazing. Bed is so comfy and everything is immaculate.Great shower! Right within walking distance to everything you can imagine including a Trader Joe's across the street. Definitely will stay here again the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Four-and-a-Half Stars Really”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: There are just a couple of things that hold me back from giving the full five stars. One is that many of the rooms are interior-facing and have absolutely no view [except into other rooms, which may or may not be OK depending on who is occupying them]. The other is the simple fact that the bar for hotels in Chicago is so high, and this place isn't quite as slick as the Peninsula or Four Seasons. That said, it also doesn't cost nearly what those places do, so the value for price is terrific. I'd recommend registering your e-mail with them on-line. I got a great e-mail offer for $129/night with a $50 food-and-beverage credit that was a wonderful bargain. The lobby is long and narrow, with a small lounge to the left just outside David Burke's Primehouse. That restaurant offers amazing lunch bargains, so it's certainly worth checking out midday. Their side of steamed asparagus with shallots is amazing. My great rate was actually for a studio suite--not just the standard room. When I first walked in the room, I wasn't sure about it, but after hanging out a few minutes, I really got to like the layout. The sleeping area is very small, far away from the door. It's really kind of a nook, with just the bed and two wall-mounted shelves that serve as bedside tables. There's also a flat-screen TV there. Most of the space in the studio suites is devoted to living area, which, when you think about it, is really where you want your space. There's also a huge bar with full bottles [not minis] of several liquors and a well-stocked fridge. There's plenty of shelf and counter space included with the bar, as well as an iPod-ready stereo. There's lots of glassware, but only martini glasses and highballs. No wine glasses or swizzle sticks. Oh, and ice is provided by room service. I'm on a campaign to get hotels to put ice machines on each floor. No one wants to have to call and wait. The room decor has a mid-century feel, with low-slung, clean-lined furniture. The color scheme is mostly brown and off-white, with big splashes of red for accent. Most of the lighting is on dimmers, so you can adjust it to your mood. All in all, it's a pretty attractive room. The bathroom is narrow with a tub/shower combo, but plenty of counter space. It's been renovated since it was the Lenox Suites, but there's a little wear and tear showing, such as chips in the bathtub molding and an unraveling robe. This was a quick trip, so I didn't get to check out the spa, gym, or JBar. Next time. Service is of the friendly and efficient type, rather than the formal and polished as at some of the highest-end places in town. Had no issues with getting what I needed, though. Room service breakfast was prompt, tasty, exactly as ordered, and in large portion. Others have commented about problems with the elevators, but I had no long waits at all. They are smallish, though. Location is perfect, two blocks from the Grand Red Line stop, one block from the Mag Mile, across the street from a Trader Joe's, and two blocks from a P. F. Chang's and a Joe's Seafood if you want chain food. If you're a hotel freak like me and want to check out some others, you're in pretty easy walking distance from a huge number worth looking at--Trump, Conrad, Peninsula, Park Hyatt, Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Drake. The Coq d'Or at the Drake is the perfect old-school hotel bar. They started serving ten minutes after Prohibition was repealed and the bartenders all look like they've been there since that day. If price is no object and you must have the best in Chicago, check out the Peninsula. If you're looking for the point where price and quality cross on the grid, look no further than the James.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m3guy
Reviews.Content: took a weekend trip with my wife. got a great rate with valet included, paid a couple extra bucks for the larger room. staff was nice, workout facility was great. room has current decor, but was starting to show some wear. watch the concierge, she suggested a pretty bad restaurant to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveChicago
Reviews.Content: The thing that makes this such an enjoyable place to stay is the staff who were all excellent and polite and the service was impeccable. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable but it was a little small and the water in the bathroom was not very hot. Other than that it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TKCA
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with superior service and amenities. The room was well-appointed in a contemporary style. Hotel furnishings are modern and comfortable. Staff was helpful and fluent in multiple languages. The hotel restaurant is supposed to be very good, but we didn't eat there. It was busy every night however and appeared to be a hot spot. Location is in the heart of downtown Chicago - about a block from the Magnificent Mile. There are numerous restaurants very close, and of course shopping as well. Also, there is a Trader Joe's right across the street for any grocery/toiletry needs.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: J2810
Reviews.Content: Most of the James hotel's best points have already been detailed in the many previous reviews. However I still felt the need to add in my opinion. The James is definitely one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, I would not consider staying anywhere else in Chicago, I could not fault it in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SandsOfClifton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I lived in Asia for a number of years and our benchmark for hotels is usually against the impeccable service and standards set by organisations such as as the Shangri-La etc. Needless to say we are usually disappointed when setting such a benchmark against hotels in Europe and North America. However the James Hotel is a major exception to this rule! Every great review about this hotel is thoroughly well deserved. We booked a standard room with a European breakfast included at an excellent rate well below $100 per night and we requested a high floor with a view. We were amply accomodated with a spacious, light room on the top floor of the hotel. The rooms are contemporary but extremely comfortable and well appointed. The only small gripe is that there is limited wardrobe/drawer space since we checked in for 14 nights. All the staff are incredibly pleasant and helpful - they actually seem to enjoy what they're doing (neither does one get the impression in any way that they are simply angling for tips!) The use of a DVD player and access to a good selection of DVDs was a great bonus. We also requested a second mini fridge in the room and that was delivered immediately. The location of the hotel is simply fantastic for the Mag Mile and access to shops, cinemas, dining, bars etc. is the best! Don't waste your money anywhere else! Stay here! It is simply one of the best hotels we have stayed in regardless of budget!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James!”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 16-19 Novemeber 2010 in Loft King Suite #1122. A hip hotel with a cool sleek design in a great location. Staff fantastic; very friendly and helpful. Entrance and lobby really trendy. Quick efficient check-in. We had booked a Studio King suite but were upgraded to Loft King suite. Large and wonderful with a media room/lounge area, living room and separated sleeping area. Brilliant good-sized bathroom with shower and bathtub. Media room really cool with a DVD projector and Bose surround sound system. Another large flat screen TV in living room and in the bedroom. Complementary wifi. Design very cool and room super comfortable. Nice wetbar. Excellent amenities. Sufficient clothing storage. Our room had view towards backside with no nice views which only negative. The bar hip and trendy. Plenty of people but not disturbing. Restaurant with nice dÃ©cor and excellent food. Very poor european breakfast included in price. Excellent fitness room. Maybe only snag elevator wouldnâ€™t take you all way down so had to pass reception/bar area. Concierge very helpful. Great stay in wonderful Chicago. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Wonderful Location - Wonderful Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: cjstpaul
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and found everything to be absolutely wonderful. The rooms are beautiful, modern and CLEAN. Nice touch with Kiehl's products in the bathroom. Turndown service at night with a different sweet was also a nice touch. The most impressive thing about the hotel was the staff was so friendly and personal - from the doorman who recognized us the next day and remembered where we needed to go, to the concierge, Bill, who was outstanding in providing us restaurant recommendations and shopping info, ANYTHING and everything, to the friendly front desk staff, and even the bartender who was an expert on the great steaks at the connecting Prime restaurant. The location is ideal, across from a Trader Joe's if you need a bottle of water, or a snack, a Marshall's across the street, to the Magnificent Mile 1/2 block away! The hotel is pet-friendly, and it was a nice touch that they had a container of dog biscuits right outside the door, and always one laying on the sidewalk for a dog "walking" by. Little friendly touches like this make a great hotel. Staying in this hotel was an absolute pleasure - I would go out of my way to go back for a weekend to enjoy this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly and easily one of the best hotels I've ever come across.”
Reviews.Author: thefinchster
Reviews.Content: The James is easily a 5-star hotel, truly one of the best I've ever stayed in. The minute you step onto the sidewalk from your taxi The James is there for you, from opening doors, carrying your luggage, to checking you in, making sure you have all the necessities you need to ensure a comfortable stay. We were checked into room 604, which my mother wasn't too happy about since she was afraid we would be disturbed in our sleep from traffic below - but we had nothing to worry about, since we slept comfortably all 4 nights, without hearing a single peep from outside (or the hallways). The only noticeable sounds you might hear are from next door when they're taking a shower - and you only hear that if you're in the bathroom. I didn't have a problem with the tiny elevators, but they could be a little bit bigger and faster. Our room (I say "our" because we noticed some rooms were bigger/smaller than others when we took a peek during turn-down service) was big enough for 3, minimal, simple, and modern, just like the rest of the hotel. The bathroom was a bit small, but who cares? 'Cause the best part? The James is amazingly, fantastically, awesomely CLEAN. I've stayed in enough hotels to know that sometimes the maids get super lazy and don't give a crap about keeping the rooms clean. But the housekeeping and turn-down service (delicious cookies every night!) at The James is top-notch. Since The James is a boutique hotel, the employees (specifically the doormen) recognized us and often greeted us by our names - which was very impressive. There's a Trader Joe's across the street on one side, which is super convenient if you want to grab a quick snack, lunch, and/or dinner. There are plenty of other restaurants near by such as Grand Lux Cafe (across the street), if you want something a bit more formal. There's also a Marshall's, which came in super handy for us because by the third day, my mother wanted a pair of sneakers 'cause her feet were so tired from walking in heels. And when it rained? Marshall's was crowded 'cause everyone was trying to purchase an umbrella! The James is also just a short block away from the Mag Mile. Again, The James is truly and easily one of the best hotels I've ever come across and I would definitely stay here again, no doubt about that.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: Smairy
Reviews.Content: This is such a lovely hotel! We stayed with friends during the New Year. The staff go out of their way to be welcomming and helpful and really make you feel at home Rooms are really spacious and the Kiehls toiletries are wonderful. I also loved the nightly turn down service and the little cookie left on your pillow. The beds are fabulous..I cant describe how comfortable they were! The location was excellent-close by to some really brilliant restuarants (try the Mexican a few doors done-food was to die for!), and just one block from the Magnificent Mile which meant all shops were easy to get to-perhaps too easy! The bar closed very early which was a bit of a disappointment but we survived. Apart from that one small gripe- an A+ hotel

Reviews.Title: “Finest Boutique Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: fierydragon
Reviews.Content: The James is just our style - modern, sophisticated, and service-oriented, without being pretentious. It is more than a bit like the Mercer in NY, without being cold, and without the outrageous cost. Our room was large, beautifully lit, and wonderfully appointed, and though it was a king bed, I don't think it was special beyond that. Great TV and bathroom, too. I've been in almost every hotel in Chicago, and this is one of the very best. If you can find a deal here, stay. You can only do better if you are at the Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Much Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: spencermfi
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend The James to anyone (we ourselves were directed by a local's recommendation). The design, comfort, service etc were all exemplary. Likes: All the basics were covered very well, from check-in to check-out. A. Location was great (although there are many options in the area). Design was excellent. Lots of nice details and not too quirky like some other boutique hotels. This place was PRO. Great relaxed bar. Although the design is high-end, it was very welcoming and comfy. Amazing bed+linens. Dislikes: There was some wedding party there that clearly liked to smoke WEED. I was getting a contact high in the elevators! That said, once in our room we never heard or smelled anything. Bar closed too early - before midnight on a thursday! JBar club next door, which they said was good was HORRIBLE. That said, the overall experience was stellar. A great value too!

Reviews.Title: “Close to ideal”
Reviews.Author: flyingfish182
Reviews.Content: The staff at the James Hotel offered exceptional service which gives one the feeling of a boutique hotel. Our room was not large, but very comfortable. Besides, who stays in their room when visiting Chicago? It is conveniently located, close to the Magnificent Mile with fabulous dining establishments to suit any palate nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary rooms with great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Yarnbuilder
Reviews.Content: The rather plain exterior of this old building, hides a little gem of a hotel., which we stayed at for four days at the end of August 2009. Rooms are spacious, with the exception of the bathrooms, however how much time do you spend in there on a holiday? The rooms are contemporary in style with some interesting pieces of furniture, such as the chaise lounge. It is located just one block from the Magnificent Mile, up by the water tower end. So nipping out to do some shopping and then bringing it all back again is simple, without the need for taxis etc. We used this hotel as a base for trips down to Indianapolis motor speedway (for MotoGP, about 3 hours drive south) and so did not use the restaurants or other facilities, as we were always out and about. However the other good thing about the location is that is is close enough to a highway entrance / exit to be convenient, without having all the noise. If you want somewhere different to eat, try the Cheese Cake factory, at the base of the John Hancock Building. The insides of which are like being sat inside a cheese cake. The portions are massive and the cheese cakes are to die for!! However the best place to eat has to be the restaurant on the 95th floor of the John Hancock building. The view from the Signature Room restaurant as night falls over Chicago is fantastic. Better still was the Fillet steak and other courses. Book early and enjoy, its worth the price just for the food, never mind the view! The only down side for this hotel is that its not great at providing tea (The drinking sort). Being British this stuff is really important to us!! The hotel was not the cheapest, or the most expensive, however to us it represented the best mix of location, service and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for a Chicago Getaway. Period.”
Reviews.Author: carycomm
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The James and I'll definitely return again. Aside from it's great location near Michigan Avenue and all that Chicago has to offer, The James itself is just a wonderful hotel. The staff is friendly and very accommodating and the rooms are fun and modern with beds that are to die for. I went with a group for a mom and daughter trip, and the teenagers immediately sought out the BOSE sound system and cool projection TV. I didn't have time for the amazing massage in their spa that I had on my last visit, but there's always next time! Eat at Primehouse - the restaurant in the hotel - at least once during your stay. You won't be sorry. I love the workout room- it's nice and spacious - not something you see every day in a hotel. Everything was just top notch and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: francophile619
Reviews.Content: For the price I was not really super impressed. Our room was was an ok size, something I would think of as really great in Europe, but a little small in the US, even in a big city. Check out was sort of a nightmare. It took nearly 40 minutes to get our car out of valet.The food in the restaurant was pretty good and the staff in the restaurant was great when you could get them. We were at our table for over 20 minutes before we even got water. And another 20 minutes between the waiter describing the menu and until we could order. The location was really good for Michigan Ave. shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ferocity
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because every time I stay I can count on excellent service, a clean room and a great stay. The restaurant is fabulous, and the staff really goes out of their way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Something to look forward to”
Reviews.Author: JordanV
Reviews.Content: Travel for my business is pretty flexible. We pretty much have our choice of major cities to work in, but for some reason we are always drawn to Chicago. I'm pretty certain it's because the James is such a fantastic place to stay. I look forward to the clean rooms and crisp lines, the nightly homemade cookie on my pillow, the delicious breakfast options in the restaurant, and the fun vibe of the lobby. I even miss the Kiehl's products when I leave. But what makes the James stand out is the service. While I've only stayed a handful of times, I'm always warmly greeted with a "Welcome back" upon entering. The staff has gone well above the call of duty, including driving my forgotten power adapter to my meeting across town. After only 2 stays, the staff began upgrading my room with each new visit. I can't recommend this great spot enough, and I hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “modern yet comfortable”
Reviews.Author: limeynyc
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect to get around the downtown area. The service of this hotel is impeccable. Everyone was extremely helpful and professional from the doorman to the front desk to the room attendants. The beds were the best thing in the room. Very comfy and cozy. I want to buy one for my house now. I do wish that the hotel had humidifiers to offer guests. Chicago in the winter can be extremely dry on one's body. One final critique is that the shower temperature was not consistent. The temperature fluctuated to extremely cold to extremely hot throughout numerous showers. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Buffed112859
Reviews.Content: Dispite what other are saying, this was one, if not the best Hotel stay in Chicago I have had. I travel to the Big City about three times a year for pleasure and The James rates up with the best. I was upgraded and the staff made the stay worth my special weekend visit. I don't believe you will be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor, shame about the lifts”
Reviews.Author: Sal123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the James over a weekend while working in the Chicago area. The location was fantastic for shopping and sightseeing. My room was on the 14th floor so I didn't notice any of the noise that other reviewers have mentioned. I liked the decor (modern) and found the room comfortable and the free wireless very useful. The toiletries (Kiehl's) were particularly nice. We ate in the restaurant and it was OK. The main problem with the hotel was the lifts - I ended up waiting for my colleague for 15 minutes on one occassion as one of the two customer lifts was out of action and the lifts are tiny. I would also recommend that the staff not correct British guests when they use the word "lift" rather than "elevator" - after 15 minutes of waiting this is quite irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good service”
Reviews.Author: sibi4
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights, from Nov 9-14, room 1004. It's a 2 queen beds room, booked on the hotel website, with an internet special offer (119$/night including taxes). The room was very clean, nicely furnished, not very large (as expected, there was no desk), but with lots of amenities, comfortable beds. The main room lights are above the beds: they are either ON (and they make quite a bit of light if one person wants to sleep), or they're OFF (then you can't read at all). I broke a mug on the very first day, and we were left with only another mug for the remaining 4 days. These are about the only (minor) faults I can find with James hotel in Chicago. The location is perfect, the price was very cheap, the staff is friendly. Most of all the room is clean and the beds are great. Free wi-fi in the rooms. I asked for a late check out (from 12 to 1pm), I was given another extra hour and some more time, with no hassle. I'll certainly go back if in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but LOUD”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMomandThree
Reviews.Content: For our mom's weekend away, this was a fun, hip and conveniently located getaway. This would have been a 4 star rating across the board, but for the very noisy noisy rooms. At first I was on the 6th floor, and the street noise (cars going by, alarms going off, people talking/yelling) was unbearable. I usually sleep through a LOT, but I couldn't even begin due to the noise. I imagine the flimsy windows have something to do with it. They moved me up to "the penthouse" when I asked for 1) ear plugs (sorry, don't have them) and 2) a room change (perhaps, in the morning). The penthouse was similarly thin-windowed, but being that much further, the street noise was more subdued. So my tip: visit the James, but bring earplugs for sleeping. You never know if you will get a room near the street level (even on the sixth floor it was terrible!!!) or if you will be on "the wedding party floor". BTW the lobby bar closes earlier than other bars, like around the corner. Strange. I must mention the excellent concierge services - they had great access to restaurant info., friendly non-pretentious, but professional service. The cabs and hotel car were super easy to obtain, and it was fun to be able to walk to a lot of terrific places. The beds and pillows were also incredibly comfortable. Be aware the typical room does not have a tub (just a very nice stand up shower). My stand up shower in the penthouse had a broken attachment, but forgot to report it to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “On the surface, a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARESQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The James for a weekend getaway. My partner had stayed here on two previous occasions for business and liked the property. The location is ideal if you like to wander Michigan Ave. Rooms are comfortably appointed and clean. We had a King Suite which provided ample room if a bit oddly shaped. Bed and pillows are top-notch. The bar is comfortable but a bit small for a hotel of this size as we had a hard time getting a seat on both Friday and Saturday nights for a pre-dinner drink. Gym is very nice and spacious with high quality equipment. Staff is friendly and accommodating. I have only two complaints. We spent most of Saturday shopping and returned to our room to drop off bags at about 1 pm. The room had not been refreshed. I notified the front desk and was told someone would clean it immediately. We went back out for about 2 hours and returned to a still-dirty room. I called the front desk again. This time someone was sent to clean the room albeit while we were still in it. The night before our early-morning departure, we placed a breakfast order and requested delivery between 6 and 6:30 am. As we had to leave the hotel by 6:50 am, we had little time to spare. When breakfast did not arrive by 6:35 am, I placed multiple calls to room service (no answer) and the front desk. I was assured that breakfast was on its way. It finally did arrive but we had less than 10 minutes to eat. Needless to say, it was not a pleasant $45 meal (with taxes & service charge). I mentioned this at the front desk upon check-out and believed the hotel would waive the cost--it didn't. All in all, not enough negatives to dissuade me from staying here again but certainly not yet a top-of-the-line hotel in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Iloveyoga123
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at The James. This is going to be my hotel for all my trips to Chicago. I loved it! The hotel is perfectly located. It is in the heart of Chicago, one block from the Magnificent Mile. I walked everywhere from the Art Institute to the Gold Coast. The room adds to the hotel's charm. I had a studio loft that was like a little apartment. There was a stylish sitting area, a fully stocked bar, and a comfortable bed. The hotel has all the amenities of a luxury hotel for half the cost. There was a spa, restaurant, 24 hour room service, turn-down service with cookies on your bed every night. I truly enjoyed my stay, and look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms retained strange smells..and it wasn't me..”
Reviews.Author: wrightdad
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the basis of its location and all the positive reviews for it. I found the location fantastic - close to where I wanted to be, close to Metro and good food. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. When the tv remote needed to be fixed, they were there in mere minutes with battery replacement. When I needed a cab, it was quick and easy. My issue was with the room itself which had a distinct negative odor to it. They quickly and switched me out with a different floor and room, but sadly a lesser version of the odor followed. Something travelling through the vents? I don't know, but it was enough to make me not want to stay there again. Landed right on a wedding party floor. Crazy loud up until 4am. My fault for not complaining, but it was certainly the talk of the hotel in the morning. And not the good J Bar kind of talk. Perhaps the James is a little classy for me, but next time I'll take one of the major chains in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The James is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: robren88
Reviews.Content: This place was a fantastic deal. We got a great rate through a 3rd party travel website. The staff was very attentive, rooms were great, beds excellent. Outstanding location, great restaurants very close. We stayed here several times when it was the Lennox House Suites and it has really jumped into the stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: lafamilleaventureuse
Reviews.Content: We just returned from several days stay at The James. It's only two blocks from Michigan Avenue- Maginificent Mile. Bathroom is stocked with Khiel's products, decorated in very clean lines. The staff couldn't be nicer. We got a very quiet room at the end of the hall- easy to walk either to Michigan Avenue, Millenium Park or to catch the "L"/CTA/Metra. I would definitely return and highly recommend this hotel. The bed is SO comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern and elegant”
Reviews.Author: KelsoKM
Reviews.Content: The James was fantastic. The hotel room was spacious, as was the bathroom. Great service and great location made this a good choice for us. We were within comfortable walking distance of shopping, restaurants and Millenium Park. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept on and we loved the modern feel of the furnishings and the platform-style bed. The bar is a little small, but otherwise, we really liked this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cali-weekender
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the James. Check in was easy, the gym was fantastic and the bed was comfy. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: kek
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the James twice now for a fun weekend in the city with friends. From the moment I walked in the door to the moment I sadly checked out I was impressed both stays on multiple occasions. The location is ideal to shopping, restaurants and nightlife within walking distance. Cool and kind of funky decor but blended with warm classy accents that really pull it all together. Rooms: Stayed in a studio suite one visit and a loft suite the other. The loft is really more room than one person needs but I loved it anyway! The studio suite was great as well. Love the Kiehl's products and the beds are so comfortable! My first visit I had requested they swap out the feather pillows and duvet as I am allergic. On the second visit without even asking ahead of time, it had already been taken care of on arrival. That is customer service!! On property restaurant/bar: David Burkes Primehouse, ate there once for dinner, once for appetizers/snack and twice for breakfast. Probably one of the top three steak places in the country. Great for appetizers/snacks and they make a great breakfast too. J Bar/Lobby Bar - both a bit on the small side but really hopping every evening. Loved both stays and have found my new home away from home in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable & Modern”
Reviews.Author: CHItoSTL
Reviews.Content: My second stay at The James in the last year for a conference, and enjoyed my stay again. The staff is extremely friendly; accomodations minimalist yet comfortable. The Keihl's bath products are plentiful and a definite plus! The food is very good, wait staff in the hip bar/restaurant area are attentive and overall, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was fantastic, facilities need some work”
Reviews.Author: mbentonfl
Reviews.Content: The James is a beautiful, contemporary, boutique hotel that is in a great location. All of the service; door, reception, maintenance and housekeeping; were fantastic. They have issues with the plumbing and the bathroom doors. Also there is a very large, plastic window shade that gets too hot in the afternoon sun and makes the entire room smell like burning plastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, close to shops, restaurants”
Reviews.Author: trio77
Reviews.Content: Very cool, modern hotel in a nice location. You have to walk through the bar at the end of the day and it can get techno loud and crowded with bar patrons. The room had nice amenities and was quiet, as requested. Had some technical issues with their computers and had difficulty getting assistance. During a rainy summer downpour, they ran out of umbrellas and said "sorry!" so I ran to Eddie Bauer and bought one for $5.99 on clearance, luckily.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HGM915
Reviews.Content: My sister, father and I stayed here while visiting Chicago to look at colleges. From the time we checked in, the James was absolutely fabulous- the decor and feel of the lobby are modern and gorgeous, and the check-in was quick and friendly. The rooms are CLEAN, spacious, and well-appointed. The bathroom is really nice, with a tub/shower combo and large, shallow sink as well as a huge closet and full-sized mirror. The bath products were Kiehls, generously sized, and the soap was environmentally friendly (as was the keycard, made from recycled paper)! The concierge (Bill, I think) was great, and even though we couldn't get into Topolobampo he suggested a great alternate (Vermilion). The proximity to public transportation is good but not fantastic, it's a few block walk to the CTA station, but you only have to transfer once to get to Evanston (although a cab is recommend to get to the University of Chicago). Additionally, the breakfast at Primehouse (the restaurant in the hotel) is amazing- the fill-your-own doughnut holes are incredible and fun, and the rest of the food (omelets, eggs, breakfast meats) is delicious. They also have a great tea menu and excellent white hot chocolate. The James is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James”
Reviews.Author: mcarollo13
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Right in the thick of Chicago. Near Michigan, Rush, walkable to almost everything. Train station nearby, great shopping, Starbucks and Trader Joe's across the street. Over the top service from conceirge, bellmen, room service. Everyone was so nice! Hip decor in rooms - cool media pit. Comfy beds, nice bathrooms, this hotel has it all!

Reviews.Title: “A great place in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Kajeygirl
Reviews.Content: I searched everywhere to find a hotel that would have everything I was looking for: a little luxury, clean and modern, close to public transportation and all of the sites for a good value. I found it with The James. The hotel is only 2 blocks from the Red Line, and just enough off Michigan Ave where you were close to so much, but was still quiet enough to sleep (we could just hear the Black Eyed Peas and Oprah during her block party). The rooms were bigger than I expected, and well appointed, with the bed being comfy (a must!). We actually got a free night through a limited time offer, which made The James a great value. Either way, I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, hip, hotel with EXCELLENT customer service to boot!”
Reviews.Author: Molls84
Reviews.Content: I, along with four other girls, hosted a bachelorette party at a gorgeous little suite in the James Hotel. Prior to leaving for a night on the town, we had 20 people over for drinks and appetizers. Not only was the hotel in a great location and our suite was spacious and cute, but The James Hotel had the most helpful and courteous staff. They did everything from help us with our 30+ bags that we brought up to filling up our coolers with ice to carrying items on and off the trolley. If we called and requested something from the front desk, the item was at our room within a couple minutes. When we got back at night, the staff brought up extra blankets, pillows, etc. I only wish I got to stay and enjoy the hotel for longer. I will be recommending the James Chicago to anyone who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bill_in_Guelph
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the James Hotel July 20 to July 23 2009. Hotel was 1 block west of the Miracle Mile - great location for everything. Room was a good size but no drawers for clothing. Very Euro-modern. Hotel has very accomodating staff and good restaurant. Nearby Corner Cafe's were perfect for breakfast. One was a block east and a block north; the other was 2 blocks south. It was a 10 minute walk to Navy Pier. Fantastic place. Took the water taxi to the museum/aquarium/planetarium for $7. Each attraction is worth a day unto itself. Name a store/retailer and it is on the Miracle Mile. Went to the bar level in the Hancock Building. Best view apparently is from the ladies washroom but the bar and lower level restaurant both offer a really good panorama of Chicago and the waterfront. Millenium Park is fascinating. The Chicago waterfront is unbelievable - roller blading, walking, biking are all accomodated without being run over. The waterfront itself has no high rise building blocking the view. Had very good dinners at both the Cheescake Factory and Joe's Seafood and Steak. We will return to Chicago and the James for another holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irelander007
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice big comfortable room. Good location. We got a great deal through 1800hotels.ie Free wi-fi in room and free print service. Handy for printing online check-in or booking confirmation documents.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely designed rooms...very close to Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: MeganOlson
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nicely designed, and very clean. The hotel is just a block or so away from Michigan Avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: aduf
Reviews.Content: I picked the James Hotel based on price (got a great deal on Hotels.com), design, and location. Upon arrival, we were greeted and immediately checked into our room even though we arrived 3 hours early. The rooms were nicely designed and spacious. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and the concierge recommended 2 great restaurants (Shaws and Prosecco) and the Chicago Line Architectural boat tour. The location of the James is ideal...it is 2 short blocks away from Magnificent mile and we were able to walk everywhere. We only ended up taking a taxi one night as they have a courtesy car available which we were able to avail of. It was a pleasure staying there and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VLASF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend in August on my way back to the west coast from a business trip. This hotel is outstanding. I was surprisingly upgraded to an apt/suite room with large living area, bedroom and bathroom. The Kiehl's soaps and shampoo are a real treat. The mid-century modern furniture was very tasteful and the beds are super comfortable. The service was excellent. I was trying to find a misplaced package that my secretary sent via UPS and the staff was very attentive and helpful. The bar and restaurant are excellent also. No complaints. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: number1hedge
Reviews.Content: hotel james is a hip hotel, expensive, but really nice. we first had a suite, very nice, but downgraded to a smaller room with a view, that we liked even better. lots of windows, with a view of ontario street. trader joe's is across the street. contemporary furniture, but really nice. great bed, large t.v., spacious, great bathroom ammenities and shower head. they have turn down service also, they brought us ice for the ice bucket and cookies. we had the sunday dimsum brunch, and it was great! lots of food and drink, and you just sit there, and they bring it to you. you just need to make it back to your room for a nap! you won't be dissappointed with the james, it's really nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and hip just not too functional!”
Reviews.Author: DebandBill
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was because we stayed at the Trump for a few nights before we moved to The James that the hotel seemed designed for munchkins. The room, bathroom, closet, drawers, and elevators were absolutely tiny. I like trendy and hip but appreciate a comfortable chair for reading, a functional workspace, and separate lights on each side of the bed. Bench seating and one long fluorescent light over the bed was problematic for two sharing a room. The coffee maker was stored in the closet along with the safe, two robes, and a luggage rack - so much for clothes! Having said that, the location is superb close to shopping on the Magnificant Mile and the Grand el station. The art is fun. The restaurant was good for breakfast with a menu that matched today's needs - smoothies, granola and all the usual egg dishes. Staff were welcoming but the promised restaurant list from the concierge never appeared and ice is only available at the evening turndown service. Yes, you are supposed to be able to request ice but it too never appeared . . . We stayed at the Trump, Monaco and The James on this trip and I would rank The James third on the list.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: hyena301
Reviews.Content: Even in these tough times it's worth it to get quality hotels. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Luxury”
Reviews.Author: eakNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed one night of the Labor Day weekend at the James in Chicago. We had our first two nights free on Starwood Points at the Sheraton a few blocks away. The James is an intimate place in size and tempermant. The service is great, the rooms spotless, the facilities small but offer all you could need. The toiletries were Kiehl's - very nice. The bed linens were crisp and white, towels larger-than-most and fluffy. The bed was a little soft for me due to the feather mattress topper, but I conked out no problem. The location is great for nightlife, music and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Even breaking up couldnt ruin this hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great rooms, kiehls skin care... even breaking up with a thankless looser didn't ruin the experience....

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service...except for one glitch”
Reviews.Author: Lucysayshi
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The James for 3 nights with my husband. From the second we pulled up to Valet we were whisked away to check in where (no joke) 3-4 staff members were attending to us. I thought, this is unreal! The hotel was a hip, clean, efficient and in a great location. The only negative thing I can say is that, Tony, their concierge was very rude. From the minute I sat down with her she was stand offish and arrogant--nothing like the rest of the staff. She reluctantly gave me some restaurant suggestions and looked irritated when I asked for directions to them. The next day, Marco, another concierge was courteous and very helpful. The David Burke restaurant in the hotel was amazing! Go for brunch for sure. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely visit again--and stay away from Tony :)

Reviews.Title: “Place this Hotel at the top of your list !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sabretooth
Reviews.Content: The James Hotel exceeded my expectations (which, my wife tells me are exceedingly high to start with LOL). The location is excellent in relation to the Magnificent Mile. The staff at all levels: from the door, desk, concierge, cleaning and management were very congenial, helpful and genuinely appeared dedicated to making hotel guests feel welcomed and comfortable. The lobby and other public hotel areas were chic and very tasteful.....they were â€œout of the ordinaryâ€� but certainly not â€œoutlandishâ€�â€¦..very refreshing in comparison to the bland and ho-hum dÃ©cor in many chain brand hotels IMO. The room was terrific. We were upgraded to a loft which is almost 600 sq. feet. It has chic furnishings and a cool media centre with a 72 in. projection DVD. They even loan you dozens of DVDâ€™s to view. The cleaning staff comes in twice a day. Bathrobes and slippers are also provided. We would definitely return to this hotel. Extremely good value and 5 star service by staff.

Reviews.Title: “i never stayed,but!!”
Reviews.Author: peterboxall
Reviews.Content: i nevers stayed at the hotel,but my daughter and her partner did As a treat for them we arranged for them to have champange and chocolate waiting for them in their room on arrival. this did not happen,as somehow my emails got misplaced for what ever reason and [many were given.] I emailed the general managers assistant JENNIFER HAMPSON.she could not have been more helpful,they recived the champange foc,and were also treated to wine and cheese platter a few days later. We all know that things do go wrong,its how a company deals with it- is when you find out what sort of company they are. my daughter and her partner were upset that our surprise fell flat, but jennifer sorted it all out.she really is a credit to the james chicago. They really enjoyed their stay and im sure they will leave a report soon.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel with good customer service - after a false start!”
Reviews.Author: Kerrybox
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights at The James in late August/early September. We got a great deal on the holiday, flying from London through Expedia.com. On arrival we were given a twin room-having booked a king room. We informed reception that this was the case and were told that even though the expedia booking stated a twin room (the booking in fact showed a king room booking as we had the paperwork with us and showed it to the staff) we could be moved rooms. We were sent to another room, to then be told this wasn't the right room for us to stay in and we had to move to another floor and yet another room. We finally go the right room....third time lucky!!!! The room itself was very clean, modern and comfortable. The kiehl products in the bathroom were lovely and the housekeeping staff were very good (with a turndown service in the evening) Overall the room was very impressive and the hotel itself was very nice. There is free internet in the reception which was useful. On the day we arrived, my boyfriend had arranged a surprise Spa Treatment for me (which I highly recommend-the Astra Spa staff were lovely), However, when he went down to the concierge desk to ensure everything had been booked he saw an email on the reception's printer from my parent's company. Thinking this odd, he saw that it was asking for confirmation that the "arrangements" had been sorted out for our arrival. Without us knowing, my parents had arranged (weeks prior to our trip) for champagne and chocolates to be in our room on our arrival. This had not happened-in any of the 3rooms we were sent to!!!! My boyfriend enquired into this oversight. The concierge made the excuse that he was waiting for the wording from my parents to accompany the gift-not that he knew what it was at this point! Needless to say, my parents were very disappointed that the surprise meant for our arrival was not in our room nor had been actioned. My mother had indeed been sorting this out for weeks and had had to send countless fax and emails due to the failure of the staff to confirm receipt of payment/order. Furthermore, on contacting the hotel on the failure to action the request my mother was told that it was due to our room change-another excuse! (the wording had in fact already been sent over too, contrary to the original excuse) We did eventually get our champagne and chocolates (without charge to my parents) and in addition, halfway through our stay were delighted to receive a handwritten note from the management with a bottle of wine and some cheese and biscuits. A special mention must go to Jennifer who liaised with my mother on the problems and was determined to make up for the oversight. We were highly impressed with this customer service. Overall the hotel is good and the service which many people on this forum have mentioned did materialise. One thing that could be addressed is the arguing we encountered in the reception. On a number of occasions we witnessed the staff arguing (quite loudly) with each other-we felt this to be particularly un-professional. I couldn't help but feel that, as suggested before, guests who book through agents do not always receive the same customer service as those who book directly. However, having said that the staff did make up for the original mishap very well. I would visit the hotel again, the location is great and Chicago was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel - but bathroom wasn't great”
Reviews.Author: agrippina17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James hotel for 4 nights in late August 2009. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay; the hotel is comfortable, stylish and well-located. We booked this hotel because of a special deal so we got a great price for what we received. The room was large and very stylishly decorated, with a really comfortable kingsize bed and a huge flatscreen tv. The storage space was perhaps a bit limited for two people (two small drawers and a hanging rail). Two small cookies were left in our room every evening as part of the turndown service, which was a nice touch. The minibar was extensive and there was free wifi access and a CD player in the room. There was a bit of noise from the street, which didn't bother us but might be a problem for light sleepers. Unfortunately, the bathroom was small in comparison to the bedroom, and the bathtub was so shallow that it was very difficult to use (about half the depth of a traditional bath). This was the only major problem with the room (and only matters if you prefer baths to showers!). The free toiletries were great, though - generously sized bottles of Kiehl's shampoo, conditioner and grapefruit body wash and lotion. The hotel is right behind the Magnificent Mile and 2-3 minutes' walk from the Grand stop on the El Red Line. There's a popular steak restaurant attached although we didn't try it. Service was generally good and they fixed a problem with our room within 5 minutes of us reporting it. I'd have liked to have been able to give this hotel 5/5 because it is a great place - but the bathroom was a bit of a disappointment. I'd still definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Example of Midwest Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Enachi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The James for her belated birthday weekend and we could not have asked for anything better. The deluxe king guest room is a clean, modern design with plenty of space and the minibar, with both "airline" bottles and a selection of larger bottles of top shelf liquors was very convenient. If you are a fan of modern/contemporary design that is still comfortable and liveable, you will love the lobby and bar area. But, what makes The James special is the service and hospitality. Examples: 1) A couple days before arrival, I was contacted by the customer experience concierge inquiring whether I needed anything special during our stay. 2) The guys who work the door and front of the building are very helpful and genuine. I could not believe how many times they would pick up a conversation we had begun hours, or even the day before. 3) Very knowledgeable concierge who gave us some excellent advice for shopping away from the Mag Mile. (fyi. Wicker Park) I travel constantly for business and pleasure and could not be more satisfied with the way we were treated. It is always easy to remember a bad customer experience, but this is an excellent one that we will remember for a long time. You gotta meet James!!

Reviews.Title: “They know all about you and take care of your every need.”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: I had the wonderful pleasure at staying at The James in Chicago twice! Before the Mondrian in Scottsdale, AZ it was a converted Holiday Inn called The James. Though it had a great pool....it looked like a Holiday Inn. HOWEVER, when they decided to close The James in AZ and open a flagship in Chicago I was desperate to go. I was in Chicago for work and Hotwired the hotel. When I called I asked if they were the same James that used to be in Scottsdale. I also mentioned I stayed at the AZ hotel numerous times. Immediately I was transfered to the GM's assistant. "Is this the Marshall that likes champagne and chocolate chip cookies." I was floored she knew this information. Then she offered me something called a "media suite!" When I got to the hotel it looked NOTHING like the old Scottsdale location. The decor was very modern and housed a wonderful art collection. When I entered the room I couldn't believe my eyes. I had a king size bed on a large platform with a gigantic TV. There was a living room with a sofa, another plasma TV, a wet bar and extra chairs. Then I discovered why this was called the "media suite." There was another queen size type bed on the other side of the room with a projector that projected DVDs on the wall!!! Also, they offer Kiehl products in the gigantic bathrooms. I was in heaven. Four months later I decided to spend my birthday their with friends. This time I was given an amazing gigantic apartment suite. It was beautiful and larger then the media suite, however, I still think the media suite is the coolest concept. The staff treated me like royalty and brought robes and slippers for my friends who had to stay and crash. I miss The James in Chicago. On a side note, GM Richard Patton, is one of the best in the business. He knows how to run a hotel and personalize each visit. This GM is everyones friend AND confidant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoShannon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend the weekend in Chicago to celebrate our anniversary, and I had been looking at the James for awhile because it was attached to David Burke's Primehouse. From the moment I called to make my reservation, I knew this hotel understood what customer service means to a consumer and a picky one at that. From the pre-arrival dossier, to the special sweets from the staff to kick off our anniversary weekend and a hand written note thanking us for staying at the James, this staff is well versed in the long lost art of customer service. The rooms were well appointed and the beds comfy and warm on a cool weekend. The walking distance to Michigan Av is a huge plus. From the front desk to the cleaning staff, the staff here is top notch! And David Burke's Primehouse is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: _j_023
Reviews.Content: First time to Chicago, lovely city and a great hotel. It is stylish, bright and great service. Free internet access and excellent concierge service - booking trips, restaurants, recommendations of bars etc. Though we were sad to be going, he may have been relieved! Kiehls products in the spacious bathroom, and bright clean rooms. Good location to walk around the city day or night. Loved the city and hotel, were there for 5 nights and wish could have stayed longer, definately would return.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, snobby staff ruined our stay here”
Reviews.Author: chinakeli
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not worth it. From the moment we walked into the hotel lobby through check out, the staff were rude and contemptuous. Rooms were only serviceable, and certainly did not live up to the pompous self-descriptions on the website. The bathroom porthole and sliding door were odd and inconvenient. The 'fitness centre' was tiny and poor. We would not come here again.

Reviews.Title: “James and Chicago: lovely”
Reviews.Author: marco_mazzei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at James at the beginning of a long trip along Us, for our first time in Chicago. The hotel is as the city is: elegant and full of design. Everything in the room has a sense and there are a lot of nice details: stuffs to prepare a perfect Martini (yep, in the room), great Kiehls' products, a giant Lcd tv, design cushions, big mirror, and more. Complimentary coffee machine, and radio-cd-Ipod music device. Good Wi-fi Internet access, complimentary business center with pcs and macs (I mean: no charge for connecting to the Internet or printing documents), fully equipped gym. For breakfast, lunch and dinner: the hotel's restaurant is really god, but a little expensive. If I have to find something I didn't like, I can say that the lobby could be better: not the best way to welcome customers, but it is really a little thing.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool, very fun, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: fussytraveleruk
Reviews.Content: The James was a favorite hotel on my cross USA trip. We stayed here during the Lollapalooza music festival and decided to splurge on a nice hotel in this city. We were not disappointed! We booked the studio room with a king bed and separate sitting room area. It was spacious, but the couch was not comfortable to sleep on - we slept four in the bed, and everyone from front desk clerks to the maids were very helpful (especially with extra towels, soap, etc..) Free computers in the lobby and free printing were so helpful for our concert tickets and boarding passes, check email and look up maps. Cool place, with hip modern design. Friendly helpful workers. Good value! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Love the James”
Reviews.Author: fleurr
Reviews.Content: The James was a random spur of the moment choice for us but it turned out to be great....it's all very new and rooms are incredibly spacious. Super comfy bed's too. Nice big tv's,ipod docks and other cool stuff. The proximity to the mag mile is great too...all the shopping you can dream of only a block away! We got a fairly good rate but i've noticed the rates lately seem a little excessive....for us the best part of the hotel is def Primehouse! and being able to get david burke room service! Even if you never choose to stay at the James make sure you go to dinner there..it is absolute perfection.I was eating there just a month ago and noticed they had a great sunday roast family style special too. Had a manicure at the hotel salon which was pretty average. Lovely girl though.We have since found better located (for us) places to stay in chicago but I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the James again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tulip_ae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the James Hotel for three nights to celebrate our anniversary in Chicago. The staff at the hotel were great, they upgraded us to a apartment style suite as an anniversary gift and continuously checked with us to make sure we didn't need anything. The hotel room was elegant and well appointed with as many bathroom goodies one girl could need. The shampoo and bath supplies were generously put out each day even if you didn't need any more. The bed was comfy and the room in general was comfortable, modern and enjoyable. We ate at the hotel's restaurant on the night of our anniversary and the wait staff were very attentive and even sent out a complimentary dessert with "happy anniversary" written in chocolate across the plate. All in all, no detail was left unnoticed and we enjoyed ourselves very much at The James, would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: travelIQ101
Reviews.Content: I recommend this place to everyone. The staff and location are great. It was comfortable and worth every cent!!!

Reviews.Title: “James Offers Everything You Need In Chitown”
Reviews.Author: VTS64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the James for 3 nights over what was a very busy oversold weekend for the hotel. Upon check in we were upgraded to suite 1220 just for being a member of Leading Hotels of the World. The service level never diminished and there was always a concierge or front desk staff available to assist without a wait. I found the Staff at the James to be extremely efficient, friendly, knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile. EXAMPLE: Concierge Bill M. recommended a very nice Italian restaurant down the street called Quartino and called ahead to guarantee seating was available.. While eating our lunch an order of Bruschetta was brought over by someone other than our server which we had not ordered and thought was a mistake. We sent it back. Our server than returned with the Bruschetta and explained it was compliments of the James Hotel Concierge. Not only was it a pleasant surprise but we were thoroughly impressed. The other thing I liked about the staff were they did not make excuses or try to justify why something had not been done. Upon returning one day at 3 PM from shopping our room had not been cleaned even though we had the housekeeping sign on the door. I called down and the staff immediately apologized and said we will send someone right up which they did. No " sir we are very busy, oversold etc excuses like you get from other hotels" the James apologized and corrected the problem. The rooms are comfortable (especially the beds), clean, quiet, nicely appointed (except for the shabby little Ikea dresser in one of the closets) good quality towels and robes and Kiehls products. Location is excellent, walking distance to everything from Millennium Park to Lakeshore drive, Michigan Avenue, Red Subway line Grand Station and Restaurants galore. Trader Joes right across the street is convenient and the housekeeper explained if we wanted to store something in the honor bar just remove an item and place on the bar to make room for our items and we would not be charged as the honor bar is not on a sensor. Did not eat at the restaurant or use the spa but enjoyed the lobby bar. Jbar is nice but not our scene, tries to be too much like a club but is really just a poser bar. Abbey the restaurant manger offered to give us a tour of the dry age room but we did not have time. I met Abbey one morning when I was wondering the hotel and peaked my head in the restaurant to see what it looked like. she noticed my coffee mug from my room in my hand and offered to refill it. Evidence the staff at the James anticipates it's guest needs and ask if you need something before you even ask for it. I am torn as I am tempted to stay at the Wit Hotel the next time I visit Chicago but will find it hard to resist the James and their amazing staff. Bottom Line: You cannot go wrong with the James and it is a very solid choice for lodging in Chitown. I highly recommend giving it a try.

Reviews.Title: “wished we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: emilieanne30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment-style suite & it was beautiful. There was a separate dining nook which was great for breakfast the next morning (delicious!). The staff was attentive & courteous. Check-in & out were easy & quick & the valet made sure to ask if we needed any directions as we were leaving. My only regret was that we could only stay one night!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: figgynewton
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel with fun, modern rooms and a great location! We had a great time, however, when we arrived at the hotel I was informed that even though we had contacted the hotel and requested a non-smoking room (my wife is pregnant) that since we booked through Hotwire they were unable to accommodate the request. They then told us that we could have a non-smoking room if we were willing to upgrade (for a fee) - which basically said to me: "we have a non-smoking room...but not for you, since you booked through Hotwire." We ended up paying the fee (I didn't want my pregnant wife to be in a smoking area of the hotel) and got a room with two double beds (of course we had requested a King sized bed, but it was either that, or pay even more for a non-smoking king room). Bottom line: this is a great hotel with a great location, but don't expect any decent service if not booked directly with the hotel (and based on their check-in service, I'm not sure if you'd even get good service if you did actually book through the hotel). I'm sure that there are better hotel choices, near Michigan Ave, where you'd get much better service...

Reviews.Title: “The James was a fabulous oasis on a long business trip!”
Reviews.Author: KristyJ
Reviews.Content: On a recent 10 day business trip to Chicago I stayed at the James. The staff was amazing, always helpful with packages, directions, restaurant reservations and special requests. Great guys at the door were always there to help. Room service was quick and always very tasty. We ate at the fabulous steak restaurant a couple of times and it was wonderful. Even though I was there for a business trip the hotel would be great for a Chicago getaway. It's just a block and a half away from Michigan Avenue and all it's shopping, plus there's TONS of restaurants within a block to 4 or 5 blocks of this hotel. Easy walk to Navy Pier and other Chicago attractions as well. Rooms were very comfortable, especially the beds and bathroom; clean, modern styling. Kiehl's bath products were great too. My only complaints would be that the bathroom was a little small and the business center is open to the lobby and could get a little loud when trying to work and there were sometimes alot of people just checking their E-mail in there when I was trying to get alot of work done. Great stay though!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllaKToronto
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and I really think it is a hidden gem. Great location for shopping, sightseeing, great restaurants nearby. Rooms are very nice and modern,and very friendly staff. First trip to Chicago and my 2 daughters and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The James is THE place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PTV
Reviews.Content: The James is an amazing hotel. The location is perfect! You can walk to everything. The area is safe and there is a lot going on. There are many restaurants and shopping right at your door. The hotel is trendy and cool. The staff was the best! Very helpful, knowledgeable and accommodating. The James also has a fantastic restaurant on the premisis...best steak!!! Well worth looking into this hotel. It was our first visit to Chicago and we will stay at The James next time too. It's not one of the boring chain hotels. We loved it at The James!!!

Reviews.Title: “The James Delivered!!”
Reviews.Author: Desilu
Reviews.Content: First time going to Chicago and we couldn't have been happier with this hotel. Great location off the Mag Mile. Great rooms---clean, spacious, bright. Great service---the conceirge Toni was awesome. Very accomodating to late check out (it's usually 2pm as it is!!!)---that's incredible!!! The restaurant in the hotel David Burke's Primehouse was delicious and had the most incredible steak I have ever eaten. Try the doughnuts---awesome!!! You can't lose staying here. Has an awesome gym!!! I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable with an unexpected (pleasant) touch”
Reviews.Author: Verely
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at the James every time I happen to be in Chicago. There are other good choices in town, but nobody has what the James offers: superior service - aka class meets efficiency -, metropolitan design and comfort with an attention to details I found only at the W in Seoul, and what always plays a role meaning a convenient location ... Then they get to you with small unexpected touches that make the difference ie: I was about to take off and drive North, it was a hot July day...one of the staff members handed me a bottle of water. A small gesture. Unexpected and appreciated. The management AND the staff understand what we expect and more importantly, what we need. AND they consistenly execute against that.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultra Swanky, Uber Cool James Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeBeat
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights in the ultra swanky James Hotel. Located in Chicagoâ€™s premier shopping district, The Magnificent Mile, this hotel is the epitome of cool. Upon entering the hotel you are greeted with the sounds of jazzy deep house dance music. The decor and the ambiance of this hotel reads uber chic. At check in Iâ€™m given an environmentally friendly room key card made out of recycled cardboard. This is the first of many environmentally friendly features that this hotel has to offer. I do have to admit that I was not fully impress by the customer service that was given at check-in. The front desk attended was very dry and unwelcoming, he didnâ€™t say much to me and did not explain how to get to the hotels hidden elevators. However I was determined not to let one persons dry attitude affect my over all view of the hotel. Entering the Apartment Suite (room number 1108) my first reaction is to be turned off by how small the suite is. At only 650 square feet the Apartment Suite isnâ€™t much larger that the standard rooms. However my disappointment is short lived after seeing the amazing view from the bedroom. The room looks straight out to Michigan Ave. and looks even better at night. As an amenity you will receive a plate of gourmet petit fours, cookies, a 350 ml bottle of wine and a personalized hand written welcome note. The room comes complete with a fully stocked bar. The bar has everything from vodka, pop, water, nuts and even a vibrator. Thats right. If you look hard enough youâ€™ll find an adult pleasure kit hidden inside the bar. In your room you can access free wifi if you bring your computer. Internet is also available through the rooms television for a charge. If your traveling for business and internet is a vital part of your stay be prepared to be frustrated as the hotels wifi is really slow. The few times that I did use my computer I found myself quickly giving up due to slow loading speeds. You can also rent tons of movies but at around $14.99 a pop, whatâ€™s the point? Go enjoy the city of Chicago and buy that movie for $9.99 when you get home. When you get to the hotel try channel 42 on the TV. Can someone tell me whatâ€™s that all about? Strange but funny. My favorite feature of the room is the huge spa inspired bathroom. It was expertly designed as has plenty of storage space if needed for extended stays. The shower has two heads. One that allows for the overhead rain effect and another that is handheld but can also be prepped up as a regular shower head. The shower also has a small window that houses a spectacular view of the city. There are many other areas of the hotel for you to enjoy. Thereâ€™s the JBar that is open Wednesday through Saturday (I didnâ€™t get to enjoy it because my stay was Sunday to Wednesday morning). However at night the hotel lobby becomes some sort of a bar in itâ€™s own right. They serve drinks in the lobby and it seems the place to be after dusk. Inside the James Hotel you will also find a high tech gym with personal trainers available, a full service spa, and the well known David Burke's stake house (sorry that I can't tell you how the food was, I'm a vegetarian so I didn't bother). Here are a few tips to make your trip even more enjoyable: 1. Although the in room bar looks great and is very tempting avoid the urge. At $3 for a can of coke and about $42 for a mini bottle of Grey Goose itâ€™s not worth it. Directly across the street from the hotel is Trader Joeâ€™s grocery store. Trader Joeâ€™s is famous for their cheep wine shop and organic foods. If organic or wine isnâ€™t your thing, less than a block and half way youâ€™ll find a Jewel Osco for hard liquors and ready to eat foods. 2. Are you looking to spend a night out on the town? While the James Hotel is in a great location, thereâ€™s tons of shopping and restaurants nearby, but there are not a lot of bars or clubs. If you are looking for a great night out donâ€™t worry. Just walking distance from the hotel you will find Chicagoâ€™s Red Line subway train. From there you can easily access the best bars and clubs the city has to offer. Take the red line to the North/Clyborn stop then take a easy walk to Weed Street there you will find a plethora of nightclubs. If your looking for Gay/Lesbian bars take the red line to the Belmont stop and you will be in Chicagoâ€™s GLBT neighborhood where you will find bars/nightclubs, lots of shopping and tons of late night restaurants. 3. Just a small heads up, this hotel charges you for your entire stay at check-in. This really isnâ€™t a huge deal but what they donâ€™t tell you is that they add an extra $100 per night for incidentals which you get credited back to you when you check out. I stayed three nights and payed with my debt card so imagine my surprise when and extra $300 was taken out of my checking account. If you are planing a trip to Chicago I would highly recommend a stay at the James Hotel. Itâ€™s in a great location and has many services and amenities to please even the discerning of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location, & Value!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTown16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The James for almost a week in January of 2009. To my surprise, I very much enjoyed this boutique hotel. The rooms were spacious, well-kept, and modern. The staff at The James were attentive and courteous. The location is ideal as it is one block off of Michigan Avenue at Rush Street. Besides the obvious close location to top-notch shopping, there are many restaurants nearby. This place is a steal in terms of value. I recommend this place to tourists and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MQ0705
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for our 1st Anniversary. We stayed at James Hotel and it was a wonderful experience. It was close to all the shoppings, resturants, the trains and buses. We only took a cab once to another area and other times, we either walked or hopped on the trains. The staff was wonderful, they cleaned our room at least twice a day. All the equipments at the gym were new and very clean. And you must try the David Burke Prime steak house. We went there on Sunday night and they have the Super Prime Sunday dinner for only $42 per person. It was a four course dinner and it was worth every penny of it. We couldnt even finish it. There is a mini bar in the room but it was pretty expensive. So i suggest you to buy drinks from cross the street where they have a Trader's joe and they have a great selection of wines too. There is also 7/11 on almost every corner. If you are travel by plane and with only couple of people, I don't suggest to rent a car since the parking in downtown is a pain and the parking in the hotel is very expensive. There is a train from the Ohare airport directly to the downtown area. We took the train from and to the airport and very conveninece and inexpensive. Overrall, this is a great hotel if you are looking for something trendy and close to everything.....

Reviews.Title: “European Oasis in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lillylights
Reviews.Content: I loved The James Hotel. It was perfect. Upscale, cool vibe with out being pretentious. Experienced, and very pleasant staff. I loved the low key, humor these hard working representatives of the James Hotel displayed. On two occasions I heard sirens outside my window (fifth floor) but on the whole it was very quiet. Perfect down town location. Good wine selection in the bar. The bed was divine ! The bathroom beautifully designed, and very clean. Frankly I have no suggestions on how to improve the James. They had me at Hello!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a special weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: lrgardener
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we flew in to celebrate our daughters - college graduation. Couldn't of been happier with our accomodations or the excellent service we received from all of the staff.
