Rooms are very clean and comfortable - only wish that they had 2 queens in a double room rather than double beds as our daughter stayed with us. Looking forward to our return next month in a king room to celebrate a milestone birthday.

Reviews.Title: “What A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jl1464
Reviews.Content: The staff at the James was unbelievably accommodating and friendly. They went above and beyond. I've stayed at many of the fine hotels in Chicago and the rooms here were much roomier and the decor was so hip and cool. Great for a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, best customer service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: christylyn42
Reviews.Content: By far, this was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in - and it made celebrating an anniversary with my boyfriend such a memorable experience! For starters, we called ahead to get suggestions for restaurants and bars in the area. The concierge couldn't have been more helpful and nice - and she obviously took note that it was our anniversary and informed guest services because when we arrived they said "happy anniversary!" and gave us a complimentary room upgrade. The hotel is impressive - the lobby and bar are gorgeous and the studio room we stayed in was very trendy and well-kept. The maids did a great job of cleaning up the room and even at night when they came to turn down the sheets, they cleaned things up a bit again and replaced towels. The location of the hotel is perfect! We parked our car and never once took it out of the lot or had to take a cab. You are literally on Rush Street and only a block away from Michigan Avenue. We walked to the Navy Pier, the John Hancock Tower and to various shops and restaurants with no problems at all. Above and beyond everything, the customer service is great. Being a younger couple, my boyfriend and I have had experiences where we aren't always taken seriously as hotel guests. At The James, every employee made us feel extremely welcome and bent over backwards to make sure that we were having a good time. The concierge arranged all of our dinner reservations, and for one dinner, even arranged to have a car from the restaurant pick us up. Even though we were in town for only 2 nights, we genuinely felt like the hotel employees knew and recognized us after only a few conversations. I would really look forward to going back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Chicago. Better than the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: DcTravelalot
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here @ 6 times and most of the other nice hotels in Chicago including the Ritz, Four Seasons and Peninsula (4 times). Travel a lot for business and this staff, health club, bar/restaurant and rooms make the James one of my favorite hotels in US. They have gone out of their way to make myself and family feel very comfortable including one time when we had to stay there for 10 days over the holidays due to a death in the family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the James Chicago”
Reviews.Author: charck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James Hotel for 2 nights over Memorial day weekend in May '09. We were in town for a wedding and this hotel was recommended by the bride. My impression of the hotel started on a great note when I called the day before arrival to get details about traveling to the hotel from O'Hare. The woman on the phone was extremely helpful and gave me tons of useful info. Overall, every interaction I had with staff exceeded my expectations. We arrived at the hotel at around 10am and were able to check in immediately. We had a double room on the 17th floor facing west down Ontario St. The room was of good size with a small alcove with a table and comfy bench, large table/luggage space in front of the window and a large bar/min fridge area. Normal size bottles of booze were available with several different types of cocktail glasses and mixing implements. Also there was cd/radio/mp3 player (with an aux plug to fit non-iPod mp3 players, too). There was also a large LCD TV and great lighting throughout. I've been to many boutique hotels where lighting (lack of it) is an issue and it was not an issue here. I could have been comfortable staying here for several days as there was enough space for 3 to move around (or sit and relax) at the same time. The bathroom had Keihl's products and enough counter space. There's a Trader Joe's across the street and a Whole Foods nearby (walking distance at Huron/Erie) The door staff was great - not to in your face annoying but always close at hand to offer tips, etc. Minutes before the wedding my sister (the maid of honor) called for help b/c the DVD player being used at the reception didn't work. They needed another and the James Hotel front desk staff immediately loaned me one. This really saved the day and they didn't say a word when I walked out the front door with it! As in any city there was some road noise (police sirens, honking, etc.) on the 17th floor. Free wifi in the rooms and entire hotel. We had a great time and I would definitely return to the James Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Supastar147
Reviews.Content: A must for any serious or regular traveller. Ideal for both business and lesiure. Great location for the major Chicago attractions. Staff offer exceptional and unrivalled service. Trendy, chic and sophistacated - a "must be seen in here" hotel. Rooms - my room had its own cinema/theater in a separate room. Furnishings were first rate. One of the only hotels in the world, where the the selection of glasses for the mini bar in the room had martini glasses! Staff - nothing was too much trouble, always ready with a smile and extremely helpful, professional, efficient and more than all, friendly. The plaque on the entrance door says "One of the Worlds Leading Hotels" - The James Hotel certainly is and lives up to its reputation. We (a group of 14) stayed for three nights. If you are looking for that "extra special" hotel - The James is the place

Reviews.Title: “Well, how chic are you?”
Reviews.Author: acumom
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. From the moment I made my reservation, the staff could not be more accommodating. I called in advanced to the concierge for information and it was waiting for me upon my arrival. The front desk people were wonderful and so patient as I wasn't comfortable with the my initial room. Between the bell staff and front desk they must have shown me at least 8 rooms with various views and layouts. They all had the patience of saints and without one bit of attitude. In fact, I could not believe how incredibly kind and understanding they were. Every morning I was greeted by name by the doorman and the bellmen. When it rained they offered me an umbrella the moment I entered the lobby from the elevator to go outside. The room service staff was great arranging food for me according to dietary restrictions. The gym was well appointed , but sadly I didn't get a chance to work out. The concierge managed to get reservations for dinner at a restaurant that it takes weeks to get into. AMAZING!!! The hotel is right across the street from Trader Joes so if you are hungry, you can get a bite to eat or pick up snacks. They have two business centers for guest to use and free internet. I decided to stay at this hotel because I couldn't bear to stay down the street for a convention I was attending and wanted more of a small boutique hotel. In fact when I brought my friends over for a drink at the bar, the entire group was lamenting why they didn't stay at the James instead of the Mariott where everyone was congested from the gross chemicals they used. My room was great and I had no issue with noise. In fact it was very quite. The room smelled great ,was clean , chic and well laid out. In fact all of the 8 or so rooms were very well laid out in their own way. Just to prove how cool the James is, Bravo's Project Runway was casting their 7 th season and Tim Gunn and the PR staff were staying there and I even got to talk with Tim in the lobby. I am a former concierge of 5 years so I know the level of service guest expect. The James was exceptional in every aspect..Everything about this hotel was beautiful, unique and well done.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at The James”
Reviews.Author: oodiks
Reviews.Content: In fairness to the James, I arrived reluctantly and fully prepared not to like the James after being transferred from the Affinia due to a booking error at Affinia. (The James and Affinia are operated by the same group.) The initial service and cleanliness of the James did impress me and I started to think that it might be as good(better ?) than a stay at the Affinia after all.The decor was plain and simple , but comfortable, and the rooms were nicely cleaned each day.Great mattress, quiet room and free internet, were all good.There was a nice, big flat screen in the room, but the closed-captioning was on, and no amount of button pushing could turn it off. It took 3 requests and 2 days to get the hotel to turn it off. I did not go to Chicago to watch TV, but after walking around for 6 or 7 hours, its nice to veg in front of the tube and have a drink or two before dinner.The closed-cap is really annoying and for the prices charged for a room, and the James' upscale presentation, everything should work correctly , or be fixed pronto. Then the bathroom faucet knob fell off late at night, and we could not turn off the water.The "engineer" as they called him , did arrive fairly quickly to fix it , but it seemed forever, laying in bed trying not to fall asleep, waiting for the guy to show up. I asked at the front desk about a long distance call and was told it would be ~$4 and change. In reality the charge was $13 something on our bill. I complained and the hotel adjusted it. On our last night , after an evening of excellent dining and great blues bars, we got back to the hotel late and wanted to watch TV for a bit before calling it a night. The TV died a minute or two after we turned it on and refused to turn on again.I did not bother to call the front desk, by this point it was too late and I'd had enough of dealing with little problems at the hotel. There was also an error with our room billing charge that turned out to be another mistake on Affinia's part. The James was OK, the little problems were annoying, taking the glow off of what could have been a more enjoyable stay.If we had paid regular rate(the James honored the Affinia's special rate of $149), I would have been much less happy. The Affinia's handling of my reservation and subsequent transfer to the James has left a bad taste in my mouth.This is not the James fault, but between the hotel problems and the reservation problems, all under the care of the same group of hotels, our stay was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings - A lot must depend on your room location”
Reviews.Author: Fr0mtheheart
Reviews.Content: The James is a very cool, well-appointed hotel. The room service was perfect and reasonably priced for breakfast. The amenities and decor are wonderful (plus there's a huge big flat screen TV), as is the location. But...if you have an lower floor East facing streetside room, like I did, good luck getting a good night's sleep. It was VERY noisy. The street noise went on most of the night - motorcycles, trash trucks, etc. Even with earplugs in, because my room was so small, I was awakened one night at 4am by a dog barking (do they allow pets?), and another night by people talking loudly in the next room. Then, because the shades don't completely cover the window, the sun streamed in too early in the morning. I got a Hotwire deal, so maybe not the best room (they couldn't switch me the first night after I'd been waiting since 10am to check in), but that means I can't recommend this hotel. Probably not what they hoped for when they made the rooms available on hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at The James Hotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: doctorwink
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the James Hotel. I stayed here based on the reviews I saw on Trip Advisor. I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Not only are you one block from the Mag Mile but you are walking distance to everything else downtown. The entire staff could not have been more accommodating. The concierge gave us great recommendations for nearby local restaurants, art galleries and even the most beautiful church for Easter Sunday Mass!! The gym they have is FANTASTIC! They have a huge cardio and weight lifting area. I was very impressed since most hotels have a few cardio machines and that's it. The room was a nice size and the beds were so comfortable I could have slept in every day! The main floor has a computer area with a few computers and a Mac to boot. We were able to print our boarding passes without any hassle. I would highly recommend this very trendy/cool hotel. Can't wait to visit the next time I am in Chicago. I did not try the restaurant but heard it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff argued with me at every turn”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveler01
Reviews.Content: First, several days prior to my stay, I called and spoke at length with the concierge. At that time I specifically requested that a large pot of coffee for two people and one large glass of orange juice be delivered on Saturday and Sunday morning at 9:30 am. After speaking with the concierge, I was telephoned to confirm this order by another individual at the hotel. When, on Saturday morning I did not get my order, I called in-room dining. They had no idea I had placed the order and stated that they weren't told about the order from the concierge. I waited another half an hour before they delivered the order to my room. They brought two (2) orange juices (more than I ordered) but I did not argue the point. On Sunday morning I received my order at 10:15 - they provided two (2) large orange juices (again - not what I ordered) and a large pot of coffee with only one (1) cup (there were two of us). Again, I did not argue but simply overpaid. In sum, I ended up paying around $60 for items that were (1) not what I ordered, (2) late, and (3) required my nagging to receive. I was further inconvenienced by in-room dining staff when I ordered room service Saturday night. First, the food was limp and uninspired. Further, I ordered the soup- which arrived without a spoon. When I called in-room dining to request a spoon, I was told one would be forthcoming. 15 minutes later, a waiter arrived with a menu. When I explained I already had food and I didn't need a menu - I needed a spoon, he had the audacity to argue with me. I respectfully requested he return with a spoon and he agreed to do so. Another 15 minutes (and one bowl of cold soup) later I decided to call in-room dining back to request (again) they send someone with a spoon. They too argued with me and expressed that they'd already sent someone with a spoon. I explained that they had not - that I had received a menu I didn't request, but that no spoon was forthcoming. Another 15 minutes later, a spoon finally arrived. I ended up paying $100+ so that I could argue over cold, flavorless food. In addition to the gross customer service, surly attitude, and sorry food, I found the room woefully lacking. It reeked exhaust fumes so much so that on Saturday night I woke up from the smell. Further, I had specifically requested when I booked the reservation that I be kept away from the elevatorsâ€¦ I was right next to the elevators and had the displeasure of listening to them ding all night long as other guests came and went.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: holly228
Reviews.Content: I found the James through a deal on Travelocity in January. The reviews here were about 50/50 but the deal was too good to pass up. I'm a single mom traveling with an almost 15 year old and I have done a great deal of traveling to give you some perspective. We arrived early (cab from O'Hare was $40 with tip) and our room was ready immediately. The hotel is immaculate and stunning (for those who like the contemporary vibe). The room was perfect for us - beds were perhaps the most comfortable I've ever stayed in. The room is very contemporary - great tv, typical city view, not overdone. The staff bent over backwards for us through out the stay. From a clogged toilet to restaurant recommendations, they were very attentive. Mr. Marcellus (evening concierge) even went to the trouble to print my boarding passes for me the night before we left. We did not eat at the restaurant on site but we did order dessert from them one night via room service - it was very good. The hotel is about a block off of Michigan Ave. The Hard Rock, Rainforest Cafe, and Rock & Roll McD's are within easy walking distance. The Red Line is an easy walk and buses come right down Ontario. My suggestion is to go to CTA's website in advance and buy passes - we did an unlimited 3 day pass for $14/each that was good for buses & the El. Nothing to do with the James - but I also strongly suggest eating breakfast at Lou Mitchell's (3 blocks from Sears Tower).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lonergan123
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay here for 5 nights recently for a conference in town. Positives: -- Great location, right off Michegan Ave and close to great shopping / restaurants etc -- Trader Joes right accross the street -- Rooms are very clean and housekeeping is great (turndown service even includes home baked treat) -- Great lighting throughout the hotel - room lights all had dimmer switches -- Gym, although not huge and in the baseroom is very well equipped. It's so nice to see hotels get the gym right -- Original art Negatives: -- No views, and many rooms look into interior courtyard (as did mine) / directly into other rooms -- Althought I got a great rate on hotwire, I was offered only a smoking room, or the option of paying $40 / night extra to upgrade to a non-smoking junior suite. This is annoying. -- Small and slow elevators (although probably not much that can be done about this given the buildings age).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: st-hookem
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The James for four nights on a girls' weekend getaway. We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go, and when we had to take a taxi, the doorman was extremely helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable, lots of towels and nice toiletries were provided. The staff was very attentive and always cheerful. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “51st Birthday Trip, Chicago,IL The Hotel James is OK with Me!”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: The James hotel is located close to everything in Chicago, the miracle mile, Pizza House Uno,Rush street, The Water Tower everything. We walked everywhere because everything was close by. The rooms are very modern and a little on the small side. But the bed was very comfortable, Very! The service is very good and the calls are answered professionally and nicely. All service was very fast and through. The lobby is a liitle small but that keeps the riff raff from hanging out in it, the bar service was good. The drink prices were high but what do you expect in a hotel bar. I got a great deal from leading hotels of the world for my stay of 3 days was just over $400.00 for a 5 star hotel that's cheap. Due to the location, price and service I may stay there again. But I think my next trip may take me to Trump's hotel in Chi Town. The James is a good stay . The doorman at the hotel are Great! Always pleasent, with a smile and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: MilsyOnalaska_WI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Chicago for a getaway weekend with friends. We could not have asked for a better hotel experience. The rooms, the location, the service, the friendly and helpful staff,,,,,, all top-notch!!! And, within walking distance to so many good things! The weather did not cooperate very well, but oh well!! The beds are so comfortable, I had not slept that well in ages!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, superb hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Johnwallis42
Reviews.Content: I spent about a couple of weeks at the James recently and in all honesty it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I travel constantly for business and I am so frequently disappointed in hotels. It doesn't seem to make any difference how much money you spend, in my experience most are fundamentally flawed in one way or another so the James came as a complete shock to me. Finally a hotel that treated me with respect and courtesy from the moment I arrived until the day I departed. The staff are fantastic and incredibly helpful, nothing was too much trouble, always a smile. I was greeted by name after I had been on premises for only about 30 minutes, I still have no idea how they do that. The rooms are very comfortable, well appointed in slightly minimalist decor, quite stylish. The bed was plush and everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The restaurant Primehouse is excellent, at the time of my stay they had a 3 course $20.09 lunch that was amazing, I can't recall ever having Kobe Beef Sashimi served on a block of Himalayan Pink Salt as an appetizer for a twenty buck lunch and yet there it was and it wasn't a serving that required a microscope to appreciate. I ordered a similar appetizer at Envy in ls Vegas a few weeks before and it was pitiful and cost more than my whole lunch at Primehouse. To be succinct the James is brilliant if you are going to Chicago don't mess about with anywhere else, the location is perfect, you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Hip Modern Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Spiderquadrifoglio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The James approximately 10+ nights over the past year and I love this place. I swap between here and The Sofitel Water Tower Place based upon price and availability. Location is central to all River North attractions and, while it is on Rush Street, it is a few blocks south of the party district so it stays relatively quiet. There is a Trader Joe's across the street, which is great if you want an in-room picnic (read on). The heart of Michigan Avenue shopping is a block to the East The decor is ultra contemporary and clubby, yet the rooms are very comfortable. Lots of great examples of modern and mid-century furniture. Beds are very comfortable with great linens. All rooms I have stayed in have been very clean and well maintained. Plasma HDTV, complimentary water, nice bath product, and nice touches like dimmer switches for most room lighting, and ipod compatible radio. The feel is minimalist, but not spare. The staff is very professional. The downstairs bar can sometimes be a good spot, but it seems to be mostly hotel guests and not many locals. J Bar, located next door, really gets going later in the evening and seems to cater to the 30-something crowd (but this 40-something has had a lot of fun with friends there too). The David Burke Primehouse restauarant has amazing steaks. Definitely worth the splurge on their 30, 45, and 60 day aged steaks. Typical rooms are of average size. The real treat at this hotel are their "Loft Suites". The hotel is not particularly tall and is surrounded by taller buildings, so there really are almost no views. It is also U shaped in plan and the interior rooms face a parking deck with a limited view of Wrigley Tower in the distance. Ingeniously, these interior rooms have been designed as extra-large rockstar suites - so no need for a view. The suites feature a living area with couch and a couple of chairs, a wet bar stocked with top-shelf liquor, cocktail shaker, refrigerator, etc., a small dining table, and large plasma TV. The bathroom has a large glass shower with separate tub. Great Kiels bath product. Nice robes. The bedroom is a king size platform bed in an alcove off the living area and has its own Plasma TV. Lastly, on the other side of the living area is what can only be described as a "party pit" - which consists of a queen matress platform surrounded by a drink shelf and with an LCD projector to show DVDs on the wall. Yeah, really. Order up the bottles of Cristal and invite the groupies. It would make a great room for a long romantic weekend. Prices are all over the board for this hotel depending on occupancy and the time of year. I have stayed from the high $100's but its not unusual to see it get into the $400s per night. You just have to check.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: uditann
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many different hotels in Chicago, including two of the high end properties. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and I really think it is a hidden gem. Great location, nice lobby bar and very friendly staff. The rooms have nice touches (they might take a look at their windows though-they leak like sieves and it was hard to keep the room warm)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location, lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophie1986
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the James May 2008 whilst visiting Chicago and found the hotel very pleasant. I am a bif fan of modern boutique hotels and this was just that. It was trendy, not too big, not too small and in a great location. The rooms are modern, a good size and clean. The only downside is theres not much of a view but you are in a big city so not many picturesque views around here! We used the gym a couple of times which was well equipped and there was also great internet access in the lobby. The staff were also very helpful. We ate in the David Burkes steakhouse one night and the food was fantastic, however on the pricey side so maybe for a special occasion. We then went to J bar which was very good music and got packed fairly quickly. I would also recommend drinks at the top of the hancock tower. Fantastic views of Chicago. We also went up the sears tower in the daylight which is worth a visit. One thing you must do whilst in Chicago is go to a Cubs baseball game. We had such a great time! I would definetely stay at the James hotel again. Great overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the James!”
Reviews.Author: Finley_9
Reviews.Content: What a great place to kick-off an exciting and adventurous evening in the beautiful city of Chicago. This hotel has a great location placing it within walking distance of some of the finest bars, restaurants, and departments stores the city has to offer, some of which are right inside the hotel. My check-in was speedy, and the entire staff was friendly and most helpful in answering all of my questions. The contemporary room has amazing atmosphere and boasts all of the high-end amenities a person could ask for including flat screen televisions, stereo system, and the most comfortable bed I think I have ever slept in. I highly recommend the James for an impeccable weekend getaway or an extended vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: cricketMissouri
Reviews.Content: The James hotel is a wonderful place to stay. It is in walking distance to great food, shopping and sightseeing. The staff at the James hotel went above and beyone to make my stay as comfortable and relaxing as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service too”
Reviews.Author: McPhil
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The James in Chicago. It's a lovely hotel and the rooms are really nice. We had a suite which included a lounge area with flat screen plus a flat screen telly by the bed. The bathrooms are lovely and the Kiehl's toiletries are a lovely touch. We really liked this hotel. The service was great, they have umbrellas you can borrow for those rainy, windy days. It's a great spot to shop, go for dinner, see the sights. We would recommend this hotel. It's not a cheap hotel but is great. Just around the block are two great restaurants, The Grand Luxe Cafe (beware, the portions here are huge!) and Heaven on Seven (amazing, particularly if you love proper soul food).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic James!”
Reviews.Author: WicklowGal
Reviews.Content: Myself, my four sisters and my mother stayed here in October 2008 for 5 memorable nights in Chicago. The main purpose of our trip was for shopping and also to visit family. We arrived at the hotel very tired and weary after a long flight from Ireland and from that moment until we left we were treated extremely well. The hotel itself is located a block from the famous Magnificant Mile (Michigan Avenue), so for those looking to shop til they drop the location could not be better. Check-in was a breeze and very efficient. When we arrived at our rooms, it almost took our breath away. We were greeted by the subtle tones of relaxing music from the stereo playing in our room, and lovely subtle lighting. The decor of the room was understated and stylish, without being over the top. There was bathrobes and slippers and complimentary treats left out for us from the David Burke restaurant which is located in the hotel. In the bathroom the complimentary toiletries were by Kiehl's which was an extra nice touch. Let me just say, that we slept like babies for the duration of our stay, such was the comfort of the beds and the room itself. Unfortunately, we did not get the opportunity to eat in the signature restaurant or bar during our stay, but we did drink in the lobby bar which was very pleasant and we did have some bar snacks which were delicious, not the usual greasy fodder. For anybody on their first trip to the Windy City, this hotel for me ticked all the right boxes. Great location, excellent service, beautifully appointed rooms, and well worth the price we paid. I want to say a special thank you to the guys on the concierge desk who looked after us so well and went the extra mile for us. Some highlights of our trip were the following; 1. Gurnee Mills, Shopping Mall - this is a shopping mall upstate which is a paradise for those who want to get designer shopping at rock bottom prices 2. The Grand Luxe Cafe, Michigan Ave - Great value for money and extensive menu for either lunch or dinner. 3. Navy Pier - it's a Chicago staple, but what more can I say, you have to see it at least once. 4. The Museum of Science & Industry - if you're going to do something different please go and visit this museum, it is absolutely fantastic and well worth a visit. All in all, we had a wonderful visit to Chicago and even though the city itself made it wonderful I would say that the James made it extra special for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel - Suitable for city shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: dan_berlin
Reviews.Content: Room: I stayed in the 16thz floor. 2 double bed room. The room has a decent size. Equipment is state of the art. The Furniture are stylish. Room Size was very nice. I could have left my big suitcase opened throughout the stay (which rarely happens in most hotels ;)) 42" LCD Screen Complimentary WiFi in the room The bed and pillows are of extrodinary quality which provided an excellent deep sleep to me. Location Located quite central. Shopping streets are in reach of 5 minutes by feet. Midway Airport is in reach by cab within 30 minutes (~30 USD). Service - Spa and Fitness exists - though I did not use. - Restuarant (not used) - Business Center - Very friendly and helpful staff. (even printed our boarding passes at the reception) I do travel frquently, and do recommend this hotel for a business stay, as also for an overnight with friends going shopping, partying whatever in the city center of Chicago. Pricing was very moderate for teh standard being provided at a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KitKatChicago
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the James Hotel for New Year's Eve and it was a wonderful experience. Probably best hotel we've stayed at in Chicago in a while. The location is excellent. Just about a block from Michigan Avenue and several places to choose from for dinner - all within walking distance. Everything went very smooth. All the staff members were VERY friendly and made us feel very welcome the entire time we were there. The decor of the hotel is very modern - which made it very different and interesting. It's not my personal taste, but it was a nice change and very fun. Swanky is the word that comes to mind. The rooms are very clean, the beds are VERY comfortable, and the products in the bathroom are top notch. From start to finish we had a great experience at this hotel. We are already planning a return trip to Chicago in late January to celebrate a birthday and plan to stay at the James Hotel again. By far the nicest hotel we've been to during our weekend stays in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James”
Reviews.Author: Klbster
Reviews.Content: Just returned to Seattle after a visit home to Chicago and I loved The James!!! Recently stayed at the Ritz at Water Tower and the Dana around the corner--both of which were great but The James was perfect. Secured the room through a package w/ American Express for a great deal so though the view wasn't great the space, decor and location can't be beat. Staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful, the gym was substantial and though I didn't try the restaurants/room service, the menus looked yummy. I've stayed in Chgo in that area on avg 1-2s/mo over the past three years and the James is at the top my list now. If you can get a good deal, I highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: GalwaySpok
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights in Chicago, 3 of those at James, was disappointed overall, probably as we spent first 4 nights at Sofitel. There was no comparisson, for starters it cost us considerably more for 3 nights at James compared to 4 nights in an amazing room at Sofitel Water Tower. Room at James was basic to say least, decor was dull, drap and boring throughout hotel. a few attempts to funk it up failed, there just was no theme or taste. Our biggest gripe is that we could not enjoy a hot shower during our stay, the water was tepid at best, staff said it was because they were at full capacity, just not good enough. We were to front of hotel where it was quite noisy. We were charged 8 dollar per bottle water left out each evening, perhaps a note should be left to advise this, very misleading and very expensive. On the plus, the door man was fantastic, helpful and friendly and turn down service was lovely, however considering all will not return, Sofitel Water Tower is miles ahead in every department.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Modern, Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenStarfish
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a bachelorette party and it was great. The rooms are big enough to hang out in - plus I love the bench seat that was in the room. They have Kiehl's products (reason why we chose the hotel). The location is awesome as it's only a block away from the Magnificent Mile and while we were there - a famous R&B singer was also staying there. If it's good enough for a celebrity... :) The el stop is about 2-3 blocks away - it's not a bad walk (Red Line - Grand stop)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: shiny-shiny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel because of it's location and also because we wanted to bring our 70lb. bulldog with us. I found this hotel using dogfriendly.com, and they didn't disappoint! As soon as we pulled up the doorman had a dog biscuit ready for our pup. There was also food/water dishes already in the room. The hotel was very nice and pleasant. My only complaints are very minor. There was no fridge in our room, not enough wastebaskets, and there was no bedside lamp. Otherwise, the doormen and concierge were extremely helpful and very warm and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Time @ The James”
Reviews.Author: CorporateHotelier
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business. Was upgraded to a loft suite. Hotel was beautifully appointed, superbly located and dead sexy. Room was completely over the top with second "media bed" (large projection screen tv, dvd player, surround sound...bow chicka bow wow), great bath amenities, wet bar, etc etc. Also loved the lobby bar scene & food and service @ check in.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Timoan
Reviews.Content: Great beds, great baths, great service overall, great location. Avoid top floor rooms because of noise from the air conditioning units. Regulating room temperature can get a little challenging. Spa is mediocre and overpriced. Concierge was wrong on lyric opera times, so we were 1/2 hour late. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JordanJames
Reviews.Content: â€”I booked a room at the James for my husband's birthday last weekend. Firstly, David Burke's Primehouse is one of Chicago's top 10 best steakhouses, and is located in the James. This is a draw if you want to eat at a top-notch, top dollar steakhouse right in your hotel. But if you don't, there are plenty of really great restaurants literally right out the door, and within a 2 block radius. â€”The hotel lobby has a contemporary, sleek decor that certainly appeals to anyone with an artistic eye and who appreciates the combination of nature and modern design in their aesthetic. I love the birch, or maybe aspen, trees throughout the lobby, as well as the energized, fun, upbeat feel. It appeals to young and old(er). â€”The bar is also in the lobby, or rather at one end of the lobby - and this is the only downfall of this entire place. We've had drinks here twice, both times in November, when the Chicago wind suddenly becomes frigid. The bar is cold. There are doors on both sides that are opening (even being held open by doormen) while patrons arrive and depart, each time allowing a *blast* of cold air to hit anyone sitting in the low comfy couches and chairs. It was really poor planning. It's a bar you'd like to hang out in - just has the misfortune of being placed in what feels very much like a mere extension of the busy lobby, and like you are part of any weather system currently hitting Chicago. â€”On to the rooms - they are fabulous. Ours was a queen studio, great couch and chair choices, large mirrors and a very urban loft type feel. Yet, everything is smart. It's all practical and purposeful while having a clean look and comfortable feel. I felt immediately like 'this is my apartment.' And speaking of comfort - the bed was divine. Linens and coverings, all white, all fluffy and comfy and ready to make you not want to get out of bed in the morning. I say, don't! There is a coffee maker in the room, but free good coffee in the lobby, free papers, and once back upstairs, a flatscreen TV by the bed. (Of course there is always room service, breakfast from Burke's. I do suggest a luxurious morning in.) Our studio also had a larger flat screen in the living area, two big closets, a large bathroom (again, appointed the way you wish yours were at home) a sidebar piece with small bar sink, several premium bottles of spirits, including a wine key, and a great little sound system. And they pack all this into a tiny space, while still making it feel both spacious and cozy. (And quiet, even right by the elevator.) Well done, James! â€”The only minor downer about the room for me was the bathtub. Again, looks fabulous with long, chocolate tiles surrounding it and a cloth shower curtain. Now, most people avoid taking an actual bath in a hotel. However, sometimes it's necessary. I happened to need a soak when we were visiting, and it was the most uncomfortable I've ever been lying down. No place to rest my head without my chin jammed into my chest. No little ledge, nothing. Could The James provide at *least* a bath pillow? That would have helped tremendously. I know most of you will, but, stick to a shower. â€”The location of this hotel is perfect. Shopping and great restaurants are *literally* paces from the front doors. And by that I mean across the street and on the same block - and with in a mere 2 block range you could be fed and clothed for life. â€”If you're trying to decide where to stay in Chicago - I highly recommend the James. (My last name is James, but no relation! The hotel is named for James Dean.) And the place is not just for young hipsters, though you will encounter many cool young staff members - good energy, very helpful folks. If you stay at The James, I hope you're experience is as fun as ours was. :) ps - David Burke's Primehouse is amazingly good. Be ready to drop some coin, but wow! And it was recently listed high in the top 20 best steakhouses in the city in Chicago magazine. (I have other restaurant rec's in the vicinity if you're looking.)

Reviews.Title: “the best!”
Reviews.Author: Bea25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The James for a week, and it was the best week ever... The James has a perfect location, a super friendly and helpful staff, a beautiful modern design, nice plasma TV ;), and is clean, secure and comfortable. On top of that you are close to the best places to eat and close to the best places to shopâ€¦.. it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good but expected better”
Reviews.Author: Bippie
Reviews.Content: My stay at The James in Chicago over the weekend was pretty good. I remember when this building housed the Lennox House hotel, so the makeover was pretty impressive. The look is minimal and hip. Contemporary art, especially photography, is displayed throughout the building. Check-in was simple. I arrived early but this was not a problem. I asked for two beds instead of one, and this request also was accommodated. The front desk person asked me if Iâ€™d like a higher or lower floor. I picked higher and was assigned t a room on the 15th floor. The rooms have already been described here â€“ very white with minimal furnishings: two beds, a table between the beds, a long bench in front of the window that contained two drawers, a dresser-like piece with the mini-bar items and tow more drawers, and a small nook with a padded seat plus a small table. The bathroom has a very small entry room containing a closet-like cabinet with shelves, hangers, and a safe. The bathroom was nicely done with grey tiles on the floor and white fixtures. As others had mentioned, there was an odd smell in the nook. This smell (reminiscent of dirty feet) probably came from the upholstered seat â€“ either the padding or the covering. This musty smell pretty much stayed in the small nook and did not permeate the room. Housekeepingâ€™s attempt to spray for the smell only temporarily alleviated the problem. Some of my observations: PROS: - The beds were incredibly comfortable. I thought Westin had great beds, but the mattress, sheeting, and pillows were maybe the best Iâ€™ve encountered in a hotel. - After looking around, I realized there was a lot of storage space in the room. - Kiehl products in the bathroom were great â€“ their Amino Acid shampoo is one of my favorites and I now have a 2.2 oz bottle to refill for future travels. - The selection of newspapers for guests was good. USA today was delivered on Monday morning. No paper was delivered on Sunday morning but the New York Times and Chicago Tribune were available for guests (gratis) at the front desk. The Wall Street Journal joins these newspapers on other days. - Having 3 computers in the lobby area (two Windows and one Mac) for guests meant I never had to wait for a computer when I wanted one. I also brought my laptop and had no trouble accessing the free Wi-Fi from my hotel room. Kudos for the free Wi-Fi. - In addition to the sheeting, the towels were top notch. So were the bath robes. - Great workout room. - Each hotel employee I encountered was cheerful and friendly. When I contacted maintenance, they came up within minutes. They fixed a very slow drain in the bathtub so that it drained easily my second day. - The location was great. Across the street is a Starbucks, Trader Joes, and a good restaurant called Farmerie 58. After a good lunch, we returned for an even better dinner the next evening. Didnâ€™t try room service or the in-house restaurant. CONS: - For a hotel that classifies itself as 5 stars, the room seemed a bit worn. The cylindrical light fixture on the floor by the window was obviously stained and dented. One of the three pictures above one bed was missing and the hanging hardware was still in the wall. The alarm clock had a nice feature to project the time on the ceiling, but that feature didnâ€™t work properly (only half the display was visible even after setting the focus). To lock the safe, I had to push hard on the door. - The cookies that were left at turndown were not very good. (Did I really just complain about cookies?) - Lighting was hit and miss. The lights above the bed could be adjusted for reading, but there were not individual controls for each bed so both had to be set at the same level. The bathroom proper had good lighting but the small entryway with the closet fixture did not. Why did they put up a full length mirror and then not provide any lighting in the dressing area? - The outside noise wasnâ€™t a problem until 3 am on the last night. The garbage was picked up and this was a noisy event. Being on the 15th floor, I didnâ€™t expect that to be so annoying. Those staying on lower floors must have been even more annoyed. - Although there was plenty of hot water for a shower, the sink produced only warm water. - Speaking of the sink, I didnâ€™t like the shallowness which was not conducive to complete draining. Other than the noise from the garbage trucks, none of these complaints were major. However, there were just a few too many of them for a self-proclaimed 5 star property. I would stay at The James again if the price were right, but normally the price doesnâ€™t look right for this property. If I could stay at the Park Hyatt or Trump International for about the same price, Iâ€™d pick either of the other two hotels. I find The James to be similar to the Affinia â€“ The James has better service but the Affinia has newer and better rooms for what is often a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Location, Didn't Meet The Hype”
Reviews.Author: MatMo
Reviews.Content: The James is one of those "super swank" hotels as I like to term it. The service was fantastic and was a place I always wanted to try out because I often passed it while staying at other hotels in the area and it always seemed to be really hip & high-end. Before I continue, I would like to preface the following by stating that I stay at a lot of high-end hotels (mostly Starwood for what it's worth) so my review is much more critical than the average traveller. First off, the service & bed were awesome...I think it's even better than the Westin's "Heavenly Bed". The pillows seemed to be made from real down and were also incredibly comfortable, actually, the Pillows & Mattress were the best I've ever had a hotel all together (this includes places like Westin's, "W"s, Four Seasons, & Ritz Carlton's to name a few)! The room was very "Chic" and high-end, however, there were some significant drawbacks. I personally thought it was a VERY small room for the price and since it was rated something like #23 in the Contiental US & Canada by Travel & Leisure Magazine. I think the "W" Chicago Lakeshore has a much larger room (probably 25% larger) with similar design & "swankiness", and I still wouldn't call the "W" Lakeshore's rooms big! At the James, there was only about 2 feet of clearance between the foot of the bed and the wall which also hung a nice 42" plasma. While the 42" plasma was nice, it was a tight squeeze by the bed & TV and the only other place to watch TV was a small sitting chair. There was also a small "nook" area off to the side where someone could sit, but it was out of view of the TV and everything else in the room. The other big drawback was that there wasn't any type of normal business work area in the room or any type of business chair to sit in. This isn't an issue for the leisure traveller, but is a BIG issue for a business traveller because there wasn't a place to get comfortable and do some work if needed. The only place was the "nook", and it was out of view of the TV and was set-up more as a little sitting area verses a working space. It's also an issue for the leisure traveller that likes a sitting area to kick-back in and watch some TV without laying in bed. Overall, it's a great place to stay with an awesome location. However, the room was a little small and not set-up well for the average business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharon17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the James for 4 nights. Thought I had died and gone to heaven. Superb room. Bed had pillow top and was about 6 foot wide. Massive T.V. on wall. Fully stocked fridge. Coffee maker. Free slippers and dressing gowns. Maid service twice a day. Pillow has small sweet or biscuit placed on it in the evening. Excellent air conditioning. One evening the T.V. would not switch on and the engineer came immediatly and fixed it. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “"Lap of luxury"”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Boots
Reviews.Content: Loved the James hotel in Chicago. We stayed there on a girlfriends trip for a concert. We were treated like rockstars from the moment we entered the hotel. The staff was excellent, knowledgable, and very accommodating. It felt wonderful to have the door opened for us and to be treated like ladies. The rooms were chic, the room service was prompt and not unreasonably priced. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: fieldmom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 night stay at the hotel. I had requested a high floor, quiet room. Neither request was honored. The windows are not well insulated, because the traffic, car horns and sirens continued all night long. On the first night two drunk parties woke us up in the hallway. The safe in our room did not work. Someone had locked it before our arrival. One of the pictures under the tv had been removed, leaving a screw sticking out of the wall. The lights are so dim, that is next to impossible to read. A small alcove with a stained bench had a "reading light" that was about 50 watts. Our room key cards didn't work, so we returned to the lobby where they recoded them. Upon returning to our room, they didn't work again and we stood there trying over and over again until finally we succeeded with no help from the staff. The bathroom is small and has no fan, so the steam covers the mirrors, and unless you leave the bathroom door open, it does not clear. On Friday night one small cookie was left in our room. What about a second guest. Are we supposed to split a 2 inch diameter cookie???!!!! On Sunday the phone rang with a 7 am wakeup call. We had not requested to be woken up!!!! The concierge did not know the way to get to O'Hare by train, and gave us a longer route than was necessary. I have stayed in much better hotels in Chicago...quieter and more spacious, more elegant and worth the money. This is definitely not worth $400 a month. (By the way, I live in Washington, DC and am used to city noise. This was unacceptable!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but be careful”
Reviews.Author: nina2727
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice hotel if you like modern decor. We were initially placed in an exterior room, but the street noise was incredibly loud so we moved to an interior room. The rooms (we had a loft suite) are large and very cool. My complaint with the hotel is specifically about the conceirge. I was celebrating my birthday that weekend and both my good friend and my boss seperately ordered drinks and chocolate covered strawberries to be sent to my room upon arrival. The female conceirge who I will not name, but who trust me will hear from me, did not place the notes that were supposed to be sent with the gifts, but instead wrote a note from the hotel thanking us for staying with them! Can you believe they took the credit! Of course I am horrified and embarrased when days later I am approached by both my friend and boss to ask if I enjoyed the gifts! At $400 a night I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Triumph of Style over Substance”
Reviews.Author: Colmac
Reviews.Content: As a fan of this property when it was "The Lenox Suites" I have been waiting for a long time to try The James but have had to wait for years to get a deal that I could afford ( Expedia ) as the normal rack rate is prohibitively expensive. I was not encouraged by the hotels own web-site which is very sparse on practical information. Sadly, The James did disappoint to a degree without ever really giving cause for serious complaint. It is a visually stunning hotel and there is an air of quality throughout. The fixtures and fittings fall within the "boutique", style and for people who like that kind of thing, they will absolutely love The James. The investment made in renovating the property appears to be considerable ( sad then, that in our room the enamel in the bath was peeling and the air-conditioner was faulty ). They definitely try to encourage a feeling of exclusivity here, helped by impresssively attentive staff and the already mentioned rack rate of $400+. To be fair they do pull that off to a great degree. If you can afford that kind of money and are in town for only one or two nights, then this is a hotel that should seriously be considered. However, for somebody like me who generally stays in Chicago from 3 to 5 nights, then The James is totally impractical. For one thing there is absolutely no closet space in some of the rooms. We were forced to store most of our clothes on the floor !. The room furniture, though very stylish and contemporary, is not what I would call comfortable. The James is all about visual presentation and for me it lacks the necessary comfort and intimacy that I always look for in a hotel. I need a home away from home and in that regard I realised very quickly that I do not fit into their target demographic. Nor to be fair, did I expect The James to meet all of my criteria for the perfect hotel. This would probably explain why I was impressed with aspects of what The James offers and yet did not like it overall. The ceiling projection alarm clocks, the remarkably unobtrusive housekeeping staff, free in-room wireless internet access and the latest check-out time that I have ever experienced ( very welcome ) are things that The James should be commended for, as they are unique in my experience. However, I came away feeling that this was one location where I would always expect more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelmizen
Reviews.Content: Two night weekend stay at The James was great. Our room, 414, must have been a handicap room because it was very large for a single king room, but had no bathtub - which was odd. The only drawback was that the shower curtain would "attack" you since there was no tub to restrain it. The bed was very comfortable and we had no issues with noise even through there was a party in the first floor lounge the 2nd night. Conceriage was very helpful. Found a bar nearby that my boyfriend could watch his football game at and got us last minute tickets to a sold out tour.

Reviews.Title: “The James made my honeymoon GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: jillianlibrarian
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff at the James and the hotel itself wowed me and my husband. When we booked our trip, we mentioned that we were coming for our honeymoon. Upon arrival, the front desk staff informed us that they upgraded us to a loft suite (which was absolutely amazing) and also gave us a gift that our family had sent for us. The suite had a fantastic view, was modern and clean, and was full of luxurious amenities (especially the robes). I loved the Kiehls bath products and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The crisp white linens were a pleasure to snuggle into! We spent some time in the JBar, the bar affiliated with the hotel and accessible with a very, very quick walk around the corner from the front door. Our waitress was so friendly and the food was delicious and not too pricey. The hotel staff quickly responded to my needs, bringing a stack of bandaids when I asked for only one and quickly bringing more coffee pods when we wanted more than just one cup apiece. The concierge spent more than enough time with us when we asked him for a suggestion for dinner, even giving us printouts and maps. The music in the hotel was soothing and modern and even played in the elevator. I can't say enough good things about this place! I highly recommend it to couples out for a romantic getaway. It's location is so perfect! So close to the Magnificent Mile and all of the great downtown restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “James is so-so”
Reviews.Author: nydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the James for Labor Day weekend. We choose the James because of a special rate they had for studio suites. I think my expectations were a little too high after reading the reviews on this site and seeing that the hotel was ranked 29 in the world by readers of Travel & Leisure. In my opinion, there is no way the James beats the Park Hyatt or even the junior suite at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago. I am a constant visitor to Chicago and have made the rounds of almost every hotel on or near Michigan Avenue, and the James is just average. What is all the hype about? Our room had some issues. The first room we were given was smelly, to the point that I called and asked for a new room. The second room was fine, no smell, and the set-up was interesting with a tiny TV area with a couch (stained) and a coffee table, then a bedroom area with a nice bed and a little bench with some drawers. The hallway area had a little wet bar, which I thought was a cute touch. The bathroom was not great - the sink was more style over substance and there is a combo bath/shower. Our shower drain did not work the entire time we were there. We also had to request towels as only 2 were in the room. Some of the furniture was chipped or stained, and a few of the light switches were missing their covers. The elevators are small and slow and at busier times (Saturday morning and evening) we had to wait for a few elevators to go before getting on. I also took issue with the lack of a view - I have never stayed in Chicago without a view of at least Michigan Ave, if not the lake and/or river. Our view was of an interior courtyard. The decor is fun, but I feel like I've seen a nearly identical wallpaper and photos before, perhaps at the W Times Square. The hotel did not seem like a boutique hotel to me, just another trendy chain (or chain in the making). There was some extremely loud music and flashing lights coming from the hotel's conference center late on Sunday night. Luckily it didn't bother us much, but it could be a problem. I was disappointed by Primehouse. We went for the American dim sum brunch. Great idea but horrible execution. The restaurant was not at all crowded but service was horrible. We never got a visit from two of the carts, which is sad when there are 6 or 7 carts total, 10 tables in the dining room with customers, and there is a checklist on the table saying which carts have visited. Some "signature" items come straight from the kitchen, like the sliders and the kobe corn dogs, and we just never received them. Not the end of the world, but evidence of very poor management. Some things I did like: very nice door staff and front desk staff; turn-down service with cookies was cute, although two nights they left only one cookie for two people (didn't need two, just weird); the Kiehl's products are nice; and the location is good, although 15 other hotels have as good of a location. Would I stay here again? Maybe, for the right price. Would I include this hotel in the same category as the Four Seasons, Park Hyatt? Definitely not. If I want a luxury experience, I'm staying elsewhere. Chicago is a wonderful, wonderful city with so many wonderful hotels - the James is definitely not the only game in town. Maybe this was just a case of me having too high of expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, & rooms! Lousy Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: MaddieBBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: The James lived up to all the reviews. I booked a package (air & hotel) on expedia and got a good rate for the hotel. We arrived before check-in and our room was not quite ready. The desk associate was very helpful, offered to hold our luggage, and to call us as soon as the room was available. We decided to go eat lunch. We barely made it a block when the hotel called to say our room was ready and we could check in at any time. The location of the hotel can't be beat. It is one block from North Michigan Avenue. Everything we wanted to visit was easily accessible. The El train is a few blocks away - within walking distance. There are also several bus stops within a block of the hotel making it easy to get around. We purchased vistor passes for the CTA (public transit) and it worked out great. A two day pass is $9.00. The room looks just like the pictures. We were in room 414 and had a king bed. The bed was extremely comfortable. The plasma TV with HBO was wonderful. The bathroom is large and stocked with Khiels products (a nice touch). There were also two plush robes. The desk, bell, and cleaning staff were wonderful. The room was visited twice a day by the cleaning staff - once in the morning to make up the room (make the bed, pick up used towels and leave clean towels). Then for turn down service - the staff would leave cookies and fill the ice bucket. The desk and bell staff could not have been more helpful with directions. It was our first trip to Chicago and although we knew what we wanted to see we were unsure how to get there. Ask for a map of the bus and train routes at the desk - it is extremely helpful in getting around the city. The one drawback we found at the hotel was the concierge. I had called the hotel two days before we arrived the inquired about Cubs tickets. Toni took down my e-mail address and cell phone number. She said she would check on the availability of tickets and get back to me. I never heard from her. When we arrived at the hotel I waited to speak to the concierge. I explained that I had spoken to Toni and had not heard back from her. The woman at the desk did not introduce herself or apologize for the lack of response, but told me the tickets would be very hard to come by and would be at least $100 a ticket. I told her I had read a review on the internet indicating that standing room only tickets were available on the day of the game. She said she had been in Chicago a long time and had never heard of that. She made no attempt to check on that information for me. We were able to buy tickets to the game on labor day at the box office. We purchased box seats right behind the cubs dugout for $66/ticket. Standing room tickets were also available. Additionally we had purchased tickets to see a show at Second City. The concierge recommended we take a cab because the neighborhood was not the safest. However, she did say we could take the #36 bus and it would take us right to the theater. We took the bus, however, the theater was two blocks from the bus stop. Not a big deal, but not what we were told. After the show we walked around the neighborhood. It looked perfectly safe to us. It was actually a nice section of Old Town. The attitude we encountered from the concierge was at best condescending. It appeared to us that if you were willing to spend alot the concierage was helpful, but if you were on a budget they couldn't be bothered. My advice is get your directions from the desk and bell staff and avoid the concierage desk. The computers in the lobby are also helpful - we used them several times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: grotbags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James for 5 nights,after a few teething troubles[the safe did not work nor did the plug in the sink] we were eventually upgraded to a studio suite, very comfortable with a view over a flat roof.The hotel is smart ,staff on the whole very helpful and friendly but there is something lacking,I would stay there again because of the location and if I could manage to get a good rate[I booked though expedia] The hotel has some very high finishes in the decor ,let down by flimsy plastic light switches and frayed shower curtains.The towels were lovely so were the toiletries and the turn down service is a nice touch. So this is a bit of a mixed review,but on the whole a comfortable,clean place to stay in the wonderful city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Labor Day wkend. Fantastic Location! Luved the boutique style of the hotel. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the lobby in the evenings. The rooms were very nice. We were upgraded to a studio. The retro fruniture was a nice break from the chain hotels we've stayed at before. The dimmer switches on all the lights were a nice treat. It felt like we were staying at an apartment not a hotel. The bar set up and the CD player was a nice touch. We especially enjoyed the turndown service provided along with the comfy robes & slippers. We appreciated the excellent service and free computer access. There was a sbucks on the corner which was great in the mornings. The Pan-Asian restaurant across the street was fantastic! We also enjoyed the location to Rush St. In case anyone is interested in restaurant suggestions...the Travern at the Park on Rush was a great place too! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLSLangleyBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at The James, wonderful location 2 mins walk to Michigan Avenue with all the shops. Staff here were all incredibly helpful and genuinely friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Rooms are huge and the beds the most comfortable I have slept in. Room was very clean, had separate seating area with sofa and chairs with a 42in flat screen tv. There was a bar area with stereo, mini bar and coffee maker. There was another flat screen tv in the bedroom area. Bathroom very good with complimentary shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion. Hotel is also "pet friendly". There was even a large bowl of iced water and a barrel of dog biscuits at the front door of the hotel !!!. Pets even had their own options on the room sevice menu.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The James”
Reviews.Author: cjd272n
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The James at the end of July. We absolutely loved it. We go to Chicago every year to get away and we will always check rates at the James first., I felt the rooms were immaculate, with fantastic beds, and an awesome mini-bar with top-shelf liquors. I also thought the flat-screen plasma TV's were great. The location is also perfect, well within walking distance to most everything. We were very pleased with the service we received the entire time we were there. Our only complaint was that there was not any kind of ventilation or fan in the bathroom, so it would get pretty hot in there. But that was easily overlooked based on the service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The James = average”
Reviews.Author: mjs2121
Reviews.Content: The James is a "trendy" hotel with good-size rooms, and decent service. The rooms are noisy with music blasting until 12.30am because of various events on the 3rd floor. Overall, I was not impressed with the quality of the service and would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the James”
Reviews.Author: abbeywood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the James at the end of July. We stayed in a studio suite which was 450 square feet and quite spacious. The bathroom was large and they offered Kiehls bath products which were nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had a quite room on the 12th floor. Although the room was nice, staff courteous and very helpful we did not like the restaurant at all. The food was below average as was the slow service. Our waiter asked us what we ordered 30 seconds after we just told him and there was no one else in the restaurant so it's not as if he had alot of orders to remember. The first morning I ordered Belgain waffles with cream and berries -- there were 3 berries and the cream was cool whip! The restaurant prides itself on their reknowned chef -- I guess he must of been on holidays when we were there! The lobby of the hotel is very nice but small. The bar though offeres complimentary coffee in the mornings although no one did mention this to us at check-in and I didn't discover this until the morning we were leaving. There are desk top computers in the lobby for email and internet use which was great. The concierge's were pleasant and very helpful. Make sure when you call to make a reservation that you ask about all their packages. Apparently there was a parking package where your parking is included for each night during the summer months. I had asked about the packages when I booked and the reservations agent did not tell us about this package and it wasn't until we were at the hotel did my husband notice it on the internet. When we asked to have our parking inculded it was abit of an ordeal however the manager did go ahead and take the $46 a day parking off our bill which was great. All and all we thought the James was nice but needed some fine tuning. The turn down service was nice as was the different cookie they put on your bed at night. The robes in the room were a nice touch and housekeeping did a good job. I may stay again but probley not as I enjoy trying new places unless we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James.”
Reviews.Author: gran2beNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say we loved the James. I agree with all the other reviews... the location was fabulous, the staff wonderful and the bed was out of the world. The concierge were all so helpful and all their suggestions were great. I have to say one of best mini vacations we have had in a long time. I had read the elevator was noisy so i asked my room to be away from the it and they put me in a room that i couldn't hear anything. The little extras were great... robes, slippers, treats with turn down and Kiels shampoo made the stay so enjoyable. I would highly recommend to anyone staying in Chicago. If you go try to go the Cubs game and take the boat ride at night around 9:00 and enjoy looking at the city with all the lights. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Melody92
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! It's in a fantastic location, very handy for the shops on Magnificent Mile and there are loads of places to eat/drink very nearby. The service was perfect - very friendly but not intrusive. The atmosphere was spot on - trendy but not stand-offish. The beds are the best I've ever slept in and we loved the turn down service, complete with yummy biscuits, mood lighting and cheesy 80s pop on the radio! (you'd think they'd looked at our I-Pods!) The David Burke restaurant attached to the hotel is also superb. We ate there and were joined by various celebrities but again it all felt quite low key. The cheesecake Lollipop Tree is an absolute must. I could go on....wish I could have moved in forever!

Reviews.Title: “A cool oasis in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: EmpireHotel
Reviews.Content: The James Hotel met and exceeded our expectations. A haven of cool, uncluttered comfort in a hot, crowded but congenial city. Located within steps of some of the greatest art, architecture, culinary and cultural opportunities anywhere in North America, the staff of the James provided us with a home away from home for the week we visited. The check-in was quick and flawless and the king suite a calm, restorative oasis. It is difficult to over-praise the friendly, attentive staff; this is a hotel that truly has its act together! The day before our visit ended, we experienced problems with the room's air conditioner. When the technician was unable to quickly solve the problem, we were immediately upgraded to a one-bedroom apartment with stunning views of the Chicago skyline. We eagerly await the opening of new James Hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Belive the hype!”
Reviews.Author: c0wb0y
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype! We were skeptal at frist this hotel had such great reviews , but we agree this is a great place to stay with a wonderful urban -mod-setting . The staff really went out of there way to make sure everything was prefect. The rooms were clean and confortable. Need i say more. The restuant was great, we had lunch and dinner. Dinner was prepeared wonderfuly. It was so good we dine there two evenings in a row. They also had a great wine list for the wine lovers. The hotel is laid back and you can enjoy congratgating in the lobby in the evening. It is in a busy part of chiago,so if you dont want to hear the street noise request an upper floor or the back side. The Location is great you are close to everything. There is a Starbucks across the street and Due Pizza( which is awesome too) next door.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: JennyB18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 16year old from June 22nd thru to June 25th.....we had a 3 night whistle-stop visit planned to shop and sight-see! I would definately recommend The James. Check in was a breeze, quick and efficient and on entering the room we were very impressed with the 2 large double beds, plasma tv on the wall, full length mirror (my daughter thought this was great for viewing how she looked in her various outfits she bought!!!!), lovely bathroom, dressing robes and slippers - everything was so clean and chic!!!! The location of the James is 2nd to none....you walk out the door, turn right, take about 100 steps and you are on Michigan Avenue - the Magnificent Mile. This is where you will find all the shops, ranging from H&M/Express (cheaper end of the market, but still great) to Chanel/Louis Vuitton.... Again perfectly placed for numerous restaurants, you cant go wrong, TGI's, Rainforest Cafe,Mcdonalds, .... we ate at The Drake and Shaws CrabHouse (both a must if you go to Chicago) and everywhere is walkable from the James - you dont need taxi's. We didnt actually eat in the hotel, but found the staff to be excellent at their jobs - i wanted to buy some junior trainers for my son, but neither the Nike, Adidas or Puma sold his age group, so we asked the concierge if he could suggest anywhere....within seconds he had printed off a map of a 6 storey sports store that sold all brands, and it turned out it was 5 minutes away from the James, just in the opposite direction we ususally walked.....excellent, got trainers and football boots!!!! All in all, would definately recommend the James.......and of course Chicago!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaToronto
Reviews.Content: The James is located in a great area, down the street from Magnificent Mile. The decor is modern and minimalist. There was a plasma tv, a player for your iPod, and free Internet. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The only drawback was the washroom had a sliding door, which doesn't offer total privacy. But the soap and cream provided smelled great. The bar always had people, and the atmosphere was great to sit for a drink. For the price, you can't beat it. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BFletcher
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were stunned with the excellence of this hotel. Certainly not your standard, all amenities, cookie-cutter place, which to me was much of the charm. The staff were incredibly friendly, swift and accomodating. The James is extremely clean and well taken care of. It is in a fantastic location and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. I am a tough sell too- some call be impossible to please when it comes to accomodations. Not this time. Great job James!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a business trip booked by a client. It has a beautiful lobby and bar, wonderful fitness room, rich furnishings and details in the rooms, and a very friendly and helpful staff. It also has doggie treats and pet pampering options if you travel with your animals. Our group had dinner, drinks, and desserts in the large reception room upstairs. It was a great venue for a large group (I think we had about 300 people). The food and drinks were all taken care of by the hotel, and were very good. The staff for the event was good as well. Elevators, stairways, hallways, and rooms were all very nicely done and warm yet brightly lit. The room had large windows looking out at some of Chicago's most famous buildings. We really liked the location as well. We were able to walk to a lot of very good bars and restaurants and shops (for shopping, Michigan Avenue is walkable). There were also a Whole Foods and Trader Joe's about a block away. We had a refrigerator and extremely well-stocked mini bar in the room, so we did get groceries as we were there for 5 nights. Some fun features included an attractive ipod dock/radio on the mini bar, full gourmet Chicago steak dinners available from room service (I am vegetarian, but it sounded like a good idea for a meat eater), large flat screen tv, port-hole shaped frosted glass in the sliding bathroom door.

Reviews.Title: “Almost flawless”
Reviews.Author: jmfangio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the James recently and we had a great experience. The hotel as others have mentioned is in an ideal location. It's in a quiet location, yet so close to many neighborhoods that you want to go to. We upgraded to a studio room which was totally worth the additional cost. It didnt have all the midcentury furniture that the website photos have, but it was elegantly appointed, spacious, and as we were on the inside of the building very quiet. The service was amazing. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful, as well as knowledgeable. This was true from the doormen at the front, to people at the desk and the servers in the restaurant. Both Concierges that we dealt with had great suggestions, and were able to understand our style and sensibilities when helping us out. The breakfast at Prime downstairs is among the best I have ever had in a hotel, this goes for the room service as well. Dinner there was good, but not great. I mentioned almost flawless, as there was a situation that occurred involving the Spa in the hotel. It involved scheduling and was aggravating, as the hotel actively encourages its use. However, Caroline who is one of the hotel managers did an amazingly competent job of making sure that we were satisfied, following up on progress and was a true pleasure to deal with. The experience could have left a very bad taste in my mouth but was resolved quickly. Overall, we left extremely satisfied with our stay and look forward to many future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: han1974
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a Memorial Day weekend getaway to Chicago, where we stayed at The James.
