We found a great deal on Expedia a couple of weeks earlier (a non-refundable rate of $176/night for 3 nights) and found it to be a bargain compared to what we could've paid to stay at inferior hotels nearby. We had an early morning flight from Boston and arrived at the hotel at 9:30AM; the staff was very friendly and accommodating, making us feel very welcome the moment we stepped out of our cab until we checked out 3 days later. We were able to do an early check-in, which made a major difference in that we had an opportunity to relax a bit and freshen up before heading out. The staff member took us to our room on the 7th floor and showed us all of the amenities - minibar, mini-stereo w/ iPod hookup, flat-screen TV, bathroom, explain the services provided by the hotel, etc. The room was in the west corner of the hotel, so we had a long walk from the elevators, but it was very quiet and we couldn't hear anything from outside. The room itself featured minimally chic decor and had a king bed that was much more comfortable than most hotel beds I've slept in. The room also featured small sitting corner and also featured a long "bench" against the window with 2 drawers below. There was plenty of space to store luggage without it being visible and obstructive in our room, so I felt the way the room was laid out made it look and feel bigger than its actual square footage. The only minor issues I found with our room were the closet and bathroom being a bit small. While the rectangular pedestal sink in the bathroom was beautiful, there wasn't much space for toiletries. In addition, the tub had a couple of scratches, but I was much happier to have plenty of towels (the bath towels were especially plush and oversized) and 2 sets of robes and slippers for our use. As for other aspects of the hotel, I particularly liked the lobby, which featured numerous lounge-style seating areas and a bookshelf full of coffee table books and magazines. The lobby bar (which bridges the lobby itself and David Burke Primehouse) was a great gathering spot for drinks and was a lively hangout throughout our stay. We ate breakfast one morning at David Burke Primehouse, which was a bit of a mistake. We went at 10AM and even though there were only a couple of other tables occupied, it took 15 minutes before a server even came up to us to start taking our order. It took another 15 minutes before the server returned to bring our juice; at this point, I was frustrated by the poor service that I spoke to the general manager, explaining the situation. He was very apologetic and comped us our breakfast, with our server coming by and apologizing for the lack of service as well. The family seated two tables over also complained about the poor service and the manager also comped their breakfast. The problem with breakfast there is that on weekends, they have an "American dim sum brunch" starting at 10:30; however, they also have breakfast daily until 11AM. This overlap, along with the transition period from 10AM-10:30AM, seems to result in inattentive service for those coming in for a late breakfast because the staff (servers, kitchen, etc.) are so focused on setting up for brunch. My suggestion for guests who want to eat breakfast in the hotel is to either: 1) Order room service for breakfast 2) Go for an early sit-down breakfast 3) If staying on weekends, go after 10:30 for brunch. My suggestion for the restaurant is to curtail breakfast on weekends at 10 or 10:30 to ensure a smoother transition into brunch. Even though the experience was disappointing, I appreciate the way the manager handled the situation. There is also a lounge/club attached to the hotel called J Bar. We checked it out on the first night of our stay and while it might be the right scene for some, it wasn't for us. We expected more of a relaxing lounge, but it turned out to be a club more than anything else. Very crowded, DJ, loud music - we walked in, grabbed a drink, and quickly retreated back to our room upstairs... Misadventures with dining/drinking aside, I would highly recommend The James. It is a very stylish boutique hotel where I think most people would love the rooms and the service provided by the hotel staff. I think the hotel is definitely appealing for the more sophisticated and trendy (yet unpretentious) traveler, and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: szmc
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, best in Chicago!! Great location right next to magnificent mile and an amazing restaurant in the hotel. Best steak I've eaten! The rooms were spacious (we booked a suite) and the staff all seemed very professional. We went to a few blues clubs (try B.l.u.e.s for the best you'll hear since the 60's). I would go back anytime I was in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kferg00
Reviews.Content: Family of four recently stayed just for fun. We loved the James. Excellent hotel; safe location; helpful and friendly staff; great facilities; had everything we needed; clean; well organized; sophisticated but not snooty; the location is perhaps the best we've ever stayed in (and we've visited Chicago numerous times). We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest luxury”
Reviews.Author: Googlehead
Reviews.Content: From the welcome at check-in to the hellos from maintenance staff as they passed by, I don't believe I have ever stayed in a more welcoming hotel. The lobby and bar are very comfortable and are modern without being impersonal. The room was spacious, beds luxurious and some style elements really gave it some personality. Toiletry products by Kiehls are a really nice touch. I loved that the all-white bed linens did not smell of industrial cleaners or bleach. Everything was spotlessly clean. An exceptionally welcome aspect was that check-out is 2pm. Very civilized and meant we could still enjoy the morning in the city without arranging storage for our bags. We had lunch in the Primehouse and can highly recommend the American Dim Sum brunch. The restaurant itself wasn't all that interestingly designed, but the high quality of staff and food was of greater importance. Conceirge service was incredibly helpful and even offered an umbrella on a rainy afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: pmr33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the James for three nights on business. Great hotel and location. Extremely professional staff from the time you enter all the way to your room. Also, it was nice to see that they were Mac friendly and had a desktop in the lobby for guest use. Great bar and fitness center as well. Would highly recommend for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat The James”
Reviews.Author: Johnlogie
Reviews.Content: I chose the James from Expedia for a short break and booked the night before I arrived. When away on business I normally stay in a Raddisson, Marriott, Hilton, Sheraton etc etc and they all end up being pretty similar with at best pleasant staff, sometimes with a great restaurant to help pull in more room reservations. When on vacation I try for independant hotels and luckily I decided to try The James when visiting Chicago. Partly because of the deal I got and partly because of the reviews here. I'm really glad I did as it definately rates as one of the best hotels I've stayed in. There was no one thing that defined this, it was more a combination of the extremely friendly and very helpful staff, the very cool public areas, large stylish bedroom, very high standard of cleanliness, amazingly comfortable bed, 42" plazma tv, stereo with a jack for my ipod, free internet, great location just off the mag mile which means its close to many attraction, shops bars etc. I honestly can't understand some of the negative feedback, especially when it comes to comparing this hotel to a typical 3*. There is no way this could be viewed as a 3 *, the facilities, standard of room, well trained staff make it so much more than a Ramada, Holiday Inn or any other chain hotel. When booking, remember that this is a boutique hotel, which are in their nature, normally smaller but of a higher standard, offering a more personal service. I also can't understand how anyone can expect to pay less than $100 these days for such a high standard of room in the centre of a city like Chicago! Get real guys.... Opinions are personal and subjective but for what its worth, mine is that you can't really go wrong with The James.

Reviews.Title: “I would try it again...”
Reviews.Author: AM_NYC
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent a weekend at the James and were so excited upon arrival to be upgraded to a suite. It was a very cool room with a media room where we could watch free DVDs provided by the hotel. The products in the bathroom were great - all Kiehls and the beds were super comfortable. The David Burke restaurant at the hotel was outstanding and the concierge pointed us to exactly the perfect spot for breakfast...The only disappointment was the noise on the weekend while the hotel was holding a wedding reception and that the room stunk like smoke. I would definitely give it a another shot though on my next weekend in Chicago based on the location, the price, and the overall experience

Reviews.Title: “Loved The James!”
Reviews.Author: angibr
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience staying at the James. My teenage daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights for some Spring Break fun in Chicago. The staff was wonderful and extremely helpful in getting us walking directions to all of the places we wanted to see. The doorman also gave us great restaurant recommendations. The rooms were cozy and the beds the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel! We stayed on the 8th floor and although the elevators are small they are also very quick. This did not pose a problem at all for us in having to wait long for one. The bar area did get hopping pretty good both nights although since I was with my teenager I didn't get a chance to check it out. I highly recommend the valet parking, it's only $10 more than public parking, you just pull up to the door and they take it from there. I will definitely stay at The James Chicago again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ciabi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the James three times for business. They have always been very accommodating. I find the location convenient to where I need to go and cabbies are familiar with the intersection. The staff is very attentive and helpful. The business center is in the lobby and very sparse, so if you need to make tons of copies of stuff (I did) it's probably not the joint for you. But I love the Kiehls bath products and the beds are very comfortable. The TV's are nice too, as is the room service from the David Burke restaurant in the lobby. The hallways are a bit dark but who really cares about that. I will definitely stay there again. It's worth the price while I'm on business, but if I was staying there on pleasure I might try and find something a little more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: liltexas72
Reviews.Content: I often stay in Chicago for business and sometimes stay at The James. First of all let me start by saying that I subscribe to Dwell Magazine and love all things modern. So as soon as I walked in this hotel I feel in love with the wonderful art and modern layout. When you walk into your room the stark white blends well with the dark and light woods with a flash of red. The bed itself is extremely comfortable. My skincare regime includes many things from the Kiehl's line so I was thrilled to find it being offered in the bathroom. This last time around my flight was canceled so I got to really experience the hotel (usually I'm so busy with work that I only get to see the J Bar and my bed). When I checked back in they upgraded me to a suite. I ordered room service from the restaurant - the steak salad was delicious. The next day I had breakfast - but the $22 price for fruit, english muffin and coffee was a little steep. The gym was great - very clean, with all the latest equipment. The hotel is situated very close to Michigan Ave so it's close to great shopping, restaurants, etc. I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Chicago! It is not a bargain price wise but well worth it if you can afford it or are going on business.

Reviews.Title: “OK for my Hotwire Price, but definately not worth published rates”
Reviews.Author: greggeast
Reviews.Content: I ended up with the James Hotel after doing a "blind" Hotwire hotel purchase. I had researched the listing (via BetterBidding.com) and thought I would receive the Conrad hotel based upon the hotel features and price. After learning that I booked the James, I did online research and was satisfied with the reviews. Our check-in was swift and pleasant. The front desk easily looked up our reservation and provided us with our room keys, then directed us to the elevators. We used the Valet parking, which ended up costing $46 for one night (with in/out privileges). The valet service was fast and courteous. The elevators are exactly what I expected (thanks to Tripadvisor advice). They are TINY (VERY VERY TINY) and somewhat scary (they buzz, rattle, and shake). However, they managed to get us where we were going each time. We ended up with an upper-floor room with a street view. We asked for a king bed, but ended up with doubles. That's no big deal, considering the method of booking. The hotel decor was modern, with interesting artwork in the hallways. The room decor was modern, as well, but with very little artwork. The layout of our room was somewhat awkward/cramped. The room was clean, but you could definately tell there wasn't much attention to details in the renovation. The bathroom was nice, with a window view out of the shower (unusual, but nice). The lighting throughout the room was great, with dimmers on anything and everything. The 42" plasma was nice, but they push analog signals to it, so grainy. The turndown service was nice, with minimuffins on the pillows. The best part of the stay was finding out that they have 2:30 PM checkout! I've never experienced that at a city hotel. It was great, after a long evening out at the clubs. I would stay there again, but only if I paid under $100 for the room. There are better deals in downtown Chicago...

Reviews.Title: “Love The James”
Reviews.Author: teedeeandchelchel
Reviews.Content: We think this hotel is great. My husband and I stayed here two weekends ago and then came back with our two teenagers this past weekend. We think The James is wonderful. First the location is ideal, one block off MIchigan Ave. at Ontario, there are so many great things to do nearby. The hotel is just the right size, big enough to have good amenities, a great bar, restaurant, workout room, but small enough to feel intimate. The staff is wonderfully friendly and accomodating. When they discovered we had returned after staying there two weeks earlier, they were so pleased and really bend over backwards to give us an exceptionally nice room. The rooms are somewhat small, but I think really typical of a downtown metropolitan hotel. The large flat screen TV is very nice. I would recommend this hotel highly and will be sure to stay here again. We found great prices for the James both at Expedia and Orbitz.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every bit of it!”
Reviews.Author: mstrillian
Reviews.Content: The James hotel was beautiful. The only thing negative I could think to mention is the tiny elevator. It only fits a couple people and their luggage comfortably. The room was beautiful and comfortable though. I loved the big screen tv and Kiehl's bath products. The bar was stocked with mini and full sized bottles. I thought that was a neat touch. My MP3 player plugged right up to the speakers. That was great. The bed was super comfortable and the time projected onto the ceiling. That was a nice touch. The slippers were nice too. I was there on business, so I didn't pay for the room and can't speak to the value but I was very impressed with the hotel and the room!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: janerobotnik
Reviews.Content: wow, i can't believe some of the reviews for the james! i've stayed at the james numerous times for business, and it is just wonderful. i love the rooms - they're small and modern - but i like the coziness of them (and love the kiehls products). Also i've found the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. Especially for business travel i'm incredibly picky, and just want everything to go as smooth as possible - and have found the james exactly what i need after the stress of o'hare and far too long business meetings. i would recommend a stay here to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: inspecting
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stay's my wife and I have had for our anniversary. We stayed on the 5th floor studio. It was truly superb. The doormen were the friendliest peole. The bed was very comfortable and the flat sceen tv on the wall was nice. Also the alarm clock projects on ceiling. nice touch. Interior design was very modern yet comfortable. My wife does interior decorating and that's how she described it. I agree. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chris2222
Reviews.Content: The James is a brilliant, super sleek hotel. Excellent rooms, super service, the best location, and very trendy throughout. You will not regret booking this hotel - and if you do do not miss the steak house in the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Glindaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James over a celebratory weekend and chose it over competitors due to its' recent inclusion into the Leading Hotels of the World. Check-in was perfunctory with the clerk adding his congratulations as an afterthought. There were beautiful flowers in the room though as an added gesture. We asked for a DVD player for the room but sadly one could not be installed without some difficulty so we abandoned the idea. On checking with the front desk it transpired we had been allocated an inferior room type so we moved to a junior suite which was extremely comfortable if somewhat minimalist in style. Great bed, shower and views across the city though. Some issues with housekeeping; we had to ASK for the room to be serviced one day, dirty cups and glasses were not removed on another occasion and on returning to the room late one night, the radio was on leading us to believe perhaps a staff member had been enjoying the facilities! Also the room key continued to be problematic during the entire stay leading the front desk staff to "accuse" us of keeping it near a moblie phone which was untrue. Wonderful food at the restaurant but spoiled by the Maitre D's superior attitude. Excellent doormen who were always courteous, informative and fun (much like the rest of the city) and the location could not be better. A "cool" (how I hate that word) very slightly pretentious property which promises more than it actually delivers and the minor caveats really stop it being in the "leading" category. **A note** BEWARE. The staff do not inform you that they "block" $100 per night on your credit card as a guarantee; this can be difficult if you are budgeting.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: funfor4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for a conference and had booked the room thru their website, when called to confirm had us down for only 1 night instead of 4, easily changed. First morning cold,cold shower, didn't complain,next day fine. Phone did not work, called every day to complain, and every day said it would be fixed when got back to room, never was. No dial tone, unable to call restaurant, or call for car or call for room service. Finally, on last night someone came to our room while we were there and did fix it. The hotel is beautiful, rooms great and everyone was so nice, even when I was complaining they were nice. Great gym area also, and love the restaurant. BUT, for the money I could easily find another hotel just as nice with a working phone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: pontoon23
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel from start to finish. We stayed 4 nights in December and from the hot cider and cranberry cookies available in reception every night through to the kiehls bathroom toiletries, heavenly beds and impeccable service we had a great hotel experience. The bathroom was on the smaller side but very well equipped. The room was kept spotless throughout our stay and the cakes and cookies that were delivered with the nightly turn down service were a nice touch. We ordered room service from David Burke's primehouse and the food was delicious and beautifully presented. Breakfast was also good, but we loved the West Egg diner down the street. An early morning checkout was swift and efficient. Overall very satisfying, especially considering the great rate from Expedia. We'll be back as soon as possible !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: sweetylaur
Reviews.Content: One of the WORST hotel experiences I've ever had. First night, they were overbooked and we got sent to another hotel when we got in from the airport after midnight ..... and there was no valet or bell attendant outside ANY time that we drove up during our stay. The next night, they lost our reservation for daughter's room AGAIN and it was another huge hassle with the manager. The next day, they were unable to locate our car through the valet for OVER AN HOUR. They were an unapologetic, unhelpful staff who bordered on rude, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Sexy”
Reviews.Author: thomkat73
Reviews.Content: Ok...I could never afford to stay here on my own but was put up by my company for a quick business trip and I couldn't have been happier. The modern design of this hotel is pure sexiness to the nth degree. A superb example of minimalism with lots of white space. And the bed was sooo comfortable! The staff couldn't have been nicer (and hell, for almost $500 bucks a night they should treat you like a king). The location is pure downtown with great shopping in walking distance. Unfortunately I didn't get to explore but I hope that on my next trip I get the opportunity to stay at this hotel again. (PS: Be sure to check out what the minibar has to offer beyond the booze...too funny).

Reviews.Title: “Above Above average”
Reviews.Author: Honest-George
Reviews.Content: The James is chic cool. The lighting in my room was very sexy. The David Burke restaurant in the hotel is a big plus - never had more steak in one serving. The location is central - near shopping, restaurants and importantly, starbucks. Service was fantastic. Front desk staff helped me fax an important document. Check out was quick. I showered in a bathroom with no convenient space for soap and shampoo while I was under the water. The elevator is compact and was made crowded when people were there for a wedding. Bed was sumptuous and most comfortable. Had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “High price, low quality”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Consultant
Reviews.Content: This hotel had some good reviews in some conference materials for the DMA07 Conference, but having stayed there for ten days I can say it is a place to be avoided. The bathrooom door did not close, a colleague staying in another room had the same problem. The in room television service, with an audio that promoted it as the lastest in hotel convenience, had no visual display. The fixtures in the bathroom were barely attached to the wall and the taps in the bathroom came off the wall while turning on the shower. The architrave air conditioning ducts were not fitted correctly which made the room look unfinished. The quality control in preparing the rooms for guests was absolutely appaling. Overall a poor experience and one I will advise our booking agent not to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: bluesboy34
Reviews.Content: After spending two weeks working in the suburbs I was looking for somewhere comfortable, central and a little more intimate than the chain hotels on Michigan Avenue. I'd stayed at the Marriott and Meridian before and hadn't enjoyed the experience. The hotel is one block west of Michigan Avenue behind the Marriott. A great location to start exploring the city. Check in was a breeze and the hot towels were welcome. Don't come to the hotel for the views. With just 16 floors it's dwarfed by the surrounding properties. Our room was on the 12th floor facing the south. We had a deluxe double room booked through Hotels.com. Over $100/night below the rack rate. Although not a huge room it was very comfortable and the bed was the largest I'd slept in for a while. Great touches like the Kiehl's bath products, free wireless internet, 42" Plasma and iPod equipped stereo. I can't comment on the Bar or Restaraunt as we didn't dine there. One tip....head to West Egg for breakfast - Great food and fantastic value for money. It's just a five minute walk up Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs”
Reviews.Author: fast_kar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nites for a conference. The hotel is a very trendy boutique hotel convenient located near the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Ave). The lobby is pretty small and 1/2 of it is overtaken by an extended bar from Prime, the hotel's steakhouse restaurant (heard some good things about the restaurant). The staff was efficient if not totally friendly. I noticed a tendency for staffers to congregate and felt as if I was intruding on their space when I went to check in/out so felt rather uncomfortable. The room itself is rather small but the clean lines of the decor made most of the room. The bed and the flat-screen TV was nice, and the corner room we stayed in was quiet throughout the night. The Kiehl's bath products were the best, and the housekeeping staff was really friendly with the bed turndown service and cookie(s). Door staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and I went to them to ask questions rather than 'bother' the front desk staff. Was there a concierge there? Didn't notice. Maybe my tastebuds were off but I would not order drinks at the bar. I ordered a G&T which tasted like soda instead of tonic; this could not be fixed so resorted to another drink. Pro: convenient location. Starbucks and Trader Joe's right across. Good eats on the same block or right across. Friendly door staff. Decent mini bar. Con: rooms were pricey and rather small (smaller than NYC hotel rooms). small elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Love The James”
Reviews.Author: maddeline
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at the JAMES for business. the staff is great, they upgraded me to a media loft , with 2 bed and 2 plasmas plus a projector screen. everything is done to make you comfrotable- from the kiehls products to the ipod hook up. the gym is also very big and well organized. I would come back again - and reccomend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “"Shagalicious, baby!"”
Reviews.Author: JLTP
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the James Hotel while attending a conference in Chicago. I received an upgraded room upon checking in, even without requesting one. The room was very nice--straight out of an Austin Powers movie, complete with a shag rug and corner bed/couch with a projection dvd player with surround sound. In fact, the room also included an additonal fairly large flat panel tv in the main area, a smaller one facing the bed (though I couldn't get this one to work) and a small stereo cd unit. Probably not everyone's style, but I thought it was pretty cool. While I was alone, I'd think it would be a great choice for a couple. Service staff (front desk, bellman) were very helpful and courteous. Location is quite good to the Chicago hot spots, but pretty far from McCormick Place, as most of the area's hotels are.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the James!”
Reviews.Author: john_travel21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of little touches that separate it from the mainstream pack of hotels. The blend of style, price, location, available services, and the level of service - really make the James special. Nice sized room, very contemporary feel, awesome mini-bar, dual plasma TVâ€™s, comfy bed, light switches had dimmers, didnâ€™t hear any outside noise. Bellmen/concierge/housekeeping REALLY went out of the way to make me feel welcomed each day. Front desk provided good service, but not as warm. Comp wireless internet in the room, room service was prompt and the food was well above par. Walking distance to Magnificent Mile, John Hancock, Millennium Park, Art Institute of Chicago, Red Line Subway (5 min to China Town, $4 round trip). Ate at Pizza Rio Uno (deep dish pizza) and the West Egg (great breakfast), both in walking distance. Glad I stayed here, will definitely get my repeat business!

Reviews.Title: “Hear Hear”
Reviews.Author: B0bbyQ
Reviews.Content: The person from Minnesota on the previous review summed it all up! This Hotel is so good it feels like home and the staff are your extended family. Any traveller, (originating from outside the US in particular) nervous about staying in a big city, check in at this hotel and you will immediately feel relaxed. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique gem near Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a summer road trip to Chicago and booked the James Hotel on Hotwire.com. We got a great rate, especially for a great boutique hotel right off the Magnificent Mile shopping area. The James was easy to find (I printed out directions from Google Maps) and valet parking is available, although we just self-parked our car next door in the garage to save a few dollars. Check-in was a breeze and the front desk staff were all well-groomed, friendly and helpful. We asked them for breakfast recommendations and they told us about West Egg, just down the street (about 5-6 blocks away). The bellman was extremely helpful and helped me carried all of my bags up to the room while my husband was parking the car. The room was nice, with a flat panel TV with cable, premium Kiehl's toiletries and plush, clean towels. The bed was plush and I love that hotels now use white sheets with a down comforter in between instead of the old style comforter (gross!). Turndown service in the evening also included a bedtime snack (I think it was a cookie of some sort). Housekeeping did a good job of picking things up each day. The best part about this hotel is definitely it's location. It's only about a block away from Michigan Ave and we were able to walk to Navy Pier, Millenium Park and many other attractions. The James Hotel allowed us to vacation in luxury, while keeping within our budget.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cariBrighton
Reviews.Content: stayed at the James for 2 nights after staying at the Palmer House Hilton down the road. There is no comparison, the James is bright, modern and has a real 'buzz' in the foyer and bar area. The staff are professional, friendly and helpful. The best part about the hotel is the bed! Amazingly comfortable with great linen.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! Sweet Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Metcall11
Reviews.Content: Well my boyfriend and I stayed the night at the James Hotel on September 1st, 2007. First impressions weren't very good as the room was not ready when we arrived at around 2:30 pm. So we went for lunch at Pizzeria Due around the corner. We returned around 4pm to find that our room was still not ready. We waited another half an hour until it was finally ready. The desk clerk did apologize and offered us free breakfast for two. The room was amazing. We stayed on the 17th floor with an amazing view of the city. There was a brown spot on the ceiling that wasn't very appealing. Also the bathtub would fill up with water when having a shower. But all around along with the beautiful room and free breakfast it was a great experience. We stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker the next night and it was like night and day. I would highly recommend a stay at the James.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: myboys2010
Reviews.Content: I found a good deal for the James hotel on TravelZoo for $169 a night, and after some searching, found that the James had very good reviews so I decided to book a night's stay for my anniversary (it was a surprise for my husband!) When I booked the stay, I mentioned the date and upon checkin our room was already upgraded to a suite. I am going to keep the review from hereon nice and simple...The James Hotel is AMAZING. Our suite was beautiful (very contemporary), clean, and room service was fantastic. The front desk was extremely accomodating and friendly. The hotel is also right off of Michigan Ave. Whenever we spend the night downtown we will surely stay at the James. Like myself, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Staff caters to your every need!”
Reviews.Author: mtvaletta
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was really impressed with the James. Not only is it centrally located, and a super chic hotel, but the staff really knows how to make your vacation even better. They great you with "welcome back" every time you return from your daily/evening excursions. The bartenders concoct amazing cocktails-the front door man recommended the mojito when I arrived from a disastrous airport situation when I mentioned I needed a drink and he was right! That mojito really hit the spot! The concierge service was the best I have ever had. Esperanza in particular, made suggestions and booked tours and restaurants for me that turned my trip from great vacation into an unbelievable amazing adventure. The fitness center is a great size and is open 24 hours. The rooms in tones of brown and red are spacious, and have that minimalist chic look, but perhaps done to the point where they lack function ability. I hated the bathroom sinks- too wide and flat and therefore do not drain well and they also take up more counter space then needed. However, overall I was pleased with the room. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the mini bar had a great selection of half bottles of liquor and all the bartending equipment to make that famous James bond cocktail! I would definitely recommend this hotel and especially to single travelers that want great service with a hip atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: kellyorc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the James Chicago. The hotel is fabulous, very chic and chilled. The service is beyond compare. Check in and out were swift and painless. The Concierge service is also super efficient having located an excellent hair salon and a couple of fab restaurants for us during our stay. The hotel restaurant itself is rated 5 in the top 10 in Chicago - voted by Chicago residents. We stayed on the 14th floor with great views of the city. The room (a deluxe king) was equipped with a great selection of cocktail making lovelies, hairdryer, safe, tv, robes & slippers, a very interesting selection of minibar items (one of which was a real surprise!) including crisps/snacks a first aid kit and an umbrella! We also had a spotless and elegant bathroom with Kiehls products and a cosy little dining area. The ipod dock/CD/radio and complimentary chillout CD were a nice touch and husband liked the enormous plasma tv. The super comfy bed ensured a good snooze and complimentary WiFi allowed us to plan our next day's activities from our bedroom. We were so busy touring around the city we didn't get an opportunity to use the gym or the spa - both of which looked fab. The bar/lobby area is a haven of civilised tranquility with smooth music playing in the background to help you chillout that bit more. Staff are attentive without being fussy and a good selection of drinks and bar snacks are available. The barman mixes a mean mohito ! This hotel is full of nice little thoughtful touches to make people feel welcomed and cared for e.g. The Virtual Tuck In service - basically a couple of PCs with webcams to allow people to say goodnight to their children when they're away from home on business. Also the dog biscuits and water outside the front door for our furry friends. Next visit to Chicago I'll definitely be staying here and wouldn't even consider an alternative if The James can maintain these standards.

Reviews.Title: “A Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dannan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the James, and I must say, this is one of our new favorites (we are excited that they will soon be opening another in NY). The location is within walking distance to everything - dining, shopping, the subway, etc. We stayed in an upper floor room (#1518), far away from any elevator noise and foot traffic. The room was spacious and clean, and yes, the bed was by far the best we had ever slept on. The bathroom was great and large - we had no problem with the sink set-up, and the Kiehl's products were a plus, and were constantly replenished when needed. I cannot say enough how friendly the staff was - the front desk staff, the bellmen, and especially Bill and Esperanza at the Concierge desk....they both made some excellent recommendations. The twice daily maid service and turndown was a treat. Robes and slippers were laid out, lights were dimmed, fresh ice was delivered, and a wonderful cookie was left behind (the TV was also turned to a funky black/white channel that portrayed a various figures in comical scenes - a nice touch when you return to your room). I also appreciated all of the reading selections located in the front desk area (I love to read) - various local magazines were available for purchase (great for tourists), but they also had an abundance of complimentary newspapers that you could take up to your room as well...the NY Times, Wall Street Journal, Chicago Tribune, etc. The USA Today was delivered daily. I visited the gym one morning and was very impressed. Abundant and quality equipment and a very clean room. TV's were on the cardio equipment, and they had disposable earbuds for you to use. Definitely the best hotel gym I have seen in my many hotel stays. My partner and I indulged in room service one night from David Burke's Primehouse. It was delivered as promised within 45 minutes, piping hot. We had filet on the bone, hashbrowns, sauteed mushrooms, and the beef BBQ/lobster dumplings - all was wonderful! We also had the incredible crab cake wrapped in a pretzel down in the lobby bar one night - this is a must try dish! WOW...We also went to the J Bar one evening - completely underdressed. However, the drinks were great, and the staff was very friendly.....Try the James martini! Anyhow, our experience was fantastic, and I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good sexy leisure hotel. Less great for business.”
Reviews.Author: skimeld
Reviews.Content: Nice big sexy 'boutique'-style rooms. Modern. Lovely bed. Great food. But it's a hotel definitely geared-up to leisure travel, not business. Wireless internet 'throughout' the hotel was very slow, sometimes non-existent. And rooms had no desks, just interesting (though rather useless) pieces of designer furniture. I'd definitely take my wife here for a fun getaway. I definitely wouldn't stay here again on business. Also a word of warning - the restaurant next door (not associated with the hotel, but an 'obvious' choice if you're looking for something local) - Su Casa mexican restaurant - was THE worst mexican I think I have ever tasted. Sloppy, tasteless, heavily fried. Oh dear. Should have stayed with the hotel food. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel/ great location/ great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ughCharleston
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms/ two adults and four kids. We requested the rooms close together and hotel was accommodating. Very clean, nice service, great location. The bellmen were fantastic, and the concierge service was very knowledgeable. The rooms were clean and stylish, ( LOVED the Kiehl's products), the restaurant was just right. All in all, a wonderful experience. One note: if you are sensitive to night-time noises, request a room on the quiet side of the building. Otherwise, a totally positive experience and we would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Needs a little more effort.”
Reviews.Author: RichardS_7
Reviews.Content: Over all, the James Chicago is a very nice hotel. It is a trendy hotel with mostly young business men and women that stay here. While it has a lot of nice features such as large flat-screen TVâ€™s and great linens and towels, it is missing a few of the soft touches you normally find at hotels of this caliber. The elevators are slow, small and noisy. We often had to wait for two or three elevator cars to arrive because only about five people at a time can fit. They are dirty and not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. The hotel has no ice makers. If you want ice, you need to call the front desk, wait 30 minutes, and then tip the person that brings the ice to your room. There is no free coffee or free breakfast or free water. A pot of coffee (4 cups) will cost you $14.00 ($7.00 plus 12% hotel tax, plus $3.50 delivery charge, plus 18% built-in gratuity, plus the additional tip they want you to give). The front desk staff tends to cluster and when approached they give you the feeling that you are annoying them. The walls are thin. When the rooms on either side of you get a wake-up call, thatâ€™s your wake-up call too! Street noise is very loud â€“ even on the 16th floor. The hotel tries so hard to be trendy that it often sacrifices functionality. For example, the bathroom sink is a trendy square, flat sink. The faucet is a standard low faucet that makes the distance between the faucet and sink stopper only about 4 inches. It makes it very difficult to wash your hands under the running water. For this same reason, you cannot fill a tall glass of water. The trendy boutique closet is in the bathroom. When the bathroom door is closed, the main room has no access to a mirror or clothes. This makes it slower for two or more people to get ready at the same time. The bathroom sliding-door has a frosted glass window. This is not a problem for one person but for two people, it is a huge annoyance. You CANNOT turn the light on in the bathroom without lighting up the bedroom as well. Also, the light switch for the bathroom is in the bedroom -- so if you are in the bathroom and then want to adjust the light or fan, you need to open the sliding door (all the way) and go in to the bedroom to adjust the bathroom light. ON THE PLUS SIDE: The rooms have plenty of electrical outlets. My wife and I both have our laptops cell phone and IPods plugged in and we have outlets to spare. The hotel is in a great location to the best shopping and restaurants in Chicago. The artwork in the rooms is beautiful. There is plenty of storage in the rooms for your suit cases and belongings. The gym at the hotel is one of the best I have seen. OVERALL: I would give this hotel 4 out of 5 stars. It is very nice, but not as nice as the Amalfi â€“ the nearest similar hotel. The James is very nice, but does not make that extra effort that separates the good hotels from the great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: George16
Reviews.Content: All of the good reviews about The James are true. I just returned from a 2 night stay. We had 2 rooms with double beds. We loved the whole place. The beds are as good as everyone says, beautiful bathroom, very clean. Great location, had breakfast in the hotel restaurant that was very good. Staff is friendly and helpful. I do not think you will be disappointed in this hotel. Will stay there again and in other citites once they open. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the James”
Reviews.Author: sivysavy
Reviews.Content: The James was a great choice by Hotwire, at first I was a little bit skeptical, but it worked out great. It's a block away from Michigan Ave where you can do all your shopping. It's also a couple blocks away from great eateries, like Uno Pizzeria, Portillos, and Giordano's. There is a movie theater located right down the street as well. It's about two blocks away from the red line. The staff was very friendly. The lady checking us in was very friendly, I arrived early in the morning, and she let me check into the room. The concierge was very helpful on where to go. The housekeeping ladies always greeted us in the morning and the doorman showed us where the nearest dunkin donuts could be found. There is a trader joe's and a starbucks right across the street. The beds are very comfortable and the room was very modern. For someone who has never been in Chicago before, this experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “The James was great!”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanChicago
Reviews.Content: I am a traveler who expects a lot from hotels and I am happy to say that the James not only met, but exceeded by expectations. The James is a very trendy hotel from the lobby down to the art work in the rooms. Even if you don't like the trendy scene, though, the James's staff will impress you. I made my reservation online and made a note that I was going to be getting engaged during my stay. When I contacted the hotel later about an early check-in, I spoke with a member of the hotel staff who, after looking up my reservation, offered to send up extra amenities to my room in light of the fact that I was getting engaged. Also, when I went to check-in, I was told that I was given a complimentary upgrade to a suite in light of the special occasion. While I certainly can't guarantee that the hotel will always make such accomodations, my experience at the James tells me that it is a hotel that is committed to its guests feeling welcome and happy to be there. I will definitely return. As for some specifics about the hotel, the fitness center is large and very well-equipped, the hotel is ideally located just off Michigan Avenue, and the hotel's bar is excellent. Parking is a little pricy and it's tough to find a low room rate, but overall, the James is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique swanky”
Reviews.Author: Geepers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the James in June, and I must say, it felt like I was in some ultra-swanky boutqiue hotel. From the uniforms of the staff.. which consists of a small J pin that they wear with nice suits and such, to the wonderful, comfortable beds, the James just makes you feel ultra-relaxed. The gym in the hotel was fantastic for a hotel gym, and the machines were all new and in fantastic condition. I really enjoyed the complimentary Kiehl's products as well as the soft, cushy beds with futons. Location-wise, it's just off Michigan ave, and it's close to all the shops and restaurants. I'd definitely stay here if I'm' ever back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: fellfromgrace
Reviews.Content: Words can't express how much I love this hotel!!!! I stayed here for two nights in April for a Placebo concert at the HOB, and I couldn't have picked a better hotel. I've had an awful time finding a hotel in Chicago that will rent a room to someone under 21. Even tried booking a room at the four seasons and that was a no-go (I'm 20). Apparently they'll only take your money if you're 21. Who knows? Anyway, I digress... I stumbled across the james through travelzoo and decided to give it ago. From the moment I got out of the cab I was treated like royality. The doorman was wonderful, I loved the water and treats he had set out for dogs passing by. Nice touch. The front desk staff couldn't have been more welcoming and kind. It was the first time someone asked me how my flight was and I actually believed they cared. On to the room--Fantastic! The beds are out of this world, so comfy! The plasma tv, ipod dock, and snacks were a nice touch. I loved the alarm clock that projected the time on to the ceiling. The turndown service was nice as well. Bathroom--My room didn't have tub. I thought that was a bit odd, but I didn't miss it. I liked the fact that there was a window in the shower so I could look out while I was in there. pretty nifty. The kiehls bath products were a nice touch. Location--the couldn't be beat. A block and a half from Michigan ave, a starbucks on the block, the el stop like four blocks away. I even walked to the HOB that night for the show, but took a cab back (3$). I can't imagine staying anywhere else in chicago ever, ever again. I've stayed at some of the best hotels in the world (The Savoy in London & The George The V in Paris to name a few) and I was more impressed with the service, people, rooms, location ect of the james.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The James”
Reviews.Author: jennacwatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June and loved it! The beds are now referred to as 'the most comfortable beds in the world!' I think there were about 8 pillows or something, it makes our bed at home now seem a little inadequate! The hotel is in a great location, right on the magnificent mile and close to the Hancock tower, Water Tower Place and some excellent restaurants. The concierge could not have been more helpful and recommended these restaurants while we were there - Quartino ( a fantastic Italian close to the hotel, great atmosphere and excellent food) and Blue Water Grill ( which had an excellent sushi selection, we also received a complimentary glass of champagne on arrival because we were staying at The James, which was rather nice! ) This place also had a great atmosphere and was really busy... Also I would stongly recommend going up thr Hancock tower at night for the breathtaking views and delicious cocktails. The hotel bar and the J bar also served great drinks and seemed to attract a large crowd. I also used their spa while I was there - it was great. My partner also used the gym while he was there and said that it was brilliant. The bathroom was great, also liked the Kiehls products and the water pressure was excellent in the shower. Overall, there was nothing to dislike about The James, I would not consider staing anywhere else in Chicago, this place could not meet your needs more.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, wonderful and well located”
Reviews.Author: RSBJGB
Reviews.Content: The James offers many strong points making it an excellent choice for a centrally located hotel. As for location, its right at the intersection of Ontario and Rush - very close to great bars/restaurants and two short blocks off Michigan Ave. While some nice properties are right on Michigan Ave,, I think its preferrable to be close, but just off of it for diminished noise and traffic. The hotel itself has a unique, comtempory design, which carries from the lobby into the rooms. Style preferrence is a personal thing, but if you lean toward the less traditional, you'll enjoy the look of the James. I was fortunate to have an upgraded room, which landed me in a suite on the top floor. Not much of a view, but the room was very spacious, contained 2 couches, had 2 flat screen tvs, very comfortable king bed, well stocked bar, and a bathroom complete with Kiehl's products. Not bad! Service at the counter and door was prompt, professional and friendly. Maid service was well done and included turn down service. Another plus is the fitness center which rivals many stand alone gyms for equipment selection and quality. I only have two minor criticisms to offer. One, the hotel is an older building and there are a few worn spots in the common areas that should be touched up. Second, and this is very minor, there is not gift shop in the hotel, so if you need toiletries or a bottle of water, you'll need to go across the street. My recommending of the hotel is enhanced by the relative value it offers. Considering the location and amenities, I think its hard to beat, especially if you compare the cost of elite Chicago hotels such as the Park Hyatt, Peninsula, or Four Seasons. For a quick business trip or a fun weekend, the James should deliver what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Love The James!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmarsh99
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay at The James and absolutely loved it. I received an excellent rate from Hotwire.com for $129 a night, rooms usually go for about $299 a night. The James is centrally located next to Michigan Avenue with tons of restaurants and shopping close by. They charge about $35 a night for parking but that is expected in downtown Chicago. The decor of the hotel is trendy yet comfortable. Our room was on the 11th floor - not much of a view just the street below. The beds are fantastic - so comfortable! My only complaint is the street noise was loud from our room - people honking all hours of the night. Friends who also stayed in the hotel with us did not have this problem in their room, I think one of our windows must have had a gap in it. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed I have EVER slept in!!!”
Reviews.Author: miamimerger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel on Hotwire and got an amazing deal!! We stayed at the James from July 13-July 15 and could not have been more impressed! First off, we saved about $250/night by booking with hotwire and we weren't sure what to expect but the hotel website displays the hotel rooms to the tiniest detail! Our check in was a breeze...we were worried about getting bumped to another hotel (this has happened to us when we booked with hotwire previously and the property was sold out) but I called the night before to confirm. Our room was incredible! My only complaint was we were put in a corner room on a lower floor with very little view and a handicap accessible room so I don't know if all the rooms looked like ours or not. I am guessing that's where they put their guests that don't pay close to full price for a room. We didn't mind too much because we didn't spend too much time in the room. The bed was a king and was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in....better than my own!! They have a featherbed on the mattress, down comforter, feather pillows (5 on the bed), an Ipod station/mp3 player, a HUGE 50" plasma TV, closet, full length mirror, electronic safe, iron/board, hairdryer, very modern furniture. The bathroom was completely tiled and had a huge sink. Only complaint here was little room to lay anything down, hardly any counter space. They provided robes, slippers, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, shower gel, q-tips and cotton balls. We had very quick housekeeping in the am and had nightly turndown service with "mood lighting" (all the lights are on dimmers) and treats on our pillows with the music turned on! The shower was enormous, easily fits two people with a handheld nozzle (no tub). Bath towels were very soft and extremely large!! My husband and I went to the gym on our first morning there...incredible!!!! The treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes all had flat screen tv's attached to them with personal remotes and headphones. They had a large variety of new state-of-the-art weight machines with racks of free weights, multiple swiss balls and even BOSU trainers with mirrored walls throughout in addition to fresh towels and pitchers of ice water with sliced oranges and lemons in the bottom as well as a personal trainer wandering around. We didn't get a chance to try out the spa, but it looked amazing also! The J Bar was smaller than what I expected and never was very crowded, but definitely had that "lounge" feel to it with comfortable seating and candlelight. The concierge gave us great recommendations for dining and even gave us business cards to give the hostess if there was a wait to get us "moved up on the list". We never had a wait, so we didn't get to use them. Check out wasn't until 2 pm, so that was nice also and the front desk tagged and stored our luggage for us while we spent Sunday in the city! My only complaint would be that the valet cost was $42/night, but it's Chicago! It's probably that much anywhere and they were very prompt and courteous. Would I choose the James again???? ABSOLUTELY!!!!! I don't know if I would pay $400/night to stay there, but if you want to try your luck that you will be placed there, I would try hotwire. What a great deal for the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in the U.S. (I have stayed previously at Hilton, Wyndham, Marriott, Crowne Plaza, etc)

Reviews.Title: “i love james”
Reviews.Author: dessert1st
Reviews.Content: I love James! No, heâ€™s not a man, itâ€™s a hotel, the James. Donâ€™t you hate people who think that their doctor is the best doctor, their hair stylist is the only one to go to, or their trainer is the only one who could possibly keep you looking as good as they do? (I donâ€™t have a trainer by the way, not that Iâ€™m against them.) Well, my hotel is really the best hotel and the rest of you who hold different opinions are wrong, wrong, wrong! My daughter and I just stayed at the James Hotel in Chicago. I found it on hotels.com, liked the description and the pictures. It looked hip and modern, the price and location were right. For $203 a night, I had one of the best hotel experiences of my life. Granted, Iâ€™m not a world traveler and Iâ€™m sort of cheap when it comes to hotels. The hotel impressed me before I landed at Oâ€™hare. I called to say I would be arriving in Chicago at 11 a.m. and was wondering if I could check in early. A charming staff person told me the hotel would do its best to get us into our room early. The hotel did not disappoint. They sent us up to a room on the 4th floor, which, actually was not ready. We returned to the front desk. The staff was very apologetic. We remained our charming selves. They offered us a suite on the 14th floor. â€œAn upgradeâ€�, I asked, â€œat no additional charge?â€� Thatâ€™s what they did for us. We went up the elevator again, this time, feeling a glowing benevolence for all our surroundings. We examined the lobby, this is no ordinary minimalist box. The James has a sense of style that would make Ian Schraeger want to rethink the Delano. Start with the cool signage, visible from far away for those of us who are directionally challenged, pass the cute doorman, notice the stainless steel water bowl for dogs and the giant canister of dog bones before you enter the lobby. Once inside, even the coolest among us, will grin. The floor to ceiling windows fronting the street let the natural light shine in on the comfortable furnishings, terrazzo floor and warm wood front desk. There are book shelves filled with design books and newspapers. This is a lobby I would actually sit in. Hotel chains everywhere should try to steal the Jamesâ€™s curator. Do hotels have curators? The art collection is fabulous. If youâ€™re dumb enough to come to Chicago and not stay at the James, at least check out the art. An installation in the lobby by Joel Ross of 50 vintage suitcases, filled with the dismantled contents of an entire motel room should not be missed. Everywhere else you look has some sort of interesting mural or photograph. The hotel rooms also have original photographs. No boring recycled stuff here. Our suite was beautifully furnished. The designer actually considered how guests would use the space. The bathroom was immaculate, beautiful and conveniently set up, one of the few hotel bathrooms that had decent light and space to put your stuff. Finally someone had the sense to put a towel bar and shelf under the sink and even remembered to put a ledge above the sink for your toothbrush, lens case, etc. I appreciated every moment I spent standing on the cool matte brown tiles and washing up at the marble vanity with the stylish square sink. The room had a sitting area with a flat screen tv, a modernist couch that would certainly sleep a kid, a Bertoia chair and a Saarinen style coffee table. Everything fit perfectly to make a cozy spot. The suite also had a bar area with martini glasses, a stainless steel ice bucket, small sink, refrigerator, coffee maker and of course, a mini bar. Iâ€™m never tempted by a mini bar, it goes back to the cheap thing. The bed and bedding may have been the best part. The James had the best bed Iâ€™ve ever slept in. The mattress was firm, even though it had one of those pillow top things that I usually hate. The pillows were also not too hard and not too soft. The designer cleverly outfitted the room with a bench with drawers, so there is both seating and storage next to the bed. Even the clock projects on to the ceiling so you donâ€™t have to lift your head to check the time. I need to get one of those to truly improve the quality of my life. Sorry I know I sound like a crazy fan, but I just canâ€™t help myself. Loved the white waffle weave robes & the red slippers. The red & white theme extended to the crisp white stationary & the freshly sharpened red pencil. Did I mention that I love red? I even loved the closet because it had cool red wood hangers. Is there nothing these people donâ€™t think of? Oh, and one more thing, when I asked if I could get a late check out time, the front desk guy smiled broadly and said check out time is at 2 p.m. So who needs late check out time at the James? I didnâ€™t examine the gym or the spa, nor did I eat dinner in the restaurant. But, we did eat breakfast there and I do need to rave about it. Itâ€™s called David Burkeâ€™s Primehouse, so I was amazed that a place that seems like a steakhouse could do breakfast so well. I ate a blueberry muffin that was large & can only be described as wall to wall blueberries. The waiter brought the coffee to the table in a carafe, which means so much to me, since I like my coffee burning hot and only like a half a cup at a time, so it doesnâ€™t cool off too much. Do I sound spoiled and picky? Iâ€™m really not, just particular when it comes to food and coffee. My daughter ordered boring oatmeal that came with beautiful berries. She loved it. While we were waiting for our food, something called orange slushy appeared, complimentary, of course, because the chef knows â€œhow hot it is out.â€� After I raved to the waiter about my muffin, he insisted that we try a sample of something off the dinner dessert menu. He brought an artfully presented dessert that lived up to itâ€™s stylish presentation. Have you ever heard of cheesecake lollipops? Three arrived in different flavors; peanut butter, white chocolate raspberry and some kind of crispy, nutty flavor. Oh, there was strawberry mousse on the plate too. I have been dreaming and salivating about that dessert since. So, I want all the world to know, that I love the James! Now, I just have to convince my husband that only dumb tourists, who donâ€™t know any better, stay at the Four Seasons. Note: The James will be opening in New York City and Miami Beach. Canâ€™t wait to stay at the NYC James. Just wonder if the staff can possibly be as delightful and unjaded there as they are in Chicago. The James Hotel is located 55 E. Ontario. The phone number is [--] Believe it or not, no one paid me to write this.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: rez_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the James for our anniversary on July 6-8. Upon checking in the staff upgraded us to a suite because of our anniversary. Rooms were very clean, we had two flat screen tv's in ours. Staff was very friendly and helpful and offered us some great advice on things to do, places to eat, etc. Can't recommend the James enough. Bed was unbelievable...probably the two best nights of sleep i have had in years!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the James!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: melliewags22
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with 3 of my best girlfriends recently. Things we loved about the James: 1. Location.....couldn't be any better for easy access to shopping, dining and nightlife. 2. Service....by far the friendliest hotel staff I have ever encountered. 3. Decor.....eclectic and energetic. very hip!!!! 4. THE BED.....omg, they were heavenly!!!!!! 5. Products.....the Kiehl's products were awesome.....i found a new favorite shampoo. Things that you need to know: There are no vending machines in the hotel and the closet place to get a soda is a few blocks away. They bring you ice at turndown, but you'll have to call downstairs if you need more. Trader Joe's is across the street, but they don't have softdrinks.....they do have organic snacks and a good wine selection.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: pdsagent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the James over Memorial Day weekend. We looked forward to getting away without our two young children for a nice quiet weekend alone. Upon arrival, they did not have our reservation that we had booked through Orbitz. Luckily, I had our confrimation printout and number. Nevertheless, they had to wait for Orbitz to fax over confirmation before giving us our room. Due to the inconvenience, they upgraded our room which was nice. I rooms were not very impressive, especially the bathrooms. I definitely expected more after what I had read. We used the valet service to park our car for the 3 nights we stayed. Upon departing, we realized that we had a substantial ding in our driver's side door. After contacting the James directly, they passed the buck by telling us that it was an independent company that handles their valet service. We have been getting the run around from both parties for weeks now. In conclusion, I would not recommend staying at the James under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the bed!”
Reviews.Author: donnyshawn
Reviews.Content: First off, if you're tired and looking for a comfortable bed, this is the place to stay. The bed is a deep pillow-top mattress and the pillows are nice and fluffy - one of the most comfortable nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. That being said, I found the James an interesting mix of over and underachievement. The rooms are nice looking and have very contemporary furniture. The HD screens are a nice touch and the staff is very friendly and helpful. However, we were on the top floor and the air conditioning couldn't keep up - the room was a bit warm and the outside temp was only the low 80's. Despite the contemporary look, the furniture is uncomfortable. In the bathroom, they have high-end soaps and lotions, but about the cheapest, roughest facial tissue and toilet paper possible, and in our room the overhead shower dripped, so it was more annoying than enjoyable. Overall, a nice place to stay in a great area - and you will get a good night's sleep. But if you're paying close to rack rate, it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: msoma97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the James Hotel for NeoCon and really loved it. The room decor was great, hotel room was clean, and nice turn down service. The hotel offers a business area with computers. Great bar and lounge area. They are two blocks off Michigan Ave. Plan on staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little boutique hotel...but beware of the city taxes”
Reviews.Author: keithwesterberg
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, perfectly situated for cruising Michigan Avenue. On a scale where boutique hotels like the Mondrian, the Delano or the Royalton are a 5 (practically perfect) then this would be a high 4. Staff was very accomodating and friendly. Rooms had some nice touches. Decor was beautiful and contemporary. Linens were great. (There was of course the usual $4 cans of coke and $10 bag of cashews, but you can steer clear of those). Water presuure was very very low on the evening we arrived. Called the front desk and the operator was willing to send someone up to check it. However it was clearly a system wide water supply problem, so we declined. By morning the water presuure was back to normal. Be forewarned. If you park a car there and once they add the city taxes to the bill the cost per night will be $100 more than the quoted rate. So our $340 room ended up being $440. Was it a $400 hotel? Probably not...but it's hard to find something much better in Chicago. That's life in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TorG
Reviews.Content: The James Chicago is another version of the Ian Schrager-style of minimalist chc over substance (a lighter version of The Royalton in NYC). In sum, an old property has been redone with some interesting touches, but still showing its age and old bones. The location, however, is nice and the rooms are bigger than most of Schrager's places, although the bathroom in my room was on the small side. I didn;t have any problems with room noise, but it was slow when I was there. Largest inconvenience for the business traveller was there was no desk in the room. Under $200 or for more than 40% below the Park Hyatt or Peninsula, and the James will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleBrandy
Reviews.Content: it's in a great location - just a few blocks off the State & Grand stop on the Red Line. There is a Starbucks and Trader Joe's across the street, and plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance. When we checked in, we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a studio room, which was fantastic. We had a small living room area, with a plasma TV & a mini-bar, and also small bottles of alcohol. Not cheap, but about the same as what you'd pay for any other mini-bar. They had a good selection. The room was fantastic - previous descriptions are accurate so I won't repeat them. We had drinks in the bar both nights - again, not cheap, but they make an AWESOME mojito. Also - when we were there, over Memorial Day weekend, both elevators are operational. This place was fantastic. We got a great deal on it through Hotwire, but we'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Davooda
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at The James on business a month prior, but brought Mrs. Davooda to celebrate my 44th birthday in the city in late May. We had a loft room (821) which I highly recommend though there is no view. Our rate was $299 for the first night and $269 the next two nights - we booked via the hotel but requested the TravelZoo rate. In a loft room you can bring your own movies to play on the projector (yes, your own projector TV with a Bose 5.1 surround system) or the front desk has a bunch from which you can choose. Check in: I had a difficult check-in and it had me wondering if I had made a mistake. Lisa from the front desk handled it well, though, (the room they gave me had no projector) and her manager offered to upgrade me to one of their executive apartments. I declined, though, as I really wanted the projector. When we bring the Davooda-offspring we will book an apartment. Concierge: Some of the best we've seen in Chicago and we've stayed at all the four-stars and some of the five-stars. Laura got us on the guest list at The Underground, Billy Dec's new club, and we had a great time - even had a hosted bar with free vodka drinks! Room service: we dined in our room twice and both times the delivery was on time and service was perfect. Even at 2:30 am the burger tasted like it had just come off the wood-fired grill! Worth the extra cost (though we had a 20% discount from TravelZoo) Bath: A walk-in shower, huge towels, and Kiehl's (I think) bath products make it a winner. Bed: huge and comfy - though kinda warm. Had to keep the AC cranked overnight Media - two plasma TV's in addition to the projector, CD/radio with IPOD dock Housekeeping: turndown service around 6pm with a cookie was nice, and they give you all the ice you want (we travel with our own cooler so that's a plus) The Lobby Bar: good service, they make a good Manhattan and play this awesome world music that is very relaxing. Primehouse - did not dine here this time but had a great breakfast on the business trip JBar - We walked in and out - not much going on Saturday at midnight but, then again, it was Memorial Day weekend and Chicagoans typically leave town Location: Couldn't be better. Trader Joe's right across the street for in-room noshing or a nice bottle of wine. Pizzeria Due - one of Chicago's best is one block west. (((TIP: Walk to Due's and order your pizza for pickup later. There is really no atmosphere at Due's and it's always packed, so pickup your pizza, asking them to cut the pizza and give you plastic plates and utensils, and enjoy it with a bottle of wine from Trader Joe's while watching a move in your room))) Michigan Avenue shopping is just one block east and Rush Street nightlife begins right outside the east door of The James. Bloomie's Home Store one block east. Our favorite thing: The attentive staff is very friendly and professional. We felt like "big-shots" the whole time. The Davoodas will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially at this rate”
Reviews.Author: Rocco46
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed the James Hotel, especially since I got a rate of $169 through TravelZoo for a Deluxe Queen room. Check in was very quick and very professional. I had a room on the 16th floor, facing Ontario Street. I never, however, heard any street noise, or any noise, really. The room was very quiet. The room was very large, with room for a large chair and ottoman and a small table and bench/sofa, in addition to the queen size. bed. The decor was white, white, with more white, which I wasn't totally crazy about, but it wasn't too distracting. Free wi-fi everywhere in the hotel, and the room had an ipod docking station, or whatever those things are called... There was a very well stocked mini bar, as well as full bottles and a cocktail shaker for fixing more than one or two drinks. The bed was very, very comfortable, the TV was great, and the clock in the room was one of the kind that projects the time on the ceiling. Turn down service provided a cookie and placed the robe and slippers on the bed. There is a steakhouse in the hotel that serves breakfast and lunch as well as dinner. I didn't have the opportunity to dine there, but it was always very crowded. Check elsewhere for reviews. The location is two blocks west of Michigan Avenue and all its shopping. A few blocks farther east is Lake Michigan; great for a walk during warmer months (not so much in the middle of winter). The famous Pizzeria Due is down the street, and Trader Joe's is across the street if you want to pick up some things to have in the room to munch on. All in all, a great stay! I would definitely return, and highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Darned Interesting place”
Reviews.Author: SGU-BOUND
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate through Travel Zoo after seeing tons of good press on this place. It's a little pretentious, but interesting. The more I think about it, the more I like it. They upgraded us to a suite since it was a birthday trip and even had special treats in the room for us. When I wrote afterwards to thank them and ask for the recipe, they emailed the recipe and then mailed a big box of goodies to my home. LOVELY customer service. Only problem is that one elevator was down and the wait time was long, but not a crisis. The location is terrific for MagMile shopping and eating and Trader Joe's is right across the street to grab some fresh things to munch on. We generally stay at the Conrad and it has more of a gracious vibe to it, but this was fun for a change. It seemed the folks sitting in the lobby were all young and beautiful and very hip, but the rooms were fun; check out the mini-bar, it's a hoot.
